Jeu, es una persona que ha luchado por tener una fuente de ingresos con la que puede suplir las necesidades personales y familiares, su negocio consiste en cultivar la tierra, criar ganado y atender una venta de bebidas, cuando ayudaba a sus padres aprendió los trabajos de agricultura, con el paso del tiempo ha fortalecido sus conocimientos y su negocio, anteriormente tenía un molino nixtamal, el cual vendió y utilizo los fondos obtenidos para instalar una tienda en su vivienda; vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos, todos trabajan juntos para salir adelante.
Comprará novillos, que posteriormente piensa venderlos convertidos en bueyes e invertirá en mercaría para la tienda, fortalecerá la crianza de ganado, diversificara los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, tales como aceite, jabón, arroz, golosinas, etc., la esperanza de Jeu es incrementar sus ingresos que serán de mucha ayuda para cubrir sus obligaciones.
Sus sueños son lograr instalar una pupusería, fortalecer la tienda, continuar trabajando en la agricultura y cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Jeu is a person who has fought to have a source of income that will supply him with the necessities for himself and his family.  His business consists of cultivating the land, raising cattle, and tending to his drink sales.  When he helped his parents, he learned how to do agricultural work.  Over time, he has strengthened his knowledge and his business.  He previously had a corn mill, which he sold.  He used the funds he obtained to set up a store in his house.  He lives with his wife and two children.  They all work together to move forward in life.

He will purchase young bulls that he later intends to sell as mature bulls to invest in merchandise for his store.  He will also strengthen his livestock raising and diversify the products that he offers his clients, such as soap, corn, candy, etc.  His hope is to increase his income, which will help him greatly in covering his financial obligations.  His dreams are to set up a pupusería [a shop that sells pupusas, or tortillas stuffed with cheese and other ingredients], to strengthen his store, to continue working in agriculture, and to change his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls that he later intends to sell as mature bulls to invest in merchandise for his store

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es:
Ramiro con 53 años de edad es casado y padre de un hijo. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee cultivos de flores y complementa con la producción de leche, de algunas vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de flores, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de El Carmen De Viboral, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Ramiro es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de una sala de empaque para sus flores con el fin de continuar con la venta de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones y muy bien presentada; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y la de su hijo, al cual le podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tenga un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Santos is a 36 year old man. He lives in a community of Solola with his beautiful family.

Santos is a man who loves to work in agriculture. He grows a variety of vegetables. He is very thankful for the first loan he obtained since with that loan he improved the upkeep of his farm, achieved good harvests and sold them at a good price.

Santos is now requesting a second loan that will serve him to invest in growing carrots as well as buying the supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. Santos says that the loans have helped to improve his crops because all of the supplies are within reach and he applies them on the date indicated. 

Santos’ dream is to further obtain better income and profits.

loans.use: to plant carrots and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn seeds to grow corn and increase corn production

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 40 years old. She lives in the small village of Ganmukhuri, Zugdidi district with her husband and 13-year-old son. Inga and her husband are very hardworking people. They are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 3 cows and land where they grow 500 nut trees. Inga milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell, as well as to use in her family. They also sell the harvested nuts seasonally. 
They have a small building in their yard where they are going to open a small shop. Inga needs money to purchase products, such as sugar, flour and so on, to establish a market. 
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 2000. Once the shop is open, Inga will work there with her husband and they will do their best to generate more income. Inga plans to improve her living conditions with increased income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a small market in her yard and to generate more income

loans.name: Edith Noemy

texts.es:
Edith, de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de 4 hijos.

Edith, desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de pupusas, gracias a este pequeño negocio, ha podido mantener a sus dos hijas de 23 y 21 años de edad y sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años. 
 
Edith, tiene el negocio a 25 kilómetros de su vivienda, esto implica que tiene que tiene que levantarse temprano, de lunes a viernes, para poder darles un buen servicio a sus cliente.

Edith, utilizará el dinero del préstamo para gastos médicos y la compra de medicamentos para ella. 

Edith, sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener mayor seguridad y que sus hijos continúen en la universidad.
texts.en:
Edith is 42 years old. She studied through high school. She is a single mother to 4 children. 

Edith has been making pupusas for more than 17 years. Thanks to this small business, she has been able to provide for her two daughters, who are 23 and 21 years old, and her two sons, who are 19 and 17 years old. 

Edith’s business is located 25 kilometers from her house. This means she has to get up early, Monday through Friday, in order to provide good service to her customers. 

Edith will use the money from the loan for medical expenses and to buy medications for herself. 

Edith dreams of improving her house so it will be safer, and that her children will continue their educations at university.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses and to buy medications for herself.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is married with four children. They live in a seven bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. 

She has faced many problems in life, including, sickness, the death of her junior senior, and no money for education. It will actively help the community by supplying them basic needs at reduced prices, reducing their traveling distances to the market.
 
With this loan, she will buy three trips of firewood, 260 litres of palm oil, two bags of rice, two bucket of groundnuts, a carton of savon, and nine buckets of garlic.  She believes that her business will succeed because she has secured a ready market, a strategic location, oil is a basic need, and she is popular in the area.

With the profit from the loan, she will pay for her children's education and provide good medication for her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the training offered to members before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy firewood, palm oil, rice, groundnuts, savon, and garlic.

loans.name: Ishimwe Group

texts.en:
Justine, the group leader, is 35. She is married with 4 children aged between 7 and 17 years, all of whom go to school. 

The group is called ISHIMWE, which means “reward” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business in hopes of creating a better future. 

Justine has a shop and has been in this business for 8 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to resell.

loans.name: Lumanai

texts.en: Lumanai is 47 years old with five children. She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. Lumanai has requested a loan to buy banana tubers, taro roots, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals to assist her to run the business. She joined SPBD in 2004, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers, taro roots, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Loisi

texts.en: Loisi is a 42-year-old mother with five children and has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant and cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this over two years. Loisi has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her to run the business. She hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 22-year-old mother with 2 children and has a small business selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over 2 years.  

Imelda has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. 

She hopes to expand her business by using her profits in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, and eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old from Sheema and it's where his business is located. He is a principle farmer, mainly in coffee and banana plantations. Emmanuel’s side income is cattle rearing where he sells milk and earns a lot from it. He has only one dependant (brother) who is a student, and Emmanuel has managed to pay school fees for his siblings and look after the family because they are double orphans and he is the eldest. 

It is his sixth cycle with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) and he borrowed UGX 2,500,000 only to buy fertilizer for his plantations. He works six hours in a day, and most of his clients are coffee traders. He started that business nine years ago and for all those years, it has been very profitable. He resorted to farming after getting a chunk of land from his father as his share. He is challenged by bacterial wilt and price fluctuations. 

He hopes to buy a car for transporting his outputs such as coffee, matooke, milk and other items. And he hopes to later use the money to purchase another piece of land for an extension. He thanks Ugafode so much for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana se encuentra dedicada al comercio hace ocho años, su idea de negocio surgió a raíz de la herencia familiar, quienes se han dedicado durante años a la venta productos para el hogar, calzado y ropa.  Ella inicio su negocio con su propio capital y su madre quien también es comerciante la acompaño a realizar sus primeras compras; la llevo a los almacenes donde acostumbra comprar para presentarla ante sus proveedores para que le ofrecieran excelentes precios.  Ana ofrece zapatos deportivos para hombre, jeans, camisas, productos para el cuidado del cabello y piel como shampoo y cremas corporales y electromenores como ventiladores. Ella ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son vecinos y amigos del sector. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en la compra de ropa de cama, ventiladores, calzado y ropa. Ana es una joven de 26 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 9 años y dos hijas de 8 años y 3 meses de nacida, a quienes desea ofrecerles bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana has been working in commerce for eight years. The idea for her business came from her family’s experience, because they had worked for years selling products for the home, shoes, and clothing. She started her business with her own capital and her mother, who also works in commerce, accompanied her when she made her first purchases. She took her to stores where she frequently bought things so she could introduce her to her suppliers, so they would offer her good prices. 

Ana sells sports shoes for men, jeans, t-shirts, skin and hair care products, such as shampoo and body lotions, and small appliances, such as fans. She offers installment plans to her clients, the majority of whom are neighbors and friends from her neighborhood.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in the purchase of bed sheets, fans, shoes, and clothing. Ana is a young woman, 26 years old, and the mother of a 9 year-old son and two daughters, 8 years old and 3 months old, whom she wishes to offer wellbeing and a good quality of life.

loans.use: bed sheets, fans, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Weder Emigdio

texts.es:
Weder, es propietario de un comedor, tiene su hogar formado por su esposa y un hijo, los cuales depende de él, comenta que no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, el oficio lo heredó de su familia, trabaja de lunes a domingo, en un horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde y lo hace con ayuda de su esposa.
Invertirá en productos para la elaboración de la comida, tales como: carnes, pollo, pescado, condimentos, verduras, granos básicos, etc., así diversificara el menú de su negocio, atraerá nuevos clientes y seguirá conservando su fuente de ingresos.
Sus sueños son comprar una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Weder owns a small, set-menu restaurant. His household is made up of his wife and son, both of whom are dependent on him. He explains that he doesn’t have any economic help from outside the country. He inherited this livelihood from his family. He works Monday through Sunday; his schedule is from 6:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. He does this work with his wife’s help.

He will purchase products for making his foods, such as: meats, chicken, fish, condiments, vegetables, basic grains, etc. In this way he will diversify his business’s menu. He will attract new clients and will continue conserving his source of income.

His dream is to buy a respectable house for his family.

loans.use: meats, chicken, fish, condiments, vegetables, basic grains, etc. so he can diversify his business’s menu.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her sewing business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a PHP 15,000, which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in sewing rugs for sale. Her round palm sized rugs are useful in cleaning cabinets and kitchen counters.  They are a major item for housekeeping and cleaning and are changed constantly to ensure a bacteria-free rug. She also has a small general store for additional income.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her because her income from selling rugs is a big help with their daily sustenance.

Delia hopes to sustain and grow her businesses so she can send all of her children to school. She dreams of giving her family a better life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-sewing business.

loans.name: Perenise

texts.en: Perenise is a 39-year-old woman with five children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Perenise has requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine, to assist her to run the business. She has been doing this for more than three years. Perenise hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy and resell soft drinks, beer and spirits at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nelson Yovany

texts.es:
Nelson, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, procura dar a su familia lo mejor y lo necesario para tener una vida digna; su negocio consiste en vender ropa, actividad que aprendió siendo ayudante de personas que reparten mercadería a otros vendedores, pero ya tiene 8 años de trabajar independiente, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Utilizará el capital para comprar camisas, blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisones, toallas, etc., surtirá  con prendas de vestir su negocio, el fin de la inversión es tener ventas e ingresos mayores para facilitar el pago de la deuda adquirida y minimizar las necesidades familiares.
El proyecto que tiene pensado para su negocio es hacer la apertura de un almacén en el que pueda ofrecer otro tipo de mercadería y tener mejores recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Nelson lives with his wife and his children. He intends to give his family the best and everything they need for a dignified life. His sells clothing, an activity which he learned as an assistant to all sorts of salespeople. He has 8 years of independent work experience, and through present day he has not had any difficulties with his business.

He will use the loan to purchase shirts, blouses, dresses, pants, nightgowns, towels and other items. He will stock his business with articles of clothing, and the purpose of this investment is to have greater sales and income which will enable him to pay the debt he has incurred and to reduce his family's needs. The next project he has in mind for his business is to open a market at which he'll be able to offer other types of merchandise and through which he'll be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, dresses, pants, nightgowns and towels.

loans.name: Perdulia Isabel

texts.es:
Perdulia es una mujer de campo con empuje y perseverancia, vive con sus tres hijos en una humilde finca en zona rural de Montería. Ella es madre responsable y durante todo este tiempo ha tenido el valor y coraje de sacar a sus hijos por sus propios medios.

Ella se gana la vida con la cría y producción de cerdos de engorde, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años con el fin de obtener los recursos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. 

Ella trabaja todos los días ya que sus cerdos requieren de aseo, alimentación y monitoreo constante para su correcto desarrollo y posterior venta.

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y alimento para sus animales, dándole la oportunidad de tener unas crías mejor alimentadas y con mejores condiciones para el consumo.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y con la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Perdulia lives in the countryside. She is a person with much drive and perseverance. She lives with her three children on a humble farm in a rural area of Montería. She is a responsible mother and through the years she has had the bravery and courage to provide for her children on her own.

She earns her living by raising and producing pigs for fattening. She has been in this business for more than 15 years, with the goal of earning enough income to provide for her family.

She works every day since her pigs require clean living spaces, feed, and constant monitoring for good their growth and subsequent sale.

She is requesting the loan to buy grain and feed for her animals, giving her the opportunity to feed them better so they’ll be in better condition for consumption.

She dreams of seeing her children become professionals and with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy grain and feed for her pigs, so they will be of better quality for people to eat.

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en: Asenati is a 53-year-old mother of six children who runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. She has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubes, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en: Joylyn is 25 years old, married and has two children. She manages a store for income. She sells grocery items. Her spouse is a mechanic who repairs appliances. Joylyn wants to increase her income and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy groceries to sell such as soft drinks, breads and canned goods. This will help maintain good sales in her business so she can save for the future expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell such as soft drinks, breads and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Meretaeutu

texts.en: Meretaeutu is a 44-year-old mother of five children. She runs a small business selling bananas, taro chips and tuna sandwiches in her village and at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. Meretaeutu has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, wooden spoon, bread, a box of tuna fish and plastic bags to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a chips store in the near future and provide for her family needs. Meretaeutu became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, a fry pan, wooden spoon, bread, a box of tuna fish and plastic bags.

loans.name: Fogalele

texts.en:
Fogalele is 50 years old with 4 children. She operates a business of selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Fogalele has requested for a loan to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use the business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a banana tube, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Christian is 42 years old, married and has got one kid who is still small. He is a business man managing a poultry activity. He has layer-chickens, and he has been in this business for three years, working from 6am to 6pm each working day. He is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is Christian's fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among the Becham Group, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous credits to build the chicken shed, and to buy chickens and feeds. He now has more chickens than before, and earned a small return which he used to cover household expenses and to plough back into his business. 

He is now requesting another credit which he will use to buy chicks and chicken feed for his poultry.
 
Christian dreams of building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed for his poultry.

loans.name: Jesus Amadeo

texts.es:
Jesús, de 33 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel académico, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica al comercio de mariscos. 

Jesús, trabaja en la pesca artesanal, pero también realiza trabajos de albañilería y siembra de granos básicos, para la sostenibilidad de su familia.

Jesús, la pesca artesanal la aprendió desde que tenía 10 años de edad, cuando su padre y su tío lo indujeron a aprender este trabajo; como también la siembra de granos básicos.  

Jesús, utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar redes para pescar, de esta manera espera mejorar su equipo de pesca. 

Jesús,  sueña con obtener junto a su familia, un buen equipo de pesca, como también  mejorar su vivienda para mayor seguridad de su familia y que sus hijos tengan oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Jesús is 33 years old. He did not go to school. He is in a relationship and his life partner sells sellfish. Jesús works as a traditional fisherman, but he also works as a bricklayer and a subsistence farmer to support his family. Jesús began learning the craft of fishing when he was 10 years old, when his father and his uncle inducted him to learning this work. They also taught him to grow staple grain crops.

Jesús will use the money from this loan to purchase fishing nets. In this way he will improve his fishing equipment. He dreams of his family obtaining good fishing equipment, and also of improving his dwelling to improve the security of his family. He also dreams that his children will have the opportunity to get an education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Anna is 43 years old, not married and has got three schooling children. She takes care of her children herself and her business is where she raises income for her family needs. She currently runs two businesses, a charcoal store as her main business and she is partly involved with poultry. She has been with these businesses for ten years, working from 6am to 8pm daily. Anna is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her tenth credit request to be apportioned among Karafuu, a three-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous nine loans, Anna managed to buy sacks of charcoal and partly paid school fees for her kids. She really appreciates Kiva's support. She now has a plot of land and has started to build. She has paid back successfully her previous loans.
With her new loan, she will invest to buy stock of charcoal for her store so as to capture more people. Her desire is to be a great business woman.

loans.use: to buy stock of charcoal for her store so as to capture more people.

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en:
Talaleu is a 67-year-old mother with 5 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. 

Talaleu has requested a loan to buy boxes of twistiest, chicken, flour, tinned fish, vegetable oil, and sausage; also sacks of sugar and rice; and plastic bags, to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than 4 years. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy boxes of twistiest, chicken, flour, tinned fish, vegetable oil, and sausage; also sacks of sugar and rice; and plastic bags

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This lady's name is Josephine, and she is 51 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and is an industrious woman. She has a sewing business to support herself and her aging parents. 

Josephine has a rag-making business. She makes round, palm-sized rags into doormats to sell. In the Philippines, rag doormats are major items for housekeeping and cleaning, and every household has them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan which she will use to buy additional materials like fabric and thread for her business. This will boost her business income as she will be able to expand her business.  

Josephine hopes to get more supplies and to grow her business, so that she can continue to support herself and her aging parents. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cloth, thread and other materials needed in her rag-making business.

loans.name: Tauamo

texts.en: Tauamo is a 34-year-old mother of one child who owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tauamo has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Tauamo joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon and a fry pan.

loans.name: Suialemalo

texts.en: Suialemalo is a 33-year-old mother with three children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Suialemalo has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profits to build a small bakery store in the near future. Suialemalo joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Fiatamalii

texts.en: Fiatamalii is 18 years old. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Fiatamalii has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage, and plastic bags to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. Fiatamalii became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausage, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sugar, food oil, potatoes, and spices to make hot Tamia (traditional food) for resale.

loans.name: Princess Kaye

texts.en:
This is Princess Kaye, a 25 year old resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is newly married to Glen, a driver. They both work for their daily sustenance.

Princess Kaye has a small business of her own. She buys several packs of biscuits, cookies, and sandwich spread from a wholesaler which she sells at retail price. Filipinos love to eat biscuits and cookies. They usually send them as snacks for their kids at school and for field trips as well. She sells them per order and on demand on special occasions and holidays. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, she would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more packs of biscuits, cookies, and sandwich spread. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. It will surely help meet their daily needs and save for their future offspring.

Princess Kaye aims to grow her business and own or rent a place to display and sell her goods. She prays for good health and a prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for packed biscuits, cookies, and sandwich spread to sell.

loans.name: Katé Keben Group

texts.fr: Justine est mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Cette brave dame vend des chaussures et des légumes. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Elle voudrait acheter de chaussures au prix en gros et revendre en détail à ses clients. En plus de cela, elle voudrait s'approvisionner en légumes chaque jour pour vendre.A l'aide de son commerce, Justine aide son époux qui est mécanicien à gérer leur famille. Après la vente, Justine pourrait faire des épargnes et continuer à s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Justine is married with two children attending school. This fine lady sells shoes and vegetables. She needs this loan to build up her business.

She wants to buy shoes at wholesale prices and sell them at retail to her customers. On top of that, she intends to stock up on vegetables each day for resale.

Thanks to her commerce, Justine is helping her husband - who is a mechanic - manage their family. After the sales, Justine will be able to save and continue to take care of her family.

loans.use: buy shoes and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 31ans, Madame Akossiwa désire un premier crédit pour acheter des produits d'alimentation générale. Elle espère réinvestir dans l'activité et aider ses enfants dans leurs études. Elle a 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Son conjoint est électricien.
texts.en:
A 31-year-old woman, Mrs. Akossiwa wants a first credit loan to buy general food products. She hopes to reinvest in the business and help her children with their studies.

She has four children of whom three are in school. Her partner is an electrician.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei designs and containers

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Гулшан имеет средне-специальное образование, она работает в детском саду поваром. Гулшан, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, в 2004 году начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Начав свой бизнес со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Гулшан приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 14 овец. На арендованном земельном наделе мерою 1,20 ГА она выращивает эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулшан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. В будущем, Гулшан планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность и построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Gulshan is 32, married, and has four children.  Gulshan the equivalent of a high school education with some vocational training.  She works in a kindergarten as a chef.  In search of an additional source of income, she began raising livestock and farming crops in 2004.  After setting up her business with 5,000 som worth of startup capital, Gulshan put all of her energy towards growing her business.  She currently has four cows and fourteen sheep on her farm as well as a 1.20-hectare plot of rented land for growing sainfoin both to use on her farm and sell as a cash crop.  

For the future development of her business, Gulshan has requested a loan of 55,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow.  She plans on further expanding her business in the future as well as building a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: buy a cow to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.ru: Мариям, 34 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. Сейчас Мариям занимается полеводством на собственном участке мерою 4,0 ГА, где выращивает фасоль. Свой бизнес она начала 6 лет назад с 10,000 сом (KGS). У Мариям также есть 5 коров, 4 лошади и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Мариям составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). По характеру человек очень честный и добросовестный. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Мариям обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры для полеводства. Доходы от бизнеса Мариям собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и образование ее детей.
texts.en: Mariyam is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She works in agriculture: she owns four hectares of land on which she grows beans.  She started her own business six years ago with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  She also has five cows, four horses and 20 sheep.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  By nature, she is very honest and conscientious.  In order to further increase her business, Mariyam has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which will help her to buy nitrate for crop farming.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase nitrate in order to grow organic beans.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old. She lives in Lusaka with her three-month-old baby. She runs her own business. Her business helps people in her community to send and receive money from one place to the other. 

Florence is a Kiva beneficiary. She has accessed two loans from Kiva, which have helped her to grow her business and earn more profits. She now runs two Zoona mobile money transfer outlets and has employed two people to help her with the day to day transactions. Florence has successfully repaid the two loans and continues to work hard to expand her business. She wanted to take this opportunity to let her Kiva lenders know that she has relocated and lives in an area nearer to her places of business. This helps her to manage her business and take care of the baby.

Florence has requested a subsequent loan so that she can fund her second shop. She has noticed that it takes longer to serve customers due to insufficient float. This loan will help her build the money that she uses to serve customers and earn more commissions. Florence depends on the commissions to take care of herself and her baby.

loans.use: to fund her second location with additional float to grow her mobile money business and service more customers in her community who need financial services.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic, now 44 years old, has been running his Zoona money transfer business for five years. He is married and has two children. His children go to school. Dominic got his first Kiva loan in November 2012 amounting to $975. This loan was instrumental in helping Dominic establish his business by increasing his capital float. He has successfully repaid this loan. Dominic accessed a second loan in July 2013 amounting to $925; this loan helped Dominic grow his business, as he was able to serve more customers, he has successfully repaid this loan. The third loan that Dominic accessed was for $950; this loan helped Dominic to purchase a trading booth so that he could open his second outlet in Luanshya, this helped him expand his business and gain new customers, he has since repaid this loan. Dominic accessed his fourth loan, which was used to finance his second outlet. This helped Dominic have funds to serve customers at his new outlet. He is making good repayments on this loan. The Kiva loans have helped Dominic to grow his business and earn more profits. He uses the profits to provide for his family.

Today, Dominic is requesting a fifth loan so that he can increase the float levels at his shops and continue to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business. He says the Kiva loan will help him satisfy the demands from his customers. Dominic is one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money agent in Luanshya and this puts pressure on him to always have money to serve customers. Dominic would like to thank his Kiva lenders for their continued support throughout the years. He says his business has grown due to the continued support from Kiva and the lenders. As a micro-entrepreneur in Zambia, he says working capital finance is very difficult to find and therefore, he has appreciated the opportunity to be linked to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add to the money he uses to serve customers so that he can grow his mobile money business and serve more customers in need of financial services

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 35 years old. She describes herself as confident and self-driven. She is a single mother of a six-year-old girl. Cecilia has been running her business of sending and receiving money with Zoona for two years. Cecilia has been able to successfully grow her business through the help from Kiva lenders. She has received three loans, which helped her open more outlets and employ more young people from her community. Having access to the Kiva loans has also given Cecilia an adequate float of working capital in order to service her customers efficiently. Currently, Cecilia operates four mobile money transfer outlets and employs six young people in Lusaka, Zambia. Now that Cecilia has successfully paid back one of her three previous loans, and is making good repayments on her other two, she is requesting a new loan to continue growing her mobile money business. With this loan, she will be able to serve more customers in a community that needs financial services. Her dream is to keep expanding her business and employ more young people so that she can give them a chance to improve their lives, too. Cecilia would like to let her Kiva lenders know how much her life has changed. She is empowered and is able to take care of her daughter and support her mother. She attributes her success to Zoona, Kiva, and a lot of hard work.

loans.use: To grow her mobile money business to serve more customers, providing a safe way to send and receive money and pay bills through her shops.

loans.name: Farafina R6 Group

texts.fr: Mariam est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est responsable de ce groupe dont les membres travaillent sans relâche pour assurer un bien être à leurs familles.. Ce groupe est client de ACFIME depuis Juillet 2012 et jusque là, il n'ya pas de problème de remboursement. Mariam est commerçante de pagnes depuis plus de 30 ans.Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des balles de pagnes pour vendre. les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre soin de sa famille, de faire des épargnes et de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of two children attending school. She is responsible for the group whose members work tirelessly to ensure their families' well-being. This group has been a member of ACFIME since July 2012 and so far there have been no repayment problems.

Mariam has been a merchant of pagnes for over 30 years. She needs this credit loan to buy bales of pagnes for resale. The profits will enable her to take care of her family, to save and to pursue her business activity.

loans.use: buy various qualities of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay university costs.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.es:
Nelda es de la ciudad de Lambaré, ella tiene dos hijos, comenta que tiene como aspiraciones poner un consultorio propio, y especializarse en el extranjero en varias ramas de la carrera.
Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, ya que debe mezclar sus roles de madre y de estudiante, ella está poniendo todo lo mejor de sí para poder dar lo mejor a sus hijos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir por sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nelda is from the city of Lambaré.  She has two children and says her goal is to set up her own consulting company, specializing in several different areas of her career.

She is a very self-sacrificing person who is both mother and student.  She does the best she can to give her children the best of everything.

The loan she is requesting is to pay university fees to continue her studies.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Bubush

texts.ru: Бубуш успешно погасила кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Бубуш, в ее хозяйстве имеется корова, лошадь и 50 овец. На ежедневной основе она продает молоко, экологически чистое оно пользуется большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Бубуш составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока. На доходы от кредита Бубуш планирует закупить корм для скота.
texts.en: Bubush used her previous loan as intended and successfully paid it off.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her get this financing.  Thanks to her very hard work and determination, she now owns one cow, one horse and 50 sheep.  She sells organic milk every day and receives a high demand for it.  She makes a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy two additional dairy cows in order to produce and sell more milk.  With the earnings from her loan, she is planning to buy fodder for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to produce more organic milk.

loans.name: Carlos Amable

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 44 años, es casado la esposa tiene 44 años tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando viven en casa arrendada ya varios años ellos viven en un sector donde la gente tiene sus taller propios de confecciones y de artesanías y también de mucho turismo y tradiciones como los san juanes que cada año lo realizan y los turistas vienen a observar sus tradiciones cada año.

Carlos es mecánico que viene realizando obras en su taller propio servicio de mantenimiento de motores, chequeos de frenos y otros servicios más esto lo viene realizando más de 20 años en la cual han sido buenos ha habido momentos que han tenido que luchar para seguir manteniendo a los clientes brindando su mejor servicio para que no estén buscando en otro lado el servicio que él puede brindarle con toda la experiencia que adquirió en sus estudios, con el crédito quiere comprar más productos de pastillas de frenos para ofrecer en el taller mismo y que no estén saliendo a comprar en otros lugares y así mantener las mismas ventas en el taller.
Agradece a fundación alternativa por el apoyo que brinda para incrementar el capital de trabajo y seguir incrementando el negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old; he is married; his wife is 44; and they have two children who are in school.  They have lived in a rented house for several years now; they live in an area where people have their own sewing and craft workshops and there is also a lot of tourism and traditions, such as the festival of San Juan that they put on, and tourists come to witness their traditions every year.  

Carlos is a mechanic who has been doing work in his own shop where he does engine maintenance, checks brakes, and provides other services.  He has been doing this work for over 20 years, which have been good; there have been times when he has had to struggle to keep his customers by offering his best work so they will not go anywhere else for services that he can provide with all the experience he has acquired in his studies.  He wants to buy more brake pads to sell in his shop so people don't go anywhere else to buy them, which will maintain sales in his shop.  

He thanks Fundación Alternativa for the support they have offered him to increase his work capital and keep improving his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and parts, such as brake pads, to increase his capital and improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her corn crop.

loans.name: Rudy Alberto

texts.es:
Rudy, vive en casa familiar con su madre, dos hermanos y su compañera de vida, por el momento no tiene hijos, su actividad económica es la de ofrecer el servicio de transporte, ya sea para personas como para carga, también vende productos de la canasta básica y variedad de lácteos que son producidos por él mismo, la leche es obtenida del ganado que posee, el servicio de transporte funciona desde hace 5 años, mientras que la tienda la fundo hace 6 meses, su horario es de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, su ventaja es que en la zona no hay muchos vehículos que ofrezcan el servicio y las tiendas son pocas.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar 3 llantas, dará mantenimiento al motor y le hará cambio de aceite a su unidad de transporte, con el resto invertirá en detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, granos básicos, etc., para mejorar la tienda, mantendrá su vehículo en buenas condiciones para continuar trabajando y ofrecerá productos que cubran las necesidades de sus clientes, por el momento no representa riesgos, ya que la zona donde vive actualmente es muy sana, es decir no tiene problemas de delincuencia.
Sus proyectos son seguir ampliando y mejorando la tienda, comprar más ganado para tener mejores ingresos, cancelar sus deudas y garantizar un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Rudy lives in the family home with his mother, two siblings and his life partner.  For now he has no children.  He earns a living providing transportation service for both passengers and cargo.  He also sells basic goods and a variety of dairy products that he makes from the milk of his own cows.  the transportation business has been running for five years and the store was set up six months ago.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  The advantage that he has in the area is that there are not many transport vehicles nor stores.

He plans to use the loan to buy three tires, service the engine and change the oil.  He will use the rest to buy detergents, sweets, drinks, basic grains, etc. to improve the store.  He wants to keep the vehicle in good condition to continue working and offering products to meet customer demand.  For the time being there are no risks since the area where he lives is very safe and has no delinquency problems.

His goal is to continue expanding and improving his store, to buy more cattle and earn more income, to pay off debt, and to guarantee a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy detergents, sweets, drinks, basic grains, etc. to improve his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 7 años, y su negocio es el tejido de buzos para niños.
Ella es buena madre y  trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de Villa Adela caracterizada por ser una área comercial y de crecimiento,  de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Gladys es de tez morena, cabello negro largo habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su familia, vive en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, Su negocio es el tejido buzos a mano y también lo realiza a máquina, las buzos son bien solicitadas por las mamas para cubrir a sus hijos  del frio labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma independiente en su domicilio, la venta la efectúa en un puesto de venta improvisado en la calle y también en feria y mercados, de forma ambulante,  con el dinero del crédito comprara lana por mayor de diferentes colores y texturas para el tejido de sus productos, esta es su primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Gladys solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para así tejer  y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gladys, a 29-year-old woman, is married and has a 7-year-old daughter. She has a business knitting trousers for children. She is a good mother and is hard working. She has her business in the area of Villa Adela, which is known as a growing commercial area. It has a dry cold climate and the temperature varies during the day between 2 and 14 degrees centigrade.

Gladys is dark-skinned, with long black hair. She speaks Spanish in her everyday life and when she is doing business. She lives with her family in a brick-built house which has drinking water and electricity. Her business is knitting trousers by hand and she also does them by machine. The trousers are highly sought after by the mums to protect their children from the cold. She works independently in her home every day of the week. She has an improvised stall in the street for her sales and she also sells at the fair and at markets as a street vendor. 

She will use the loan to buy wholesale wool of different colours and textures for knitting her products. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years which she has been doing this business. This is why Gladys is asking for a loan to buy wool wholesale so she can knit and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, es una persona dedicada a trabajar en el campo cultivando maíz y frijol, su familia está integrada por su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, su familia depende económicamente de él; su experiencia en la agricultura la aprendió de sus padres, no tiene un horario establecido y hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar ganado, de esta manera ampliara su negocio y aprovechara el pasto que saca de sus cultivos para alimentarlo, espera adquirir animales sanos que puedan producir leche para elaborar sus derivados, con los que alimentara a su familia y podrá venderlos a sus vecinos para tener ingresos extras.
Yonis aspira establecer mejor el rubro del ganado para tener recursos económicos con los que pueda ampliar su vivienda y dar a sus dos hijos una educación superior.
texts.en:
Yonis works in the country growing corn and beans. His family consists of his wife and two children, ages seven and four years old. Yonis’ family depend on him financially. Yonis learned farming from his parents. He has no fixed timetable and, so far, has had no difficulties with his work.

Yonis is applying for a loan in order to buy cattle, thus expanding his business and taking advantage of the pasture from his crops that he will use to feed his animals. He hopes to buy healthy animals that can produce milk in order to make other products to feed his family and sell to neighbours to earn a higher income.

Yonis aspires to strengthen his cattle business in order to have the financial resources to put an extension on his home and offer his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy cattle, thus expanding his business and take advantage of the pasture from his crops that he will use to feed his animals.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hija de 4 años de edad, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de mantas de vicuña como también vende sombreros tradicionales.
Ella es emprendedora, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chasquipampa’,  que se encuentra al sur  de la ciudad de Paz de clima cálido que en los últimos años se convirtió en una zona comercial.
Martha es de piel morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el aymara (el cual se habla en el lugar) y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a hija, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillos y cuenta con electricidad. Su negocio es la elaboración de mantas de vicuña; su trabajo consiste en caminar largas distancias en el altiplano en busca de lana de vicuña, la cual asea para luego hilvanarla, una vez que tiene suficiente lana se dispone a tejerla en un telar. Su trabajo es netamente artesanal y cada manta lleva un promedio de 2 a 3 semanas en terminarla. “esta actividad lo aprendí de mi madre que se lo enseño mi abuela y también enseñare a mi hija…” comenta. su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia para que su hija crezca en mejores condiciones. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor, para contar con material de trabajo para trabajar la temporada de fin de año sin problemas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de vicuña por mayor  para contar con material para trabajar a fin de año como también sombreros para abastecerse de mercadería.
texts.en:
Martha, aged 50, is single and has a 4-year-old daughter. She has a business making and selling vicuña wool shawls as well as selling traditional hats. She is enterprising, thorough, responsible and hard-working. She has her business in the 'Chasquipampa' area which is found to the south of the city of La Paz and has become a commercial area in recent years. It has a warm climate.

Martha is dark-skinned and short of stature with long black hair worn in a plait. She wears traditional dress (hat, shawl and full skirt) and her mother tongue is Aymara (which is spoken in the area) and she also speaks Spanish. She lives with her daughter. They live in their own brick-built house which has electricity. Her business is making vicuña shawls. Her work consists of walking long distances on the altiplano to find vicuña wool, which she cleans and then spins. Once she has enough wool she starts to weave it on a loom. Her work is entirely handmade and each shawl takes an average of 2-3 days to complete. "I learnt this skill from my mother, who learnt from my grandmother, and I will also teach my daughter..." she says.

Her dream is to improve her family's quality of life so that her daughter has better conditions to grow up in. She wants to invest in her business by buying vicuña wool wholesale, so she has enough raw materials to be able to work through the end of year season without any problems. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years which she has been doing this work independently. This is why Martha is asking for a loan, to buy vicuña wool wholesale so she has raw materials to work to the end of the year as well as to buy hats to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool and hats.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Km 21 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa Km. 21 está en su ciclo número 7 del de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty ,  la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento.  Por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Carmen,  es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su trabajo de cocinera en una estancia de la zona, y también está procurando para poder iniciarse en un nuevo proyecto.  Con este trabajo desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las reuniones de capacitación pueda ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de animales y otros, para poder criarlos, y de esa forma implementar este trabajo para ayudar a su familia.  Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa KM 21” group is on its seventh loan cycle as part of the women’s committee programme. The group comes from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is growing. The members of this group want to fight to keep growing and make the area where they live better.

Carmen is one member of the group. She works as a cook in the local area, and is also working on starting a new business. With this new project, Carmen wants to move forward and, through training sessions, wants to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Carmen is applying for this loan in order to buy animals to raise and other items, allowing her to start a business and help her family. Carmen is grateful for this opportunity to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es:
Diego, tiene  22 años, la esposa tiene 22 años, tiene 2 hijos con los cuales viven en una casa arrendada en el barrio de Santa Martha que pertenece a Antonio Ante es un lugar donde la mayoría de personas se dedican a la confecciones, artesanías las cuales ofrecen distintos lugares de la provincia también en el lugar hay turismo como la fábrica de Imbabura que los turistas han estado visitando desde su remodelación que se encuentra ubicado en el sector de Andrade Marín.

Ellos se dedican a dar servicio de maquilado a clientes de la zona, maquilan prendas de vestir con sus propias maquinas esto ya viene realizando 4 años en las cuales les han ido bien han incrementado máquinas para seguir ofreciendo servicios a pesar de dificultades en el negocio han venido luchando para seguir manteniendo el mismo ritmo de brindar sus servicios.
Con el crédito que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de una máquina de coser que necesita y que es necesario para brindar un servicio mucho más mejor y que los clientes no se vayan a otros sitios a pedir el servicio que puede ellos brindar con la compra que van a realizar.
texts.en:
Diego and his wife are both 22 years old. They have two children. The family lives in a rented house in the Santa Martha barrio of Antonio Ante. Here the majority of people work in sewing and handicrafts that they sell in different places around the province. Also present in the area is the tourism industry; tourists have been visiting the Imbabura textile factory in the Andrade Marín area since its remodeling.

Diego and his wife make a living doing sewing work. They have been producing clothing with their own machines for four years. This has gone very well and they have increased the number of sewing machines that they own in order to continue offering their services. In spite of difficulties the couple has fought to keep up the same working rhythm as they provide their services.

This loan will be used to buy a sewing machine that the couple needs to provide a much better service and so that customers do not go to their competitors.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and use the resulting income to offer his children a better quality of life.

loans.name: Henry Miguel

texts.es:
Henry, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 
Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de Monteria, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 
Henry solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos de aproximadamente 70 kilos, los cuales engordará para su posterior venta, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 
Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 6 horas en distintas actividades, es un hombre rebuscador e inquieto
texts.en:
Henry is a peasant who is filled with dreams and aspirations. He wants to move forward with his family by the sweat of his brow.

As a result of this, Henry started a business raising pigs, a common trade in the Monteria municipality, where the pigs are not only known for their good prices but also for their good quality.

Henry is applying for a loan in order to buy 70kg pigs, which he will fatten up to sell. His only objective is to progress and look after his family, which brings out his fighting and driven spirit.

Henry works hard every day for six hours in different jobs. He is a resourceful and active man.

loans.use: to buy 70kg pigs to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender ropa, lo hace de manera independiente de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., está actividad la desempeñaba con su familia, pero ya tiene más de 15 años de trabajar en su negocio propio; vive con su esposo y una hija de 5 años de edad, con los ingresos que genera apoya a su esposo con los gastos familiares y no tiene ingresos de ayuda económica del extranjero.
El préstamo le será de ayuda para comprar variedad de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niñas/os, incrementara su inventario, atenderá mejor a sus clientes, tendrá ventas e ingresos mayores, espera aprovechar la oportunidad de trabajar con un crédito para fortalecer su negocio.
Para María es importante lograr tener un local en el centro de la cuidad para expandir su negocio, tener una posición económica más favorable y brindar a su hija la oportunidad de superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
María makes a living selling clothes; she does this independently from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm. She does this with her family, but she already has more than 15 years' experience working in her own business. She lives with her husband and 5 year-old daughter, and she supports her husband with the household expenses with the generated income; she doesn't receive any financial aid from abroad. 
The loan will help her to buy a variety of clothes for ladies, men and children, increase her inventory, better serve her customers, and have better sales and a better income; she hopes to make the most of the opportunity to work with a loan to strengthen her business.
It is important for María to achieve her goal of getting a shop in the centre of the city to expand her business, have a more favourable financial position and give her daughter the chance to excel academically.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for ladies, men and children, which will increase her inventory.

loans.name: Huber Antonio

texts.es:
Huber, con 27 años de edad, es un hombre soltero. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de platano, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 
El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del platano en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 
Huber solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.
Huber sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
27 year-old Huber is a single man.
He was born and raised in the countryside, where he learnt about farming alongside his father; thanks to this, nowadays he has a banana plantation, whose harvest is sold and this is how he obtains the resources to bring home food to his home.
The borrower is a man who is thriving; he is a fighter and is devoted to his family and his work, which motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead. Every day he fights to overcome the obstacles that are in his way; he has been through difficult financial situations due to the low price of bananas on the market, which affects the price of his product. 
Huber is asking Corporación Interactuar for a loan to invest in the purchase of farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides), in order to keep his business going and prepare his crops to harvest a high-quality product.
Huber dreams of improving his crops and expand them to obtain a good monthly income.

loans.use: to  buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides for the upkeep of his business; they are costly supplies which he cannot afford.

loans.name: Thành

texts.en:
Mrs Thành works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle.

Thành is forty-four years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Hau Loc district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thành's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.Thành has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Thành faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In the future, Thành hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi  is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a goat meat business for the past ten years and her potential customers are mostly in her community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats for resale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is twenty-eight years old.  She is single and the primary supporter of her three-year-old son. Juliet is a Micro-entrepreneur. She runs her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Her business helps people send and receive money.

Juliet used her first Kiva loan to start running her Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan helped her to purchase a trading booth, which she uses to serve her customers’ money sending needs. Juliet wants to let her Kiva lenders know that opening her own business has empowered her and she is able to provide basic needs for her son.

Juliet is now applying for a second Kiva loan, which she plans to use to finance her business by adding to her working capital float. This is the money that she uses to serve customers on a daily basis. These funds will ensure that Juliet has enough money to fulfill her customers’ transactions. This then helps to increase her commissions, which she depends on for her income. This also makes sure she never has to turn away customers who need to transact.

Juliet is positive that once she receives her loan, her revenue will double and she will be able to improve her education through distance learning. Her biggest dream is to see her son through university so that he can have a better life in future. Juliet thanks Kiva lenders for their support with the growth of her Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: To finance her mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is a twenty-nine-year-old micro-entrepreneur. He operates his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business in Livingstone, Zambia. His business provides financial services to people in his community. Luka is married and has two daughters ages seven and two years old.

Luka began running his own business ten years ago selling clothes. He added the business of mobile money transfers to boost his income, as his profit margins were very low and he struggled to provide basic needs for his family. Today the combined incomes from his two businesses help Luka earn a decent living.

Luka is requesting a loan from Kiva because he wants to pay for his trading booth which he currently uses it to make his transactions but has not paid for it due to lack of capital. This loan will also help Luka to add on the money that he has to serve customers in his business.  Adding capital to his mobile money transfer business will help Luka earn more commissions and help him take his daughter school. He is hopeful that this will improve his standard of living. 

He sees his mobile money business as a good first step in becoming a successful businessman. Luka thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth and serve customers who need to access financial services

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es: Doña Ilda es una mujer de 43 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y deseos de superarse, casada y con ella viven 6 hijos los cuales viven en casa y estudian en la escuela en diferentes grados de educación así como también el apoyo en el campo. Su grado de estudio es de primaria la cual no culmino llegando hasta el tercer año y agradece a sus padres el esfuerzo realizado para que ella pudiese estudiar y que por razones económicas no termino. En compañía de su esposo se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de granos básicos maíz y frijol teniendo su propiedad a pocos metros de su casa de habitacion permitiendo esto dar una mejor asistencia a sus cultivos y estar más pendiente de ellos. Su mercado de venta es en los alrededores de la comunidad los dueños de bodegas quienes en ocasiones llegan hasta el lugar para la compra anticipada del mismo ya que ellos saben de la magnífica calidad de su trabajo. Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos agrícolas ayudando estos a poder dar la abonada que necesitan para poder sacar su cosecha de maíz completa y que la misma sea provechosa para generar los ingresos económicos que debe de generar. Como productora y agricultora su meta la ampliación de su propiedad, la siembra de más granos de maíz y el crecimiento continuo de su negocio ya que esto ayudara a generar más ingresos y que los estudios de sus hijos puedan ser una realidad y ellos puedan superarse en la vida.
texts.en: Doña Ilda is a 43 year-old woman; she is a figher, an entrepreneur and wants to outdo herself. She is married, and lives with 6 children at home; they study at school in different school grades, and are also a support in the countryside. Her level of education is primary, which she didn't complete, reaching the third grade, and she is grateful to her parents for their efforts so that she could study; she did not finish for financial reasons. Along with her husband she makes a living planting and harvesting basic grains such as maize and beans, on her own land a few metres from her house; this allows her to pay greater attention to her crops and keep an eye on them. Her trading market is on the outskirts of the community. Shop owners sometimes come to her to purchase her stock in advance, since they know how high the quality of her products is. She is currently asking for a loan which would help to buy farming supplies, which would in turn help to fertilise the crops as needed, in order to have a full harvest of maize; this would be beneficial to generate the income she needs. As a supplier and farmer, her goal is to expand her land, plant more maize seeds and continually build her business, as this would help to generate more income and allow her children's dreams of studying to come true, so that they might get excel in their lives.

loans.use: para compra de insumos agricolas para asistir sus cultivos de maiz

loans.name: Jetherine

texts.en:
This is thirty-two-year-old Jetherine. She is friendly and works very hard to take care of her family. She has three brothers and three sisters. She runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business in Ndola, the third largest city in Zambia.

Before running her own mobile money business, Jetherine worked as a cashier in a grocery shop for two years. Her experience helps her in the day-to-day running of the business and she enjoys talking to her customers. Jetherine says that her community benefits from her business of mobile money transfers because they no longer have to travel long distances to access financial services. She is very pleased with the business because it allows her to have a minimum income at the end of the month to pay her rent. 

Jetherine is pleased to be connected to the Kiva lenders and have the opportunity to access working capital support. She explains that running her own business has not been easy. This is due to the fact the she does not have enough money in her business to serve customers who want to send and receive larger amounts of money. Currently, Jetherine is operating with a very low amount of capital reserves. This is not enough because mobile money is becoming more popular and the demand for the product has increased. Her second challenge is the she does not have any branding and signage to direct customers to her place of business.

Jetherine is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can grow her business, by adding money to enable her to serve more customers. With increased working capital, Jetherine will also use part of the funds to purchase some paint so that she can paint her place of business and put up signs to bring more customers to her shop. Jetherine is confident she can earn additional profits, grow her business, and provide a better future for herself and family.

loans.use: To buy branding materials for her shop

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia, radicada zona rural del municipio de Guaduas, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 
Lleva unos meses con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 
Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Porcinos, los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos y adecuación de su cochera.
Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.
De este negocio dependen sus hijos a quiénes ayuda mucho con los gastos de su hogar.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia, based in a rural area of the town of Guaduas, has always worked in the area of agriculture and livestock alongside her family, where she learned to perform these tasks.
