For a few months, she has been, on her own, raising and fattening pigs for sale and for distribution in several areas of her town. 
 
She dreams of improving the number of pigs to raise, and she is asking "Corporación Interactuar" for a loan with which she can buy several pigs, supplies for feeding them, and with which she can maintain and adapt the pens. The earnings obtained from having more animals will be much more which will allow her to have a better quality of life, without so much economic hardship. Her children depend on her business, which helps a lot with household costs. 

Her biggest dream is to own a home and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for feeding her pigs and to help maintain and adapt the pens.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, tiene 37 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería, el negocio lo aprendió cuando apoyaba a su papá a realizar dichas actividades, trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido, es casado, su esposa tiene 32 años de edad, en su hogar hay dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad, toda la familia vive junta y son dependientes de don Julio.
Está preparando todo para la próxima siembra de maíz, el capital que solicita le servirá para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semilla e insecticidas, con estos productos dará un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos y eliminará las plagas, espera tener una cosecha abundante, mejorar sus ingresos y pagar la deuda con puntualidad.
Julio sueña con mantener su negocio funcionando y cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Julio is 37 years old and he has worked his whole life with agriculture and livestock. He learned the trade when he helped his father do these activities. He works every day, without a set schedule, and he is married. His wife is 32 years old and they have two children at home, of 15 and 12 years of age. The family lives together and they all depend on Julio. 

He is getting everything ready for the next sowing time for corn. The loan that he is asking for will help him buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, and insecticides. These products will provide good crop development and will eliminate pests. He expects to have an abundant harvest, improve their income, and pay the debt on time. 

Julio dreams of keeping his business going and changing the family's way of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, and insecticides-- these products will provide good crop development and will eliminate pests.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, está dedicado a atender la carpintería que posee, así como también la crianza y comercialización de ganado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero, la experiencia en el negocio la adquirió con ayuda de su padre, por más de 12 años ha luchado por tener un negocio independiente, por motivación propia aprendió a ejercer el trabajo de carpintería y ha adquirido más experiencia en el comercio de ganado.
Invertirá en ganado, lo engordara y luego venderá a mejores precios, espera incrementar sus ingresos, disminuir las necesidades familiares, cancelar sus deudas y seguir trabajando sin dificultades como hasta la fecha.
Su sueño es dar a su núcleo familiar un mejor estilo de vida y que sus hijos tengan un buen desarrollo en la sociedad.
texts.en:
José works at his carpentry shop and he also raises and sells cattle. He lives with his wife and two children. He has no relatives abroad. He acquired experience in the business with the help of his father. For more than 12 years, he has fought to have an independent business. On his own initiative, he learned to do the work of carpentry and he has acquired more experience in the cattle business. 

He will invest in cattle and later he will sell at a better price. He hopes to increase his income, decrease the family needs, pay off his debts and keep working without any difficulties as he has done so far.  

His dream is to give his nuclear family a better life style and for his children to develop well in society.

loans.use: to invest in cattle, which he will fatten and then sell at a better price.

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es:
Sonia, es cosmetóloga, profesión que a aprendió tomando diversos cursos, sus conocimientos los ha puesto en práctica desde hace 5 años, con ello ayuda a cubrir los gastos familiares, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, no cuenta con ayuda económica del extranjero.
Invertirá en tintes, tratamientos para el cabello, esmaltes, limas, entre otros productos, ofrecerá un mejor servicio a sus clientes, espera ganar más clientela, incrementar sus ganancias y tener un negocio más competitivo.
Para Sonia es importante cumplir el sueño de expandir su negocio y dar a su familia mejores circunstancias de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia is a cosmetologist. She learned this profession by taking different courses. She has put her knowledge into practice for 5 years. With it, she helps to cover the family expenses. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She doesn't have any financial help from abroad.  

She will invest in dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, files, and more products. She will offer her customers a better service. She hopes to earn more customers, increase her profits and have a more competitive business. 

For Sonia it is important to make her dream of expanding her business come true and to give her family better circumstances in life.

loans.use: to invest in dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, files, and other to products to offer her customers a better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn wholesale to make and sell tortillas. This way, she will take advantage of the good price to acquire it.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 36 años de edad, que desde hace 4 años comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes que un familiar le cedió para que la trabajara y generara ingresos para sustentar los gastos del hogar.
Este negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7 am a 8 pm y ha obtenido buenos resultados, generando ingresos suficientes para que a su esposa y a sus 2 hijos no les haga falta nada.
El crédito que solicita con la Corporación Interactuar es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, lácteos, galletería, granos, entre otros, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, aumentando las ventas e ingresos que recibe por su labor.
Luis, con su espíritu de superación y las ganas de salir adelante con su familia, lo impulsan a seguir luchando y avanzar para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is a 36-year-old man, who started to work four years ago doing various activities. Currently, he has a grocery store that a relative gave him so that he could work and generate income in order to sustain household costs. 

This business is open daily from 7 am to 8 pm and has been successful, generating enough income so that his wife and their two children do not lack anything. 

The loan he is asking for from "Corporación Interactuar" will help buy a variety of bulk products such as pastries, milk products, cookies, grains, and others. This will allow him to offer a wider variety of products to satisfy the pressing needs of his customers, increasing his sales and the income that he receives for his work. 

Luis, with his spirit of achievement and desire to get ahead with his family, push him to continue fighting and making progress towards accomplishing his dream of having his own house in which he can enjoy a better quality of life, along with his family and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: , an in-progress entrepreneur, to invest in snacks, milk products, cookies, and grains

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una mujer soltera de 40 años, ella vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Chichicastenango. 
María para generar sus ingresos tiene una pequeña venta de enseres, ella vende fuera de su comunidad,  ella es vendedora ambulante, hace tres años empezó con este negocio, según lo que manifiesta María es que en esa comunidad son pocas las personas que se dedican a este tipo de ventas.  Pues la meta de Maria es ampliar el negocio, pues para solventar esta necesidad ha decidió buscar un prestamo de cinco mil quetzales, que lo invertiría en la compra de más mercadería. 
Maria es una mujer que busca bienestar en la vida, ella además de tener este negocio, pues como otra fuente de ingreso se dedica también a la elaboración de ropa típica, estas dos actividades son  de vital importancia para Maria ya que solo de esa manera ella ha prosperado en la vida. Maria no pierde las esperanzas de conseguir el prestamo. Y uno de las metas personales es tener un local para no seguir como vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
María is a 40 year-old single woman who lives together with her parents and siblings in a community in Chichicastenango. María earns her income from her small furnishings-selling business. She is a traveling sales woman and sells outside of her community She started this business three years ago and, as María has demonstrated, in this community there are not many other people dedicated to selling these types of goods.

María's goal is to expand the business. To achieve this she has decided to search for a loan of five thousand GTQ [$675], which she will use to buy more merchandise. 

María is a woman who strives for well-being in her life. As well as having this business, as another source of income, she also makes typical clothing. These two activities are of vital importance for María because they have allowed her to succeed in life. María is hopeful that she will get the loan. One of her personal goals is to have a shop so she doesn't have to continue being a traveling sales woman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron and bricks, etc. to build a sanitary bathroom with plumbing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior ha ido mejorando su venta de ropa y calzado, con la nueva situación financiera ha podido cubrir necesidades básicas de su hogar y ha mantenido puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo por los buenos resultados y el apoyo que le da tanto Padecomsmcrédito como los inversionistas  Kiva, invertirá en la compra de trajes para niños/as, vestidos, camisas, faldas, pantalones, etc., para todas las edades y ambos sexos, su objetivo es continuar su progreso.
texts.en: With the help of the previous financing, María has been improving her sales of clothing and shoes. With her new financial situation she has been able to pay for the basic necessities for her home and she has made her payments in a punctual manner. She is seeking a new loan because of the good results she obtained and the large amount of support that comes from Padecomsmcrédito and the Kiva investors. She will invest it in the purchase of outfits for children, dresses, shirts, skirts and pants, etc. for all ages and both sexes with the goal of continuing her progress.

loans.use: to purchase outfits for children, dresses, shirts, skirts and pants, etc. for all ages and both sexes with the goal of continuing her progress.

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yesenia, está decidida a solicitar un nuevo crédito por los buenos resultados obtenidos anteriormente, invertirá en bebidas envasadas, harina, tomates, cebollas, quesillo, aceite, golosinas, etc., elaborara la venta de pupusas, meriendas y  surtir mejor el inventario del chalet.
Hoy en día el negocio de Yesenia cuenta con mayor demanda y sus clientes están satisfechos por el buen servicio, su familia se mantiene unida y con su mismo núcleo, la situación económica se ha estabilizado y por el momento no tiene dificultades para continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Yesenia has decided to seek a new loan because of the good results she obtained previously. She will invest it in bottled drinks, flour, tomatoes, onions, cheese, oil and sweets, etc. to develop her sales of pupusas and snacks and to better supply her stall. Today, Yesenia's business features high demand and her customers are satisfied with the good service they receive. Her family remains united within the same group. Her economic situation has stabilized and at the moment she is not having any difficulty continuing to work.

loans.use: to invest in bottled drinks, flour, tomatoes, onions, cheese, oil and sweets, etc. to develop her sales of pupusas and snacks and to better supply her stall.

loans.name: Florellas Group

texts.es: Florellas es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres exitosas en su vida laboral, quien lo coordina es Carla una mujer emprendedora decidida a superarse para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, tiene la edad de 31 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 3 y 9 años, quienes son su mayor fuerza para su superación se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos a los pobladores de su comunidad y cuenta con una experiencia de diez años, es el segundo ciclo que solicita en ADIM el financiamiento para su negocio e invertir en licras, blusas, camisetas, cremas corporales, body, perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, entre otros productos. El resto de las integrantes son, Luisa una mujer de laboriosa de 28 años de edad comerciante de ropa en su comunidad desde hace tres años, y Marion una joven que a sus 22 años de edad ofrece un servicio de comida desde hace cinco años, principalmente a trabajadores de empresas cercanas a su domicilio.
texts.en: Florellas is a solidarity group composed of three women who are successful in their working life. The coordinator is Carla, a businesswoman who decided to excel in order to improve the quality of life of her family. She is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 3 and 9 years old who are her main inspiration for succeeding. She works selling clothing and cosmetics to members of her community and she has 10 years of experience. This is the second loan she is seeking from ADIM to finance her business and to invest in tights, blouses, tank tops, body lotions, women's perfumes and men's colognes, among other products. The rest of the members are: Luisa, a hard working woman who is 28 years old and has sold clothing in her community for three years; and Marion, a 22 year old young woman who has offered food services for 5 years, primarily to workers in businesses near her home.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics merchandise.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Rowena successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rowena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 36 years old. He is married to Lenganji, and they have two children together. Ernest runs a small business in his hometown of Luanshya, a town whose main economic activity is the mining of copper. He is very happy for the opportunity to get his very first loan. Ernest’s business deals in the services of mobile money transfers. He helps people in his community send and receive money to and from their loved ones, and for business purposes. 

Ernest started running his business in August, 2013. He runs his mobile money transfer business in his grocery shop. Most of Ernest’s customers are miners who send money to their families back home. Ernest is very excited to get his first loan because it will help him to have some good working capital. Having more capital will boost Ernest’s business, as he will be able to serve more customers who want to send money at his shop. He has hopes of seeing his business grow to greater heights. 

Ernest is hopeful that this loan will help him to earn more profits. The anticipated increase in profits will help Ernest provide better for his family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to fund a mobile money transfer service at his grocery store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old. He runs his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. His business deals in the sending and receiving of money.

Joseph completed high school in the year 2009. He pursued a short course in business, and got a certificate.  Before Joseph started running his own business, he worked for a year at a filling station, working as a fuel attendant. He began running his own mobile money transfer business last year so that he could earn some additional income to cover his household expenses. His business is located in Lusaka, and it is his only source of income.

Joseph has requested a Kiva loan so that he can grow his business by increasing his working capital float. This is the money that Joseph uses to serve his customers who come to his shop to send/receive money and pay bills. 

Joseph has high hopes for his future; he dreams of opening up more mobile money outlets so that he can have the finances to take himself back to school to pursue a business degree. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to fund his mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand, iron bars and other items in order to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Los Kioneros Group

texts.es:
Maribel tiene  40 años separada, con un hijo que aún está en la escuela. Maribel trabaja en la venta de comida y gaseosas desde hace aproximadamente 15 años gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Su negocio está ubicado en una buena zona comercial. El  mayor anhelo de Maribel es dar estudio superior a su hijo. Maribel solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y gaseosas para su venta diaria. Maribel es la primera persona del lado derecho de la foto, viste polo de color fucsia.
Ella esta agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por haberle brindado el apoyo
texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old, separated and has a son who is still in school. Maribel has made a living selling meals and fizzy drinks for around 15 years and, thanks to this work, she has been able to support her family and offer her son a higher quality of life. Maribel’s business is located in an area with a lot of trade. Her biggest wish is to give her son an education. 

Maribel is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies for preparing meals, and fizzy drinks to sell. In the photo, Maribel is the first person on the right (wearing a pink top).

Maribel is grateful to Kiva investors for their support.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing meals, and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Rarotoga

texts.en:
Rarotoga is a 39-year-old woman with four children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Rarotoga has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business.  

Rarotoga hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, and a printing machine

loans.name: Aibu

texts.en:
Aibu is 32 years old. He is happily married and has three children ages 9, 6, and 1. His two eldest children go to school. Aibu describes himself as a simple humble man.

On any given day, Aibu can be found at his busy bottle store, where he sells Coca-Cola products at retail and wholesale to local retailers.  He describes his place of business as a place where people from all walks of life come to get their drinks. His business is located in a busy area in Lusaka. Aibu enjoys running the business because it is a good way for him to earn money and provide for his family. He also gets to interact with different people everyday, which he really enjoys. He says his community benefits from his business because they can order their drinks at a convenient place and do not need to go into the city to order drinks to sell. 

Aibu has applied for a Kiva loan to help him with his stock levels. He is taking out a Kiva loan so that he can purchase crates of soft drinks to increase his stock levels. 

Aibu is hopeful that the loan will help him grow his business. He explains that accessing capital is very hard in Zambia, and it has been tough to inject money into the business. He is grateful for the opportunity to be on Kiva. 

Aibu’s biggest dream is to one day expand his business to other countries in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Kadziche

texts.en:
Kadziche is a widowed woman, and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She  owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Kadziche operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Kadziche dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fund his mobile money transfer business and buy a sign for it

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and married with three children, twins aged 5 and a 2-year-old. Her hometown is Kabwe, located in the central province of Zambia. She operates her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, which is the capital city of Zambia. 

Elizabeth is a nurse by profession. She recently decided to start her own business because her salary was too low to sustain the needs of her growing family. When asked what she enjoys most about running her business, Elizabeth says providing a service to people who do not have bank accounts or are intimidated by the formal banking environment makes her feel like she is contributing a needed service for her community. She also gets enjoyment from being able to employ others now that she is a business owner. Currently, Elizabeth has one employee.  

Elizabeth is requesting a loan in order to pay for a trading booth, which will help her business become more visible and serve more customers at her shop. She is working with a very small amount of capital, which makes it difficult to service her growing customer base. She constantly struggles to serve particular customers. The loan will go to providing her the working capital needed to serve these customers, grow her business, and make the day-to-day operations of her business more efficient. 

Elizabeth is confident that she will be able to open additional mobile money outlets. In doing so, she will be able to earn more profits and take care of her family better.

loans.use: to buy a trading booth and increase her ability to service more customers in need of financial services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet

loans.name: Vai

texts.en:
Vai is a woman of 43 years with 7 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage, cucumber and eggplant in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. 

Vai has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals to help her with the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. Vai joined SPBD in 2008.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage, cucumber, eggplant), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Muafaka-Group Musoma

texts.en:
Edwin, who is in his early 40s, is married with six children, four boy and two girls who are still at school. He has been selling clothes door-to-door for 10 years now.  He works from 07am to 06pm daily, and is able to make a very small monthly profit.  

This will be Edwin's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase the clothes stock, and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to continue to increase the clothes stock.  He dreams of owning a wholesale price shop.

Edwin will share this loan with his loan group, "MUAFAKA-GROUP Musoma", which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the clothes stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the condition of her bathroom in order to create a more hygienic environment in her home.

loans.name: Linda Ebans

texts.es: Linda, tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con su madre y hermanos en el municipio de El Negrito Yoro.  Linda  lleva 8 años de experiencia apoyando a su madre  en la administración del negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, vende arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, carnes, verduras, refrescos, golosinas, pan, huevos, especies y también variedades. Con el fin de ver su negocio mas surtido y con variedad de productos  para cubrir la demanda, está solicitando un prestamo por 30,000 lempiras para comprar todo lo que son granos básicos, verduras, variedad de carnes, embutidos, pastas, refrescos, golosinas, manteca, huevos, medicamentos, productos de limpieza y otros abarrotes. De esta manera incrementará sus ganancias. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio para lograr mejorar el local y ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Linda is 21 years old, single and lives with her mother and siblings in the municipality of El Negrito Yoro. Linda has eight years’ experiencing supporting her mother in managing a grocery store where she sells staple goods. The business sells rice, sugar, beans, butter, meats, vegetables, soft drinks, sweets, bread, eggs, spices and other miscellaneous goods.

In order to further stock up her business and over a variety of products so meet demand, Linda is applying for a loan of 30,000 Lempira to stock up on basic grains, vegetables, a variety of meats, cold meats, pastas, soft drinks, sweets, butter, eggs, medicines, cleaning products and other groceries. This will allow Linda to increase profits.

Linda’s goal is to continue expanding the business in order to improve the premises.

loans.use: to stock up on basic grains, vegetables, a variety of meats, cold meats, pastas, soft drinks, sweets, butter, eggs, medicines, cleaning products and other groceries.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1983. She lives in a small town. She is divorced. She has one kid. She is a businesswoman. She has been doing business almost seven years. She serves brides. She is an honest, bright, purposeful person. 

Brides are coming to her salon to have a good wedding dress and making up their faces. 

She brings up her child alone. Also, she has an ill mother who needs a treatment in the hospital. The money which she earns from her activity is not enough to pay for the treatment of her mother. She is asking for financial support for the treatment of her mother.

loans.use: To pay for treatment of her mother

loans.name: Kasongo

texts.en:
Kasongo is 33 years old. She is single and has three children. She has been a Zoona mobile money transfer operator for six months. In August 2014, Kasongo used Kiva funds to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth. She is making good repayments on her Kiva loan and now hopes to get a new Kiva loan so that she can have essential transaction cash needed for her to grow her business. 

Prior to running her own business, Kasongo worked as a customer service assistant at one of the Mobile telecommunication firms in Lusaka, Zambia. She started her own company because she believes that her mobile money business is very useful for families in her community. Kasongo’s customers come from all walks of life, though the majority of them are unbanked. The Kiva loan will help Kasongo to serve customers who need to send and receive money from her trading booth. 

Kasongo has requested a subsequent loan so that she can serve her customers with much ease. She says the float in her business is not sufficient and as a result she constantly has to close her booth and make trips to the banks. This inconveniences her customers, as they sometimes find the booth closed. Kasongo is hopeful that once she gets her Kiva loan, she will be able to serve customers without a lot of problems and grow her business.

Kasongo’s dream is to take her children to good schools. She also hopes to employ people to help her at her shop as she currently operates the business alone.

loans.use: to provide essential funds needed for her to serve customers who need to send and receive money from her trading booth.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is 28 years old. He helps support his mother, his brother, and his sister financially. Asaph graduated from University of Zambia in 2010 and subsequently worked for the Ministry of Health. This experience allowed him to gain valuable management skills, which he has since put to use in driving his Zoona business. He has decided to go back to school, which he pays for through his Zoona business. His dream is to finish school and be able to finance it through his entrepreneurial success with Zoona. Asaph enjoys his Zoona business because it provides people with financial services they would otherwise not have access to. 

Asaph is requesting a loan in order to increase float. Float is the money that Asaph uses on a daily basis to serve his customers. He would also like to expand his business into other salient markets. 

He hopes to one day own and manage multiple outlets, while providing communities with access to financial services

loans.use: To add to the float to grow his mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide the essential funds needed for him to serve his customers at his shop, and pay for branding and shop signage

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 27 years old. He helps support his brother, who is in 11th grade financially. Harrison graduated from high school in 2008, and subsequently started running a small business after getting a loan from his uncle. This experience allowed him to gain valuable management skills, which he has since put to use in driving his Zoona business. His dream is to grow his business by owning a lot of Zoona mobile money transfer shops across the country, and seeing his brother through university.

Harrison enjoys his Zoona business because it provides people with financial services they would otherwise not have access to. 

Harrison is requesting a loan in order to increase the money that he uses to serve customers on a daily basis at his small shop. Currently, Harrison only has a float of $750, this is not enough to satisfy the demand from customers. 

The business is Harrison’s only source of income; he hopes to expand his business into other salient markets. He thanks Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To increase the money that he uses to serve customers on a daily basis at his small mobile transfer shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide the essential funds needed for her to start running her own Zoona Mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Cordelia

texts.en:
Cordelia is a single mother of three children. She is 36 years old and recently relocated from her hometown of Lusaka to set up her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Chingola, a town located approximately 430 kilometers away from her hometown. 

Cordelia believes in hard work. Every morning, she wakes up motivated by the fact that soon her business will grow bigger and enable her to take better care of her children. However, she faces a few challenges, one of which is a lack of working capital. She is currently operating her money transfer business with a minimum working capital of $1,000. This is hardly enough for her to serve her customers with ease, as she is constantly running out of cash and losing out on profits. The second challenge is that the booth she currently uses to operate her business is not hers. 

This is Cordelia’s first Kiva loan. She plans to use her loan to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth. The loan will also help her solve her problem of float. This will help Cordelia grow her business and bring in enough revenue to allow her to send money back home to her mother, who is currently taking care of her children while she settles down in Chingola.

loans.use: to buy a branded booth and increase the money she uses to serve people in her community who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 44-years-old and happily married with four children.  Three of his children are in school. He continues to grow his business of mobile money transfers thanks to the financial help he has accessed through Kiva. This will be Moses’s second loan from Kiva. He is happy with how the business has given him the opportunity to send his children to school and pay his rental costs.

Moses used his first Kiva loan to increase the money in his business so that he could serve more customers. He was able to serve more customers and generated more profits and now runs his business with more confidence. He has opened his second outlet in Walamo Township. Moses says from the time he got his fist loan; his personal life has also improved because his profit margins have improved.

Moses is applying for a second Kiva loan to boost his working capital at his new Zoona outlet. This will help Moses to grow his mobile money business to service more customers at his new outlet who need financial services.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona money transfer business by adding to the money that he uses to serve people in need of financial service.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Godfrey. He is married and has three children, ages 9, 7 and 3. His two older children go to school. Godfrey says he struggles to take care of his wife and children. He recently completed training with Zoona to start running his own mobile money transfer so that he can have an income and realize his dream of running his own business. 

Godfrey is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a Zoona branded booth where he can operate his business.  The loan will also provide essential funds needed for Godfrey to serve his customers. The business will enable people in his community to send and receive money in a safe environment. He says the banks are very far from his location and as such people have to go long distances to access financial services.

Godfrey is hopeful that once he gets his Kiva loan, he will be able to earn an income that will make providing for his family much easier. He explains that, with his children in school, he needs to be able to pay their school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded trading booth and have the essential funds needed to serve people in need of financial services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a branded booth and provide essential funds needed for him to serve his customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to re-model their home.

loans.name: Redge

texts.en:
Redge is 37 years old. He provides for his family, including his wife and their two children, who are 11 and 3 years old. His eldest child goes to school. He has largely provided for his family through working a full time job in agriculture until he decided to diversify by becoming a Zoona agent in the hopes of strengthening his financial stability. 

Being a Zoona agent allows him to better support his family. By opening his outlet, Redge has been able to provide his community with accessible financial services, meaning that they no longer have to travel long distances. He has also empowered members of the community by employing them at his outlet. Redge hopes to someday open more Zoona outlets in areas where his services would dominate over the competition. 

Redge is requesting a loan in order to have essential transaction funds to service customers at his trading booth, so that he can invest the profits in his longer-term projects, such as opening more Zoona outlets and growing his business. 

Redge is grateful for this opportunity to be connected to Kiva lenders. He is hopeful that through this connection, he will improve his standard of living and that of his family.

loans.use: To provide essential transaction cash needed for him to serve people in need of financial services in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, glue, pipes, elbows, bricks, rebar, etc. to repair the plumbing in his drinking-water system and to build a retainment wall

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a woman 43 years old with 8 children. She owns and operates a small business selling cabbage, cucumber and eggplant in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Rosalina has requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals to help her with the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. Rosalina joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel and chemicals

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 30 year-old-married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and parents in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. Mahmoud would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.
Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to decrease the electricity usage. 
Mahmoud appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Dinia

texts.es: Doña Dinia es una señora soltera madre de familia, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida. Sin embargo el congelador donde guarda la comida se daño, por lo que ella necesita de un préstamo de un millón cien mil colones (1.100.000) para comprar otro congelador y otros productos básicos para preparar los alimentos. Ella desea lo mejor para sus hijos, y este negocio le ha ayudado a generar los ingresos suficientes para alimentar a su familia, por lo que la compra del congelador es de suma importancia para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Doña Dinia is a single mother; she has a small business that sells food. However the freezer where she keeps the food was damaged, which is why she needs a loan of one million one hundred thousand colones (1.100.000) to buy another freezer and other basic products to prepare the food. She wants the best for her children, and this business has helped her generate enough income to feed her family, which is why the purchase of a freezer is of utmost importance for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a restaurant freezer.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Don Rodolfo es un joven emprendedor padre de familia, el es el único ingreso con el que cuenta su familia y ha tenido problemas para conseguir empleo, es por ello que el desea poner un pequeño restaurante en la comunidad que le sirva para generar los ingresos para darle el sustento a su familia. El solicita un préstamo de un millón cien mil colones (1.100.000) para comprar los utensilios y materiales necesarios para empezar su negocio. Con este negocio el va a poder ayudar a su familia y darle la calidad de vida que desea.
texts.en: Don Rodolfo is a young entrepreneur and father; he is the only source of income that his family has, and he has had trouble finding work. This is why he wishes to open a small restaurant in the community which would help generate income to support his family. He is asking for a loan of one million one hundred thousand colones (1.100.000) to buy the necessary utensils and materials to start his business. With this business, he will be able to help his family and give them the quality of life he wishes for them.

loans.use: to buy materials and utensils to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Salama is early thirties old, not married, and has got two kids who are in school. She has been taking care of her family with a business of selling charcoal. She has had this store for two years now, working from 08am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, paid back in full, to replenish the supply of charcoal at her store. 

Salama received some extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses for her kids. Her dream is to open another charcoal store so as to maximize her income. She will invest her new credit to buy sacks of charcoal to sell at her store. 

Salama will share this loan with her group, Wazo Tegeta, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell at her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with three children, two of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 57 years old.

Marilyn has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothes to sell for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 3 years.  She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes to sell for her business

loans.name: Quifel

texts.en:
Quifel is 30 years old, married and has one child, who is attending school. .

Quifel is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Quifel requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Quifel has been in the agricultural business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Gina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

NWTF is presenting Gina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are in school. Corazon is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for ten years.

Corazon requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josen

texts.en:
Josen is very pleased to have fully repaid his first two Kiva loans. He would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for their help. 

Through the loans he has been able to increase his profit margins and recently procured a simple tablet to help him make his transactions faster. 

He is now opening another Mobile money transfer outlet in his hometown of Chingola. 

Josen is 38 years old. He is married and has two children. His children are 17 and 18 years old. They are both in high school.

Josen says the two loans he got from Kiva helped him increase his working capital float, which enabled him to serve more customers, as he had more money in his business. This helped him to increase his profit margins. 

He saved up some of his profits so that he can open a new outlet and keep growing his business.

Today, Josen is taking out a subsequent loan so that he can purchase a trading booth for his new location. He has already trained one person to start working in the location and is convinced that the outlet will be successful, because there is a high demand for people to send and receive money safely.

Expanding the business will help to improve Josen's standard of living. He says it will also help him save towards his children’s college educations, as it is very expensive. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.

In this photo, Josen poses at his shop with the tablet he purchased from his profits to help him process transactions faster.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth for his new location so that he can grow his business and serve more customers who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a divorced woman with one child who does not attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat to the community. She faces the major challenge of transportation in her business

With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats for selling their meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for selling their meat.

loans.name: Uputo

texts.en: Uputo is a 43-year-old woman with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Uputo has requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Uputo hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is a 36-year-old mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips, sandwiches and Twisties in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Toafa has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, a box of Twisties, bread and a box of tinned fish to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business in the near future. Toafa became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, a box of Twisties, bread and a box of tinned fish

loans.name: Valaauina

texts.en: Valaauina is a 39 year-old-mother with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Valaauina has requested for a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, bottles of mushroom soy sauce, a sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, and aluminum foil for her business. She has operated this business for more than 2 years and she hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profits. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausage, bottles of mushroom soy sauce, a sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, and aluminum foil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new solar system for heating water and a tank for his home.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 44 year-old-baker. She is a divorcee and since then she has been taking care of her family of three children. Her kids goes to school. She has to wake up early in the morning preparing them for school. Anna decided to engage in the bakery business where she bakes cakes and bread and has done so for the last ten years. She works from 07 am to 09 pm each working day and is able to make a good profit every month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, as Kiva partner, this is her second credit request, wishing to improve her business with baking ingredients and better baking equipment. She used the previous loan to buy baking items; baking flour,cooking oil and other ingredients. Anna has paid back her loan in full. She received some extra income, which she used to pay for her family expenses. In the coming days she would like to manage a business located in a congested area and containing a large cooking room. 

With her new credit, she will buy baking flour and other baking ingredients. She will be responsible for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy baking flour and other baking ingredients.

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en:
Jemelyn works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a food processing business in the Philippines. Jemelyn has been in this business for 8 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport.

Susan has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetable.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport

loans.name: Garun

texts.en:
Garun is 41 years old and he lives in the village Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Garun is married and he has two school-aged children. From his very young age till to today, and now with his nice wife, Garun is engaged in farming and agriculture. In his farm Garun takes care of cows, calves, sheep, lambs, a pig and a bull. His farm products such as milk and great assortment of meat he sells from his farm to his loyal customers, the city butchers. Garun also cultivates potatoes, the greatest part of which he sells and makes money for his family's needs.
Garun asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams since all the stored fodder for his farm cattle for the winter period is gone and he wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle, in a quantity that will be enough till the spring months.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling native mats in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase raw materials for this business.

Elma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Elma's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her native mat business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 55, is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. One of her children is still in school.

Teresita has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables like bananas, oranges, apples, cabbages, and carrots to sell in her food stall

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like bananas, oranges, apples, cabbages, and carrots to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Angel 3 Group

texts.en:
Angle 3 is the same group which took out the first loan from Kiva lenders. This group consists of five women who are named Neama, Saeda, Aetemad, Shadia, and Najah. They hadn't completely paid back the first loan but applied for a concurrent loan of 180,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Neama is the same leader of the first group who applied for a first loan to purchase incense, perfumes, and women's clothes to resell. She thanks Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan which helped her very much in enlarging her business. 

She didn't finish the repayment of all the installments of the first loan before she applied for a concurrent loan of 60,000 YER from Kiva lenders to enlarge her business through purchasing sugar, tangs, and some drinks to make ice-cream to sell along with her first business.

Neama hopes this loan will be funded, too.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tangs and some drinks to make ice-cream to sell.

loans.name: Balqis Group

texts.en:
Balqis is the same group which received the first loan from Kiva lenders. It consists of the same members of the first group. They have repaid the first loan and applied for a new loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva lenders. All members thank Kiva lenders for there first loan.
Shafiqa is the leader of the group. She is a 28 year-old-married woman, living with her family in a rented house. She has a diploma certificate. Due to the high rates of unemployment in the country, Shafiqa doesn't have a job to look after her family, so she decided to run a sewing business inside her house. She has a small amount of equipment and little capital. After she finished the first loan from Kiva lenders, she applied for a second one of 60,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase new stylish fabrics to sew and sell to the women in her area.
Shafiqa looks forward to purchasing all kinds of stylish, new women clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase new stylish fabrics to sew and sell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products like milk, rice and wheat

loans.name: Fofoaivaoese

texts.en:
Fofoaivaoese is 59 years old with one child. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. 

Fofoaivaoese has requested a loan to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubes, taro roots, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, hand gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals

loans.name: Moetoto

texts.en:
Moetoto is a 54-year-old mother with 6 children. She operates a small business of selling pancakes, buns and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. 

Moetoto has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags to help her run the business. 

She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future and provide for her children's needs. Moetoto became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags.

loans.name: Lucelyn

texts.en:
Lucelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lucelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business, like meat, spices, flour, etc.

She has been in this business for years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business, like meat, spices, flour, etc.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 22 years old and he lives with his mother in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Sargis is a student at the Gavar State University, at the faculty of Jurisprudence in the paid division. Sargis now simultaneously works at the police station, in this way trying to support his mother financially. Sargis’ mother works at the charity canteen with a very cute salary. For this small family, Sargis’ tuition fee is a great problem which seems to be unsolvable. 

Sargis asks this loan in an amount of 160,000 Armenian drams in order to pay his tuition fee for the second semester. This will greatly lighten their family’s hard financial state.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn is 31 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Judilyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Judilyn has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Judilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Princess is 34 years old, and both of her children are currently in school.

Princess has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business, in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock -- for example, ready-to-wear pants, shirts, and t-shirts.

Princess has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear pants, shirts, t-shirts, and the like.

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en:
Rizalie is a 44-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 16 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Rizalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a perimeter wall to guarantee security at her house.

loans.name: Los Vencedores Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento LOS VENCEDORES compuesta por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, mecánica,  venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.

Cirila es la presidenta del banco ( en la foto la señora que se encuentra sentada), ella tiene 30 años de edad, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 3, 15, y 10 años su negocio es el comercio y crianza de cerdos.
Ella es independiente, responsable, y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad del ‘Torno’ una localidad rural que agrupa a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc.,y comerciantes revendedores mayoristas que se encargan de vender esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.

Cirila es de tez morena, estatura alta, cabello negro, habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre la cual se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es el comercio de cerdos; ella cria y engorda para los cerdos para su posterior venta en la feria de la localidad,  Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea realizar una inversión en el comercio de crianza de cerdos realizando la compra de cerdos. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Cirila solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para ampliar su granja y también para la compra de alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank, Los Vencedores, is made up of ten members- eight women and two men. They make a living from different activities, such as: fruit sales, juice sales, a mechanic, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, food sales, and vegetable sales. For this reason, they are requesting a loan to grow their businesses.

Cirila is the president of the bank (in the photo, she is the woman who is seated). She is 30 years old, married, with three children who are 3, 15, and 10 years of age. Her business is commerce and raising pigs.

She is independent, responsible, and hard-working. She performs her business in the town of “Torno,” a rural town that brings together farmers who produce meat, milk, vegetables, grains, etc., and wholesale retail traders who are responsible for selling those products in different markets in the city. It has a warm tropical climate that is very humid, with an ambient temperature of approximately 30 degrees centigrade during the whole year.

Cirila has dark skin, is tall, has black hair, and speaks Spanish. She lives her life in the home of her mother, who makes a living from agriculture. They live in an adobe house that has electricity and potable water. Her business is the sale of pigs. She raises and fattens the pigs to later sell in the town market. Her dream is to improve the quality of life of her family and she wishes to make an investment in the business raising pigs by purchasing pigs. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years that she has performed this work.

For these reasons, Cirila is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to increase her farm and also to purchase nutritious feed.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and to purchase nutritious feed.

loans.name: Ñaupasunchis Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñaupasunchis” el banco está ubicado en el departamento de  Cusco.
 Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

La socia Justina tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera salir adelante.
La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar aceite, arroz entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Ñaupasunchis” communal bank which is located in the department of Cusco. The members are grateful for the opportunity offered them and promise to comply with the payment of their loan in the established time-frame.

Justina is 38 years old and is single. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar and milk amongst others. She has been doing this work for quite some time and things are going well thanks to the dedication she brings to her work each day. She want to be able to continue her work ans
d in this way get ahead.

She needs the loan to buy oil and rice amongst others. Justina is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of the installments of the loan.

The members who are in the adjoined photos asked permission to arrive late due to their work commitments.

loans.use: to buy oil and rice amongst others.

loans.name: Rodelyn Anne

texts.en:
Rodelyn Anne works hard to support her family. Rodelyn Anne is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Rodelyn Anne requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Rodelyn Anne has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is greatly thankful to all the Kiva lenders for supporting him already once (definitely at this period of time) and now again he hopes to have financial help for paying his son’s tuition fee. 

Gagik lives with his family in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Gagik still works at the police station, and his wife works at the kindergarten. Their smallest son is still in the army, but he will be back very soon; and their elder son is still a student of Gavar State University at the Faculty of Jurisprudence in the paid division.

Gagik says that it will also be really great if this time Kiva helps him with loan in order to pay his son’s tuition fee again for the second semester. He and his family offer great thanks beforehand for the loan amount.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of drinking water to sell to customers.

Ailen successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Ailen's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of drinking water to sell.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres San Marcos forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por un mejor porvenir de sus seres queridos y también por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
María es integrante de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas que ella misma se encarga de hacer y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por poder mejorar cada día, todo esto gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo que hace.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos para poder hacer sus empanadas para vender, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos, discos de empanadas, huevos y otros, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres San Marco (Women of San Marco) group is part of a program to eliminate poverty. All members are female heads of household who are fighting for a better future for their loved ones and also to improve their own standard of living.

María is a member of this group. She sells empanadas which she is in charge of making and later sells on the street. She is a hardworking woman struggling to improve every day through her work and effort.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy products such as meat, chicken, condiments, empanada rounds, eggs and more for making empanadas to sell. This will help her keep her business growing.

loans.use:
buy supplies such as meat, chicken, condiments, empanada rounds, eggs and more for making empanadas for sale.

Comprar insumos para hacer empanadas para la venta, como ser: carne, pollo, condimentos, discos de empanadas, huevos y otros

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE UNIDOS TRIUNFAREMOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Karin tiene 31 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,colonias,perfumes entre otros, la socia vende a pedido para sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,famialires entre otros,, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia a la vez trabaja en una institución pública, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, venta de frutas, abogados y trabajadores del sector público.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Karin belongs to the communal bank Siempre Unidos Triunfaremos. The bank is located in the Cusco district the Cusco department. 

Karin is 31 years old. She has 2 children and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities, making a living from the sale of beauty products, such as creams, colognes, and perfumes, among others. She sells by orders from her customers, such as friends and family members, among others, who make requests. She feels thankful for the loan awarded and promises to make the established payments. At the same time, she works in a public institution, and so brings her family out ahead.

She is requesting the loan to purchase women’s perfume.

The other members make a living from clothing sales, fruit sales, as lawyers, and as public-sector workers.

The member who is in the attached photo asked for permission to come late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to purchase women's perfume.

loans.name: Dina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de contadora, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the communal bank Buenos Amigos. She alternates her daily activities, making a living from her accounting career. She has worked for a long time at this job, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she applies each day to her work. She wishes to be able to continue working, and so continue to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase a computer.

She feels thankful for the loan awarded to her, and promises to make her established payments.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Rosa Mística Group

texts.es: Rosa Mística es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socios laboriosos que solicitan una vez más el financiamiento en ADIM para sus negocios con el objetivo de seguir creciendo en el ámbito de los negocios. Quien lo coordina es Luis un hombre que ha luchado para ofrecerle mejores condiciones a su familia, se ha dedicado desde hace diez años a la comercialización de prendas de oros a los pobladores de su comunidad. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de prendas de oro como es anillo, pulceras, cadenas, chapas, etc., y de esta manera cubrir la demanda que tiene estos productos, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la clientela por lo que sus ingresos han mejorado. El resto de las integrantes zonas señoras, Yovana de 39 años de edad y ofrece el servicio de comida en su domicilio desde hace diez años, y Berta quien tiene la edad de 41 años su negocio es la comercialización de carne de pollo en la municipalidad desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
Rosa Mística Communal Bank is made up of three hardworking members who are requesting a loan from ADIM once again for their businesses.  Their goal is to keep on growing with their businesses.

The coordinator is Luis, a man who strives to give his family better living conditions.  He has worked for ten years selling gold jewelry to the residents of his community.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy gold jewelry such as rings, bracelets, necklaces, gold plate, and so on.  That way he can cover the demand for these products.  With the previous loans he managed to expand his clientele, which improved his income.

The other members are Yovana, 39, who has provided food service in her home for ten years, and Berta, 41, whose business for four years has been selling chicken meat in the town.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to cover his product demand

loans.name: Jose Wilmer

texts.es:
Jose Wilmer tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales como sustento principal.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de mecánica de motos, cuenta con más de 01 año de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para realizar la compra de herramientas de trabajo, aceites y lubricantes para implementar su negocio, con esto Jose Wilmer espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Wilmer is 41 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own house with his wife and children in the district of La Matanza, located in the province of Morropón, Piura region, on the North Coast of Peru. Life in this district is quiet. The inhabitants work in agriculture, raising cattle and small animals as their principal sustenance.

Jose Wilmer works offering his services as a motorcycle mechanic. He has more than one year experience in the business and has very good personal and labor references in the area. The loan will be used to buy work tools, oil and lubricates to use in his business. Doing this Jose Wilmer hopes to provide better service to his clients which will be reflected in his level of income. This will allow him to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools, oil and lubricants to use in his business.

loans.name: Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.fr: Wabigwa est commerçante, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Tusonge Mbele», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un militaire, âgée de 48 ans, mère 7 enfants, tous  étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires sur une rue de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en patates douces, pommes de terre, fretins, huiles, arachides, tomates, braises etc. Elle  souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Wabigwa is a merchant, and the treasurer of the "Tusonge Mbele" credit group, which is a client of the Hekima MFI. Married to a soldier, she is 48 years old, and the mother of seven children, all in school.

She started her business with funds received from her husband. She has been a street vendor of food products in the city for the past 10 years. She will stock up on sweet potatoes, potatoes, small fry, culinary oils, groundnuts, tomatoes, charcoal, etc.

She wants to increase her turnover, build a house and educate her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for supporting non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Stock up on sweet potatoes, potatoes, small fry, culinary oils, groundnuts, tomatoes, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en: Lilly is a 45-year-old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling pancakes, pork cakes and buns in her village to earn a living. Lilly has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, and yeast to help her run the business. She hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. Lilly joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, plastic bags, yeast

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Las Golondrinas está integrado por 16 mujeres que están en su 3er ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, cada una tiene una actividad productiva en la que se esmeran cada día.
Las 17 señoras que integran este grupo están haciendo su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder ir creciendo. Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Antonia, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas, que hoy por hoy tienen mucha demanda, comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar mayor variedad de prendas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called “Las Golondrinas” (“The Swallows”) includes 16 women, who are in their third cycle with the program for female entrepreneurs. Each one has a business in which they make a lot of effort everyday. The 16 women who make up the group are taking a survey about eliminating poverty to be able to go forward. 

One person that stands out is Mrs. Antonia, who sells used clothing. Day after day, she has a lot of demand. She says that she has very good clients.

She requests this loan to be able to buy a bigger variety of clothing. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales as they have been. She is thankful for the opportunity that all of them are receiving, and it will help them a lot.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Poposavaii

texts.en:
Poposavaii is a 56-year-old mother with six children. To earn a living, she owns and operates a small business, selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Poposavaii has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. 

Poposavaii joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yaneth continua dedicándose al negocio de venta laboratorio fotográfico, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien y le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de rollos, cámaras  entre otros.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the “Buenos Amigos” (“Good Friends”) communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Yaneth continues working in her photo lab business. She is thankful for the loan offered and promises to comply with all of the repayments. She is a responsible and diligent person.
