She continues working in her business, which is going well and brings her personal satisfaction. She feels that in this way, she will be able to take her family forward. 

She requests a loan to buy rolls and cameras, among other things.

loans.use: to buy rolls and cameras, among other things.

loans.name: Wiñay Huayna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WIÑAY HUAYNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gavina ella es viuda y tiene 68 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz,fideos, azúcar, leche y galletas.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de huevos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de tejidos.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank “WIÑAY HUAYNA,” located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Gavina, one of the members, is a widow. She is 68 years old and has four children. She owns a restaurant and a grocery store, where she sells staple food such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She wants to get ahead with the help of her business. She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman, and her dream is to expand her business.

Gavina is requesting a loan to buy rice, noodles, sugar, milk and cookies.

The remaining members work selling eggs, clothes, groceries, or woven fabrics. The members who appear separately from the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting because they had requested permission to arrive late for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio  tiene 29 años de edad es soltero y tiene 03 hijos, el socio continua trabajando como maestro de obra, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, él socio continua trabajando ya que mediante su trabajo él apoya a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas .
texts.en:
This is one of the members of the communal bank “Buenos Amigos” [Good Friends], located in the Cusco district, Cusco department. He is 29 years old and has three children. He continues to work as a master builder and appreciates the loan he received. He promises to pay all the installments on time. He is a responsible and persistent person. He works continuously in order to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosa Maria  continua con su  negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
This is one of the members of the communal bank “Buenos Amigos” [Good Friends], located in the Cusco district of the Cusco department.

Rosa Maria continues to sell clothes. She appreciates the loan she received and promises to pay the installments on time. She is still selling her products to different customers, such as friends and relatives. She is a responsible person who can support her family thanks to this business.

Rosa Maria is requesting a loan to buy sweaters, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, among other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Asociacion Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Asociación sin frontera lo integran tres mujeres laboriosas que solicitan por vigésima ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM para su negocio. Lo coordina la señora Lidia de 44 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la comercialización de artesanías en Catarina, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de hamacas, muñecas de barro, vestidos de manta, zapatos, etc., con los créditos anteriores le han permitido reinvertir parte de las ganancias en su negocio y otra parte destinarlas a los gastos familiares, esto la ha motivado para seguir solicitando los financiamientos. El resto de los miembros del grupo son las señoras, Socorro que tiene la edad de 56 años su negocio es la venta de papel para comida desde hace veinticinco años y Felipa una mujer de 55 años de edad comerciante de frutas en Tipitapa con una experiencia de veinticinco años.
texts.en: The communal bank 'Asociación sin fronteras' ('Association without borders') is comprised of three hard-working women who ask for the group's twentieth loan with ADIM. Lidia, coordinator of the group for this round, is 44 years old and married. She sells arts and crafts in Catarina. The loan will go towards purchasing hammocks, terracotta dolls, traditional clothing, shoes, and other items. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to invest part of her earnings back into her business, and to use the rest to pay for household expenses. This success motivated her to keep working with loans. The two other members of the group are Socorro, 56, who has been selling food-wrapping paper for twenty-five years, and Felipa, 55, a fruit vendor in Tipitapa who also has twenty-five years' experience in her field.

loans.use: to buy arts and crafts to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old, married and has five children. Her youngest child is still studying. 

Rosa was managing a store before, but she stopped it and shifted into raising hogs as a business. Rosa wants to make her hog raising business more profitable but has insufficient funds. That is why she is now asking for additional capital of 7,000 PHP to buy pigs, their feed and medicines for sustenance.

She hopes that continuously giving better nutrition to hogs will give her good sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy pigs, their feed and medicines for sustenance

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es:
Maria Maritza tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa como blusas, polos y pantalones, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener más amplio su negocio y poder incrementar sus ventas para atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, esto le generará mayores niveles de ingreso y le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Maritza is 28 and a single mother. She lives with her son in the district of Oyotún, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru. Life in the district is quiet. The local population mainly work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

She sells clothing for women, men and children. She has more than 5 years of experience in the business and has good personal references and work references in the area. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a greater quantity of clothing such as blouses, polo shirts and trousers, in order to increase the amount of stock for her business. This investment will allow her to increase the size of her business and improve her sales to cater for the different tastes and needs of her customers. This will generate a greater level of income and will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of clothing such as blouses, polo shirts and trousers, to increase the  amount of stock for her business

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES, Nyamvula wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Wend La Malgda Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA représente le groupe WEND LA  MALGDA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 29ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des céréales  depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 08 sacs de 100kg de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne  s'acheter une moto et mieux s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mamouna represents the Wend La Malgda group. She is doing very well. She is married and is the mother of seven children, the eldest of whom is 29 years old and the youngest 12. Three attend school and she has four persons to support.

Ms. has been selling cereals for the past 12 years. She resupplies at the market in her area. She wants to buy eight 100-kilo bags of maize.

She wants to reinvest the profits in her business. Her ambition is to buy a motorbike and take better care of her family.

loans.use: buy eight 100-kilo bags of maize

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is a 46-year-old innovative woman. Intisar used to read a lot about date seeds and its benefits, so she decided two years ago to start her experiments to find a way to make a product from those seeds that people can use to take its benefits. She tried many ways - boiling, frying, etc, and all failed. Then she looked at a seed, and thought that it looked like a coffee seed, so she decided to go through the process of making coffee using date seeds, and she succeeded. She produced decaf coffee from date seeds using home tools.
 
Intisar then used her savings and bought the equipment she needed to do the whole process. She rented a place to open a small workshop where she can work with her older children and start making coffee. She got the needed certificates that support the product and its quality. 

Now she is expanding to make a coffee powder that can be used in making sweets. Intisar is applying for a loan to help her buy a vacuum packing machine that will give her product a two year expiration period, instead of the six months based on what she is using today.

Intisar is a mother for five boys and a girl aged between 23 years old and 4 years old. Her two older sons help her in the business after work and school, to support their mother in her innovation and to make a small business for their family that they can expand step by step.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum packing machine to pack her decaf coffee product

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to dig a borehole and buy a water treatment plant to produce more sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate and expand his commercial toilet and bathhouse facility in order to support his family.

loans.name: Nilsa Isabel

texts.es: Nilsa tiene 21 años de edad agricultora y madre de familia de una niña. Ella termino sus estudios en de educación primaria y decidió aprender la actividad de cultivar granos básicos como maíz y frijoles a muy temprana edad siendo sus padres quienes la instruyeran y enseñaran los conocimientos y técnicas para llevar a cabo un magnífico trabajo. Sus clientes son las personas que viven en los alrededores de la zona donde ella habita como las bodegas y pulperías aledañas. El apoyo que ella recibe para desempeñar dichas actividades son sus padres y en ocasiones las diferentes personas que contrata para dar mantenimiento al mismo pues es necesario aprovechar el tiempo y recursos parta hacer un magnífico trabajo. Diariamente ella se desplaza hasta sus cultivos para dar el cuidado y atención que estos requieren para salir adelante, sacar buenas cosechas y hacer que sus cultivos sean beneficiosos por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara 8 QQ de urea, 8 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 7 litros de foliar, 7 litros de herbicida y el pago de mano de obra con lo que ara más eficiente el uso de estos insumos sobre su cultivo. Sus planes a futuro son algún día construir su casa de habitación donde ella y su hija puedan estar seguros y con tranquilidad de manera propia, darle una excelente educación a su hija para que ella pueda ser una persona de provecho y una mujer prospera en el futuro.
texts.en: Nilsa, 21, is a farmer and has a small daughter. After finishing primary school, Nilsa decided to learn how to grow basic grains (such as maize and broad beans). She started at a very young age and learned how to be a farmer from her parents, who taught her all the techniques and knowledge necessary to do a splendid job. Nilsa sells her harvest to businesses in the area, such as stockpilers and grocery shops. Her parents help her with her business, and she also hires farm hands from time to time to assist her in caring for the crops, since it is very important to employ time and resources effectively to reap a good harvest. Nilsa goes every day to her plot of land to tend to her crops very attentively in order to make them grow. She aims for an abundant harvest and profitable sales. This is why she asks COMIXMUL for a loan to buy eight quintals of urea, eight quintals of 12-24-12 formula, seven litres of foliar fertiliser, and seven litres of herbicide, as well as to hire farm hands to more efficiently use the above farm supplies. Her plans for the future include: building a house of her own one day for herself and her daughter in which they would feel safe and comfortable and giving her daughter an excellent education so she can become a successful and prosperous woman.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and hire farm hands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials for the completion of his commercial toilet business.

loans.name: Hilda Yamileth

texts.es: Hilda tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y no tiene la edad para estudiar. Ella está en unión libre y tiene un grado de estudio realizado de secundaria llegando hasta el tercer año de ciclo común básico gracias al apoyo económico de sus padres lo cual permitió que fuera posible. Como medio de ingreso económico en su hogar ella y su pareja se dedican a la siembra y cosecha de granos básicos maíz y frijol. En la comunidad donde ellos habitan el clima y la tierra son muy aptos para cosechar y en su familia la agricultura es un conocimiento que se pasa de generación en generación pues las fuentes de trabajo son escasas. Sus clientes son las diferentes bodegas que están situadas en los alrededores y en las comunidades aledañas siendo muy seguros ya que estos revenden en otros mercados el grano. La tierra que trabajan en familia es propia ubicada muy cerca de su casa de habitacion permitiendo esto hacer una mejor asistencia y el debido mantenimiento del mismo. Ella solicita apoyo económico para la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a que sus cultivos de maíz estén mayormente protegidos y más mayormente asistidos como: urea, formula 12-24-12, foliar, herbicida y el pago de mano de obra. Su meta es aprovechar al máximo su cosecha para poder cumplir sus sueños que son de poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y de hacer crecer su negocio para salir adelante y generar mayores ingresos en su hogar.
texts.en: Hilda is 22 and a mother of three. None of her children is as yet of school age. She has a common-law husband. She completed secondary education, up to the third year, thanks to her parents' financial support, without which she would have had to drop out. She and her husband grow and harvest basic grains, such as maize and broad beans. This is their only source of income. In the place where she lives, the climate and the soil are very good for farming, and being a farmer is in Hilda's blood, since it is a trade that is passed on from generation to generation, in an area where there are not many other options in terms of economic activity. She sells her harvest to various stockpilers in the area and neighbouring villages. This is a tried-and-tested circuit since the stockpilers then sell grain to other markets. The family owns their plot of land, located very near their house. which makes tending to the crops much easier and more convenient. Hilda is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies in order to protect her crops from disease and help their growth. She needs urea, 12-24-12 formula, foliar fertiliser, and herbicide, and also wants to hire farm hands. Her goal is to profit as much as possible from the sale her harvest, in order to make her dreams come true. She dreams of supporting her children through school and of making her business grow so as to increase the family's income and carve out a better life for all of them.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and hire farm hands.

loans.name: Maninoa

texts.en:
Maninoa is a 50-year-old mother with seven children and has a small business selling vegetables (cabbages, eggplant, and cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over two years. 

Maninoa has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, gloves and safety boots to assist her in running the business. Maninoa hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Азиза проживает в районе Спитамен.  Азиза замужем и имеет трое детей в возрасте 12, 8 и 4 лет, дети учатся в средней школе.  Она работает учительницей в средней школе уже более 6 лет, и она в свободное время занимается земледелием, где она имеет  0,20 Га земельный участок. Она сажает пшеницу и кукурузу. Ей в работе помогает ее муж и старший сын. 
У Азизе во дворе есть коровник, она планирует заниматься животноводством. Ей этой деятельностью нравится содержать домашние животное. Азиза берет кредит, чтобы купить  молодых  телят  для нового бизнеса. Она в будущем хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность. Азиза верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Aziza lives in the Spitamen region. She is married and has three children aged 12, eight and four, who are all in school. She has been working as a schoolteacher for more than six years and, in her free time, grows wheat and corn on her 0.2 hectare plot of land with the help of her husband and oldest son.

Aziza has a cowshed on her property and intends to start working in animal husbandry, since she would like to keep domestic livestock. She is taking out a loan to purchase young calves for her new business. In the future she wants to increase her head count of livestock and expand her business. She puts her trust in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Niño Jesus” está en su 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 17 Señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, lo que quiere decir que se encuentran en una pobreza extrema, luchando por mejorar.
La señorita Norma, es una de las integrantes y presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de su trabajo. Ella tiene una despensa que con sacrificio pudo montar y que hoy ya esta mas que firme gracias a que ella es muy amable y buena vendedora.
Norma pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos cárnicos, bebidas y verduras, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Niño Jesus" is in its second cycle of the Women's village bank program, where all pledge to work and help themselves among all to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where 2 of the 17 women are found below the poverty line, which means they are found to be in extreme poverty, fighting to improve.

Norma is one of the members and the president of this group. She is a woman who is striving to be able to get ahead and be able to improve her living conditions by means of her work. She has a general store which with sacrifice, she was able to start and today it's more than stable thanks to the fact that she is very friendly and a good saleswoman.

Norma is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of beef products, drinks and vegetables, and in this manner, be able to continue with her sales. 

She is thankful for this opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy beef products, drinks and vegetables.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella trabaja en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y apoya en los gastos económicos de su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del baño sanitario y para construir un muro perimetral. Con el monto solicitado comprará  cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc.
texts.en: Reina is 24 and lives in a house of her own with her family. She works at a company close to her village. This is how she supports her family and contributes to household expenses. She wishes to improve her living conditions and thus asks FUSAI for a loan in order to improve the bathroom and toilet and build a wall around her property. She needs to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and other such materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nyabange Grp Msm Group

texts.en:
George, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two daughters who are still at school.  He has been running two projects, a barber shop and selling cereals, for ten years now.  He works from 7 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be George's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more cereals and to buy barber shop products.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more rice, beans, maize grains, and peas to resell and to buy an up-to-date shaving machine.  He dreams of extending his business.

George will share this loan with his loan group "NYABANGE GRP MSM" which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, maize grains,  and peas to resell and to buy an up-to-date shaving machine.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: Vilma tiene 42 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace seis meses en su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sillas y mesas para brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. En el grupo “YAHVE YIRE” cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Vilma es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste polo cuello camisero blanco.
texts.en: Vilma, 42, lives with her partner and supports two children. She has been selling food at her house for six months. She will use the loan to buy tables and chairs to improve customers' comfort. She is the group's president. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Vilma is the second person from the right, wearing a white polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Marisol tiene 42 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda en donde implemento una parte de bazar y librería. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares por campaña.  En el grupo “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN” cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Marisol es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho viste chompa negra.
texts.en: Marisol, 42, lives with her partner and supports three children. She has a small shop at her house, part-bazaar and part-stationery shop. She will use the loan to buy school supplies. She is the group's treasurer. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Marisol is the first person from the right in the back row, wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to keep investing in her business.

loans.name: Las Hijas De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: “LAS HIJAS DE GUADALUPE” es un nuevo grupo. Que está conformada por socias dedicadas al comercio minoristas. Jessica tiene 36 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella inicio su negocio de venta de comida hace 03 años de manera ambulatoria luego ambiente una parte de su casa para poder expender sus comidas con mayor comodidad. El crédito lo invertirá en la renovación de vajillas cubiertos y una nueva licuadora. Su objetivo es aperturar su restaurant en una zona de mayor movimiento. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jessica es la que se encuentra sentada en medio.
texts.en: 'Las Hijas de Guadalupe' ('Daughters of Guadalupe') is a new group. The members are retailers. Jessica, 36, is single and supports two children. She started selling food three years ago. At first a street-vendor, she then set up a shop at her house because it was more convenient. She will use the loan to renew her cutlery and plates and to buy a new blender. Her goal is to open a restaurant in a busier part of town. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Jessica is the person sitting in the middle.

loans.use: to buy cutlery, plates, and a new blender.

loans.name: Tarynda Shamelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Tarynda  continua ejerciendo  su carrera de contadora, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to the “Buenos Amigos” (“Good Friends”) communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Tarynda continues working for her accounting career. She brings a good attitude dedicating herself to her work, which is going well thanks to the determination she puts in everyday to her work. She wants to be able to continue working, since this is how she supports her family.

She requests the loan to buy a computer.

She is thankful for the loan offered and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Lyzel

texts.en:
Lyzel is 37 years old and married with six children who are currently in school, Lyzel works very hard to provide for her family.

Lyzel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, soap, sugar, shampoo, etc.

Lyzel has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, soap, sugar, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Siran

texts.en:
Siran, from the village of Khdranc of Synik region, is seriously engaged in farming and agriculture.  She finds her big farm great and a perfect way of living close to nature, being healthy, and earning money for her family needs. 

Siran has big nice family; she has two sons and a daughter who is married and lives with her family. Siran's elder son works at a bread factory as a baker and her younger son is still school-aged. Siran says that she has a great army of helpers (her husband and two sons) about her farm so she wants to make it richer with animals. Now, in her farm she has four cows, four bulls, five sheep, 20 rabbits, a horse, 70 chickens and 25 beehives. 

Siran's plot of land and her greenhouse also expand the assortment of farm products that she sells. Siran’s husband has a track which he drives to the city’s wholesale market several times in a week, in order to sell their farm’s milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, meat, eggs, greens, cucumbers, tomatoes and peppers. Siran says that she enjoys her farming activities and she hopes that her son will be as laborious and as heedful towards their farm, which they established all together. 

Siran plans to use this loan amount on the purchase of several heifers in order to make  her nice farm richer.

loans.use: to buy several heifers in order to make her nice farm richer

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet John. He is a forty-one-year-old smallholder farmer from Ruiru village in the Central region of Kenya. Like most farmers in the region, John practices mixed farming. He keeps dairy animals and grows maize among other crops. He has been doing this work for a decade now. Over the years, he has come to like farming because it is a sustainable and self-fulfilling investment.

Farming doesn’t take all John's time, so he is also able to attend to his salary-paying job. A delicate balance of both jobs has enabled him to comfortably raise his two children. John is seeking a loan to purchase poultry and construct a chicken coop. He is ready to get into commercial production for meat, eggs and, perhaps, feathers. This business is very profitable but it doesn’t require a license, a big space or product marketing. There is an established market for poultry products in almost all places around the world. Besides, chickens will bring many non-monetary benefits to John’s farm. Chickens will be great for his farm's compost because their poop is high in nitrogen; in free-range, they will naturally forage by scratching soil looking for bugs, which aerates the soil and breaks up vegetation for decomposition. 

John will also use your money to construct a chicken coop in order to make the raising of chickens easier. By putting all the chickens in one place, he can feed them consistently, track each one of them easily and more easily manage to collect eggs and manure. The coop will contain water containers and laying boxes for the health, comfort and safety of the chickens. When Juhudi Kilimo’s loan officer asked John how his family will benefit from the loan, he replied, “They will benefit from the income I get once I acquire the loan and buy the asset.”

loans.use: To purchase poultry and construct a chicken coop

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson, de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, es pescador artesanal y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica al comercio de mariscos.- 

Nelson, también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, para la sostenibilidad de su familia y en algunos casos también comercializa parte de su cosecha.

Nelson, la pesca la aprendió desde que tenía 12 años de edad y fue su padre quien lo indujo a aprender, como también la siembra de granos básicos.  
  
Nelson, utilizará el dinero del crédito para compra un motor de 15HP y para comprar redes de pescar, para obtener mejores resultados en su trabajo.  

Nelson, sueña con tener un buen equipo de pesca, como también arreglar su vivienda para mayor seguridad.- Y que sus hijos logren estudiar a nivel superior.
texts.en:
Nelson, 35, went to school until the fifth form. An artisanal fisherman, he lives with his wife and two children, aged seven and three. His wife is a fishmonger. 
Nelson also grows basic grains in order to diversify the family's sources of food. He also sells part of the harvest when conditions allow.
Nelson learned to fish when he was twelve, at his father's knee. Farming he also learned from his father. 
Nelson will use the loan to buy a 15 HP engine and fishing nets, supplies he needs to fish more efficiently. 
Nelson's dream is to have decent fishing implements as well as to improve the security of his house. He also wants his children to reach a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy fishing implements.

loans.name: Petrono

texts.es:
Petrona,  de 62 años de edad, no estudió, es viuda, su esposo falleció hace 9 años, vive junto a una nieta de 14 años de edad; tiene dos hijas, pero cada una ya tienen sus nuevos hogares.

Petrona, siempre se dedicó a los oficios domésticos, pero su esposo le enseño acerca de la agricultura, y fue de esa manera que cuando el falleció, ella tuvo la necesidad de comenzar a sembrar granos básicos.
  
Petrona, utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar arena, cemento y ladrillos, para la construcción del muro perimetral de su vivienda, para evitar que el agua lluvia cause daños más grandes. 

Petrona,  sueña con arreglar bien su casa, para mayor seguridad de ella y de su nieta.- Además, desea que su nieta se gradué de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Petrona, 62, never went to school. She has been a widower for nine years. She lives with her granddaughter, aged 14. She has two daughters but they both already live on their own.
Petrona has always been a housewife, but was lucky to learn enough about farming from her husband that she could start growing basic grains when he died.
She needs the loan to buy sand, cement, and bricks, the aim being to build a wall around her house to avoid further water damage when it rains. 
Petrona's dream is to have a nice house that is safe for her and her granddaughter to live in.- She also wishes for her granddaughter to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a 55-year-old mother of five children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancakes, pork cakes, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Luisa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoons, and a fry pan for her business. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Luisa joined South Pacific Business Development (Kiva's partner) in 2014.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared-foods business.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is a 49-year-old mother with six children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years to earn a living. 

Matalena has requested a loan to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, banana tubers, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and gloves

loans.name: Patron San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN JERONIMO II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth ella es soltera y tiene 50 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza un platos como salchipapas que es un plato a base de papa y salchichas,ella vende en una carreta en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como papas y salchichas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The community bank Patron San Jeronimo II is located in the district of Cusco, in the department and province of Cusco.

Elizabeth is a member of the community bank.  She is single, 50 years old, and has five children.  She works selling food.  She makes dishes such as "salchipapas", which is a dish made from potato and sausage.  She sells as a street vendor from a cart.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm.  She has eight years of experience with this business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She will use this loan to purchase products to cook, including potatoes and sausages.

The other group members work at an Internet cafe, selling clothing, at a grocery store, and at a restaurant. 

Elizabeth thanks everyone who is a part of this dream and promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase products to cook including potatoes and sausages.

loans.name: Ketty María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Santa Marianita, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ketty, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 1 hijo mayor de edad y que viven con ella. Su esposo es mecánico. Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza.
Doña Ketty es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja casi todos los días 6 a 8  horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella también realiza trabajos de belleza en su casa ya que tiene un salón o a domicilillo también si sus clientes necesitan de algún servicio, tiene 14 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y productos de belleza. Lleva 1 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un gran SPA.
texts.en:
In the city of Carmen, every fifteen days, the "Santa Marianita" Village Bank meets. This place is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal raising, because it is an area with lots of vegetation.

Ketty lives in this place, she is 48, married, and from this relationship they have one son, of age, who lives with her. Her husband is a mechanic. Several years ago, she learned beautician skills.

Ketty is a homemaker who, to obtain her own resources, works selling Avon and Yanabal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories) and with this, is able to get ahead with the expenses of the home. She works every day, 6 to 8 hours a day. She leaves her products on credit and charges every eight days. She also carries out beautician work in her house since she has a room, or door to door as well if her clients need some service. She has been working at this activity for 14 years, with which she gets ahead.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and beauty products. She has been in this village bank for one year and she likes it because the loans are easy to do. Her dream is to have a large spa.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is 25 years old and is studying law. He chose this major because he wants to help people. Ayman is an ambitious person who wants to make difference. He had to work to help his family with household expenses, which delayed his last year at the university. Lately he faced some financial problems, so he has applied for an education loan to help him cover his university fees and to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees to study the English language.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is a 35-year-old mother of one child. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Lisa has requested a loan to buy taro roots, bananas, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. Lisa became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, bananas, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA,la socia continua  dedicándose al  negocio de picantería, la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solictan,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla community bank.  She continues working at her restaurant.  She is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and she promises to make her scheduled repayments.  

She continues to sell different types of food for her customers to order.  She is a responsible person since this is the way she supports her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase rice, meats, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio Walter se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de transporte. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member, Walter, continues with his transportation business. Through this business he wants to move forward in life. His dream is to expand his transportation business. The member is requesting the loan in order to buy tires for his vehicle. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 31 years old, married and has four children, two in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for six years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
This pretty lady is 30 years old and  lives with her parents in the city of Sevan,  Gegharkunik region. 

Armine has a higher education and was trained as a linguist.   She currently works in a place as a leading specialist. Armine’s father has a small business of his own and her mother is a housewife. 

Armine describes herself as a cheerful, active, and hard-working person, and the fact of feeling unwell recently greatly worries her. She says that she gets tired very early which is not typical for her.

This loan in an amount of 170.000 AMD will help her to have a proper medical examination and find out the cause of her illness.

loans.use: to have a proper medical examination.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26 years old lives in Irbid. He depends on himself; he completes his education at his own expense.

Mohammad is studying in one of the private universities, majoring in accounting. He works hard to achieve his dreams. He is working and studying at the same time. This causes him physical and mental fatigue. Also, he faced difficulties in his education years. It takes six years or more instead of four years.

He decided to leave his work to concentrate on his study. Therefore, he asked for an education loan to help him pay the university fees. Mohammad needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mbodze has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables, like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of KES 35,000 she is requesting, Mbodze wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur has been involved in retail since 2010. He purchases construction materials from the Yerevan wholesale market and sells it in the town of Kapan.
 
Artur lives with his wife and young daughter and is the breadwinner of the family. 

Artur will use the loan to  purchase construction materials and cover current orders of his customers,  He has been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products

loans.use: to pay for construction materials.

loans.name: Maurice's Group

texts.en:
Maurice is 56 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and represents a group of13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Maurice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He described his last harvest as very good but believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Maurice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Maurice's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher, who is retired from the army, is 37 years old, lives in Marka, and is married with three children. 
After he retired, his pension did not meet the needs of his household so he decided to start a business. He buys a large quantity of balloons and then his wife helps him divide the balloons into small quantities, putting them in bags to distribute to the market.
Maher wants to increase his income because his children are growing up with greater needs. He wants to expand and develop his business to raise the family's standard of living. He has requested a loan to buy more kinds of balloons and to develop his business. He is thinking about opening a balloon shop.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of balloons and to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help him pay university fees

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Doña Antonia es una mujer de 51 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella pues ellos están independientes y en hogares aparte. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad la siembra y cultivo de granos básicos Maíz y Frijol a muy temprana edad como único medio y fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia ya que ella es de descendencia muy humilde y trabajadora. Su grado de estudio es de primaria pero no pudo completarlo cursando hasta su tercer año ya que por la falta de recursos financieros no le fue posible completar sus estudios. Sus clientes son los diferentes dueños de bodegas que habitan en los alrededores de la zona donde ella vive. El la siembra y cultivo de maíz únicamente ella y su conyugue se involucran en ocasiones sus hijos por lo que la mayoría de veces se paga la mano de obra para hacer actividades extras que no son posibles debido al esfuerzo físico que muchas veces se realiza como la limpieza de maleza, y de la planta. Actualmente Doña Antonia solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como abonos, fertilizantes y otros como el pago de mano de obra para llevar a cabo un mejor trabajo sobre su plantación. Su meta es aprovechar al máximo su cosecha para poder cumplir cada uno de sus sueños incrementar sus áreas de cultivo, diversificación del mismo la siembra de café y frijol tanto rojo como negro entre otras que ayudarían a que sus ingresos incrementaran para mejorar el patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 51 year old woman.  She is the mother of three children, but none of them are dependent on her since they are all independent and live in their own households.  Her parents taught her how to plant and cultivate corn and beans at a young age, since it was their family's only source of income.  She is from a humble and hardworking background.  She attended primary school through her third year, but she was not able to finish her studies due to a lack of financial support.  

She sells her crops to different warehouses located in the outskirts of the area where she lives.  She plants and cultivates the corn herself and her husband and children sometimes help, but most of the time she pays laborers to do extra work that she can't do herself because of the physical effort.  This often includes weeding and planting.  

Antonia is requesting help to purchase supplies, including manure, fertilizers, and other items, and to pay laborers to do work on her land.  Her goal is to have a good harvest so that she can achieve her other goals, including increasing her amount of cultivated land, diversifying her crops with coffee and red and black beans, and others that will help increase her income so she can improve her family's assets.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and pay laborers to help with her corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fee at the university.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university tuition fee

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her tailoring business. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to cover their daily sustenance.

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy quantities of peanut butter to sell, which is her second business. Peanut butter is one of the favorite spreads of Filipinos; there is always peanut butter in almost all Filipino households. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the community where she lives. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and the financial help that will be given to her. 

Imelda hopes to grow her business of selling peanut butter and her tailoring business. She prays to stay healthy and strong. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for peanut butter

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 28 years old and married with two children who are still in school, Remy works very hard to provide for her family.

Remy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like bread, eggs, soap, and noodles.

Remy has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford her children to send to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like, bread, eggs, soap, and noodles.

loans.name: Taron

texts.en:
Taron lives in Agarak town with his parents, grandmother, and wife. He runs their family farm and gets income for the family's living. 
Taron, besides agribusiness, is also occupied in construction. He provides construction service for locals in Agarak town. Realizing how important this additional source of income is for the family, he would like to expand the construction work.
 
Taron asks for this loan to be able to purchase tools and equipment for providing construction service. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing construction service

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad, 53 years old, is a conservative woman so she asked her son to appear in the photo instead of her. Jihad lives with her husband and her children in Baqaa. Jihad is a housewife and does not work outside the home because she did not complete her studies. Her husband is working as freelancer.
Her son studies at a university majoring in English language, a major he chose due to local needs. Because he lacks cash, the tuition fee isn't paid. For this reason, Jihad is requesting a loan to pay her son`s tuition fee. As a result, her son will study hard without worrying about the fee.

loans.use: To pay her son`s university fees

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is 28 years old and lives in Amman. She is a conservative married woman who asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her.
Her husband has small sewing shop. Enas wanted to help her husband in his store so she decided to take a course to learn sewing.
She has since worked with her husband so he doesn't have to hire another employee, thus saving the money he would have to pay in salary.
She wants to expand the store to sell their products and increase their income instead of having the products distributed to other shops. Therefore, she asked for a loan to expand the store to sell their products and to buy a sewing machine

loans.use: To expand the store to sell their products and to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 34-year-old married, conservative woman.  She is married to Tariq Jamal Al deen and asked her husband to take her place in the photo. who was working in a laundry shop.

The owner of the laundry shop decided to sell his shop  so Tareq was forced to leave his job and be without work and income. He is the only provider for the family and decided to rent the same laundry shop and operate it by himself.   The laundry shop was very old and  the equipment  needs maintenance , 

He desperately wants to establish  his new shop so he does not lose his customers and every thing. His wife asked for a loan to help him buy new equipment, complete maintenance, and update his new shop .

loans.use: to help her husband purchase a dry cleaning machine and develop his shop.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawther Al Nu'aimat is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, her husband is in the Jordanian army.

She is ambitious and has goals for her life.  She has always wanted to be an  English teacher and is studying the English language, but she doesn't have enough money to cover her last semester fees.  She  seeks a loan to help her earn a bachelor's degree and develop her standard of living.  

She wishes to work and increase the family's income to guarantee a good life for her children.

loans.use: to pay her university fees because her parents are facing financial problems.

loans.name: Noong Het 12 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong, 29, is a Thai lady who has been married and become the mother of two boys, ages 1 and 9 years old. She lives happily with her husband along with her sons in a small Thai traditional house. They mainly rely on agricultural production for a living, including cultivating rice and raising pigs and musk ducks. 

Mrs. Thuong is a hard-working woman, and she has always tried to increase production to gradually improve income and living conditions for the family.

This is the fifth time she has received a loan from the program, and she will use it to buy piglets and musk ducks. 

Despite plenty of difficulties ahead, she still believes in the success of her investment, with the support of the socio-economic team of the program. 

Mrs. Thuong dreams of a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she wears a red coat and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and musk ducks

loans.name: Xayyam

texts.en:
Xayyam is a 30-year-old man. He is married and has two children. His children go to kindergarten and his wife works as nurse there.

Xayyam has been working in his shop for three years. He has many clients because people like his behaviour and he always looks happy. He sells rice, sugar, butter and so on. 

Xayyam always thinks about his family’s problems, but his income is not enough to live at a good level. His monthly income is 170 manat (AZN). 

Xayyam has decided to repair his shop and to install water in his shop because people like new-style things. If he realizes his plan, a lot of clients will come to his shop. Xayyam has applied for 1,000 AZN from Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his shop and to install water in his shop.

loans.name: Lefu

texts.en:
Lefu is a 40-year-old mother with two children. She runs and operates a small business of selling pancakes, buns, and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Lefu has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil to help her run the business.

Lefu hopes to build a small bakery store in the near future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is 42 years old and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Antonina has requested for a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, fry pan, and wooden spoon to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide her family's daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, vegetable oil, fry pan, and wooden spoon

loans.name: Melialofa

texts.en: Melialofa is a 33-year-old mother of two children. She owns and operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Melialofa has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. Melialofa became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a fry pan, plastic bags, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 39 years old, married and has six children, four in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF  to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Marivic has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Kdadija

texts.en:
Kdadija is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over nine years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling meat goats to the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is 35 years old and single. She lives in Madaba with her family which consists of nine persons. 
Abeer is an example of a helpful, ambitious, active and assiduous woman. Abeer always helps her siblings with the household expenses which are really high. 
She wanted to help her younger siblings with their education so she decided to start a small business. She buys accessories and cosmetics to sell to her neighbors and friends. She feels her business does provide help for her family. Therefore, she wants to expand her work.
Abeer asked for a loan to buy more products to sell and to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell and develop her business.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives and works in Stepanavan town. He has been working in construction for two years. Artur now asks for a loan to purchase a rotary hammer drill. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She and her husband live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 50,000 KES Hadija wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Maku

texts.en:
Maku is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Maku operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With a loan of Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik is a taxi driver. He purchased his car last year and since then has been providing taxi service to locals in Kapan town. 
Erik lives with his parents and works hard to help them to sustain the family. 
To be able to pay off the car which he purchased last year, Erik has applied for this loan.
He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEFIinternational. The start-up loan program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay off his car used for his taxi business

loans.name: Hudson's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Hudson, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to three children, known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Hudson joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvest season, Hudson plans to send his children to school.

Between the 11 farmers in Hudson's Group, a total of 5.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a water heater for the bathroom.

loans.name: Leah's Group

texts.en:
Leah is a 62-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Leah has noticed that she has learned a lot from her farming training.

Leah described her harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus) last year, but believes she can have a better crop this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, along with fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Leah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.en: Shahriniso is 52 years old, married and has three children who are studying at school. Her husband is a worker. She has her own grocery store which she started five years ago with her friend's help.  Due to her honesty, she has achieved a great deal but she wants to keep significantly developing her business. She wants to increase sales and in the future open a big grocery store. That is the basic reason why Shahriniso is requesting a loan. She hopes Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Bibirahima

texts.en:
Bibirahima is a friendly and honest woman. She lives in Tursunzoda town. She is 59 years old. Bibirahima is selling cosmetic products. Her husband is also engaged in business. They are very hard working people. 

She has 3 children and she always trying to improve their life. Bibirahima wants to expand her products and increase her profit. For this reason she is asking for loan. With your help she is planning to open her own shop. It is her dreams and  only with your help she can perform it.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 44-year-old married mother with five children who sells fruit, vegetables,  and chicken. She has been in this business for fifteen years to help her husband meet the needs and expenses of their family.

Mervat is a hard worker who makes sacrifices to develop her business and satisfy her children's needs.  She requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to purchase new  fruit and vegetables. She also wants to help her son to complete his house and add aluminum windows.

Mervat hopes to expand her business  in the future and provide her beloved family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia Lucia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de artes, pulseras entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como hilos, alambres entre otros.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the community bank, SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA. She continues to dedicate herself to the business of creating wearable art pieces, such as bracelets, upon request from her clients. 

She is thankful for the past loan she received and promises to pay off the established quotas. She hopes to continue working and support her family. 

She asks for a loan to buy materials such as thread and wire, among other items.

loans.use: to buy thread and wire, among other things

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business, producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

Estrella applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to cater to tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons, and sewing supplies.

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is a businesswoman from Napolan, Pagadian City. She is 68 years old, widowed, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Roberta is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Roberta continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has owned a food stall business for 2 years. She faces a major challenge maintaining a steady customer base, which influences the freshness of her products.

She will purchase sugar, rice, maize flour,  wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of working in a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
This young farmer’s name is Gegham, and he lives with his parents in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. 

Gegham is 26 years old and has a degree with a specialty in education. He worked for 3 years at the school as a teacher of physics. Now, he is seriously interested and engaged in farming and agriculture. His father is busy with his work abroad in the Russian Federation, while Gegham lives with his lovely mother, who is a housewife. 

On his farm Gegham has cows, calves, heifers, sheep, pigs, piglets, lambs, sheep, and chickens. This variety of animals also provides a great assortment of farm products. With his mother's help, he sells a great assortment of meat and milk and eggs from his farm. On his plot of land he also cultivates potatoes which he sells for a good profit. 

With the loan Gegham has requested, he wishes to purchase potato seedlings for spring sowing and fodder for his farm's cattle.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his cattle and potato seedlings for spring sowing.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is 20 years old girl and lives in Zarqa with her family of 7. 

Noor  is a university student majoring in Islamic science.  She chose  this major because of her  love for The Islamic culture , but unfortunately her economic situation did not allow her to continue her education.

Noor was very upset and sad because she was not able to settle her semester fees and continue her education. 
She had to make a decision to either continue or lose all of her previous efforts and paid tuition. 

Noor seeks a loan to get her certificate and start a job related to her field.  She will then  provide assistant for her extended family in the future and enhance their living standards.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.ru: Людмила, 63 года, вдова, дети взрослые, самостоятельные. С Людмилой живет ее внучка. У нее высшее образование, по характеру, ответственная, доброжелательная, вежливая. У нее большой опыт в торговой деятельности. Людмила занимается реализацией вержней одежды на рынке. Благодаря упорному труду Людмилы ее деятельность приносит около 35,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Людмила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку женской одежды для перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Людмила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить на ремонт квартиры.
texts.en: Lyudmila is a 63 year old widow, with adult children who live independently. Only Lyudmila's little grand-daughter lives with her now. Lyudmila has a college degree and is a responsible, polite and positive person. She has a lot of experience working in retail, as she sells coats and jackets at the local market. Due to her hard work Lyudmila earns 35,000 som (KGS) a month, which pay for the family's food and household necessities. In order to further expand her business activity, Lyudmila has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), which she will use to purchase women's clothing for resale. She plans to invest the profits from this expansion to further improve her store, and in the future save enough to improve her home as well.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes for resale in order to expand inventory and attract new clients

loans.name: Nursina

texts.ru: Нурсина, 55 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Нурсины средне-специальное образование. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Нурсина в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Нурсины имеется 43 овцы, 4 коровы, 11 коз и 2 лошади.  Доходы от хозяйства позволили Нурсине вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку cкота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем она хочет накопить на обучение ее детей в университете.
texts.en:
Nursina is 55 and married with four children. She has a specialist high school education and has been working in animal husbandry since 2000 as an additional source of income for her family. Her husband and children help her with the farming. Thanks to her hard work, she now has 43 sheep, four cows, 11 goats and two horses. Profits from the farm have allowed her to raise her children and give them all that they need. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Nursina has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing the size of her farm, and in the future wants to save toward her children's university education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Bazargul

texts.ru: Базаргул 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей, старшему сыну - 15 лет, младшие еще не ходят в школу. У Базаргул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Базаргул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 2 лошади, 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,20 Га собственной земли она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Базаргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота.
