Доходы от кредита Базаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Bazargul is 35 years old, married and is raising four children with her spouse. Her oldest son is 15 years old, while the youngest children are pre-school age. Bazargul has a high school degree and has been raising livestock and farming for the last 15 years. She started her farm by purchasing cattle with 5,000 som (KGS). Her hard work has allowed Bazargul to expand the herd, which now contain 4 cows, 2 horses and 10 sheep. She also rents 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land as well as owns 0.2 hectares (0.5 acres), where she grows oats. The monthly profits from the animals and the farm are 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further expand her farm, Bazargul has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS), which she will use to buy more cattle. She will invest the profits from this loan by continuing to expand her herd and hopes to save enough money to build a new barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has two clever kids. His children study at school, and his wife works in a hospital. He has been working in a bathhouse of the region for seven years. He lives in Imishli region. He is a very responsible man with his work. His monthly profit is 190 manat. It is his first loan with Aqroinvest CU.

Adil has a big problem about water. There is not water in his yard. Adil needs to buy a water pump and to construct a water system for his home. He carries water from his neighbor’s. But his profit can’t allow him to solve his water problem.

He requests 1,000 AZN from Kiva. He hopes lenders help him.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and to construct a water system for his home.

loans.name: Mbaghangu Samson

texts.en:
This borrower is married with seven children living in a five room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. He has had a lot of problems amongst which include sickness, death of family members and a son - who was of great support to his family. 

He is confident that the new grocery business he is starting will succeed because of his experience. It will help the community in providing raw food items such as coco, yam, beans, maize, Irish potatoes and plantain to the entire neighborhood and also provide manure at relatively lower prices.

He also wants to start rearing piglets and chicks, and this loan will enable him to buy some animals to start this new venture.

With the profit from this business, he will pay for his children’s school fees, and provide for his family's well-being and health care. He rather prefers to take his loan from GHAPE because the interest is low; the duration of repayment is really convenient not withstanding the non-financial services offered which include loan management and social networking.

loans.use: To buy food items as well as piglets and chicks

loans.name: Pardaxol

texts.en: Pardaxol is a fair and polite woman who lives in N. Khusrav district. For three years she has been engaged in the agricultural business. She is 49 years old and has three children. Her son helps her with her activity. She has a big land and there they grow cotton. It is the basic income for the family. Her husband is also involved in this business. They work on the land day and night to get a good crop of cotton. Now she is preparing to plant a new crop, but does not have enough money to buy high-quality cotton seeds. For this reason she is getting the loan. She wants to quickly begin to plant cotton, and in the summer get a good harvest so she can increase her family income and develop her activity. Pardaxol needs for your support and help.

loans.use: to buy cotton seeds.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat is a very fair and hardworking person. This is her second time applying to Kiva lenders. The first time thanks to your help and support she increased the count of livestock and developed her business. She adores her activity because it brings a good income. Saodat likes her animals and always takes care of them. With her activity she provides her family with dairy products. Today Saodat wants to significantly increase the count of livestock and to raise the level of her family income. It is the main reason why she wants to get a loan. She is grateful to you and hopes at this time you will help her too.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Charisima

texts.en:
Charisima is 33 years old. She is married, and the family lives in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Philippines.

Charisima is managing a direct-selling business. She sells products, such as soap, lotion, perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, cosmetics and others, for men, women and children. She has had this business for two years. She found it interesting because she can earn income in an easy way through her good and effective salesmanship.

She requested a loan to pay for more stock to offer more to her customers. Expanding her inventory would also mean an increase in her income.

Charisima has recently become a member of PMPC, in May of 2013. In the future, she hopes to arrange a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for more stock to offer more to her customers.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Evelyn Elizabeth

texts.es: Evelin de 22 años de edad es una mujer que se caracteriza por su sencillez y su espíritu luchador el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia  con su negocio de venta de tortillas la cual realiza en su vivienda desde hace 2 años. Ella vive con su esposo y su hijo de 5 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años. Evelin cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que no logra cumplir la demanda con la que cuenta ya que la plancha con la que cuenta es demasiado pequeña, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en una plancha para tortillas más grande y de esta manera espera lograr cumplir con la demanda de productos para obtener mejores ingresos económicos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Evelin, 22 years old, is a woman characterized by her simplicity and her fighting spirit which has allowed her to get her family ahead with her business selling tortillas, which she has done in her house for the past 2 years. She has lived with her husband and their 5-year-old child in their own house for many years. Evelin has a large number of customers who ask for her products, so she isn't able to meet the demand that she has, since the griddle she has is too small. For this reason, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in a larger griddle for tortillas and in this way manage to meet the demand for her products to get better income which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a larger griddle for tortillas.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 23-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarm city. He works as a farmer on his own land where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. Hussein takes care of his land and crops to insure he has good quality products.

Hussein took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, the farm productivity will increase and also the income.

Hussein appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Daniyar

texts.ru: Данияр, 47 лет, женат, 3 детей школьников. Образование у Данияра -средне-специальное, с 2004 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Данияра, на сегодняшний день он имеет хорошее хозяйство: 6 коров, 50 овец. Он продает экологически чистое молоко , также занимается полеводством, выращивая на собственном участке мерою 6,66 Га эспарцет, ячмень и картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль Данияра составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита Данияр планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, что позволит ему накопить на воспитание и обучение его детей.
texts.en: Daniyar is 47 years old, married and has three school-age children. He has a professional degree and has been farming and raising livestock since 2004. His hard work allowed Daniyar to own a herd of six cows and 50 sheep. He sells organic milk and also grows oats, potatoes and sainfoin(a feed plant) on his own land (6.66 hectares/16.5 acres). The monthly farming income is 15,000 som (KGS). In order to expand the farm, Daniyar has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy feed and hay for his livestock. He plans to invest the profits from the loan to further expand his herd and save for the education of his kids.

loans.use: to purchase feed and hay for livestock

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 49 years old, married and has four children, three still in school.

Emelyn is in the agricultural business raising chickens in the Philippines. Emelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Emelyn has been raising chickens for three years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Tumonbai

texts.ru: Тумонбай, 55 лет, женат, есть взрослый сын. У Тумонбая высшее образование, в поисках доходов для своей семьи он  начал заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря непосильному труду и терпеливому характеру Тумонбая на сегодняшний день он имеет хорошее хозяйство - 1 нетель и собственный участок мерою 0,37 Га, где он выращивает картофель для реализации. Он обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров для откорма и реализации. Прибыль от бизнеса Тумонбай планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее его увеличение и развитие.
texts.en: Tumonbai is 55 years old, married and has an adult son. Tumonbai has a college degree, but to better provide for his family he has started a farm . His dedication and hard work resulted in successful farming business - he now owns one heifer and .37 hectars/0.9 acres of land where he grows potatoes for sale. Tumonbai has turned to "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy 4 cows for fattening and resale. He pans to invest the profits back into his farm.

loans.use: to purchase four cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулкайыр успешно погасила кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Гулкайыр есть 3 коровы, 24 овцы, 6 лошадей, 2 теленка, 17 коз. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса Гулкайыр составляет 8,500 сом (KGS). Хозяйство ее развито, скота много, ежегодно она заготавливает на зиму сено и корм для животных. Однако, в этом году случилось несчастье, сын Гулкайыр, играя с друзьями во дворе, случайно сжег 2 машины заготовленного на зиму сена. Дети не пострадали, однако теперь скот нечем кормить. Поэтому Гулкайыр обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена для скота, она уже договорилась с поставщиком, он уступит в цене. Кредитные средства помогут Гулкайыр сохранить скот и получить весной здоровый приплод.
texts.en: Gulkaiyr has repaid her loan in full and she is very grateful to Kiva and all who lent her money. She now owns 3 cows, 24 sheep, 6 horses and 17 goats. Her monthly income is 8,500 som (KGS). The farm is flourishing, she has a lot of livestock and every year she puts up hay and feed for all of her animals. However, this year a terrible accident happened - her son, while goofing with friends, accidentally burned down two flat beds of her hay. The kids didn't get hurt, but now the animals have no food for the winter. Gulkaiyr had to turn to "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to purchase feed for her livestock. She has already made a deal with the supplier, he will give her a discount on the price. This loan will help Gulkaiyr to save all of her livestock and make sure the newborn animals are healthy in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase feed hay for her livestock

loans.name: Ma. May

texts.en:
Ma. May is 34 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Ma. May works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, soap, bread, charcoal, noodles, candy and etc..

Ma. May has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, soap, bread, charcoal, noodles, candy.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 54-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jane has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Jane described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jane’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nashon's Group

texts.en:
Nashon is a 34-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Nashon has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Nashon described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Nashon’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for university fees and books .

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar  is a 43-year-old man living with his family in a civil development area near Al  refugee camp in east Amman.  There are 6 members in his family.  

He has a small vegetable shop  which is the only source of income.  His children are growing day by day and his responsibilities are increasing due to the hard economics situation in the area.

He needs to increase his income and wants to enlarge his small shop and sell  additional goods and provide better services for people in this isolated area. 

He needs a loan to do this project and feel more secure about the future.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 32-year-old married woman. She lives in Kobuleti district with her husband and pensioner mother-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities and generates seasonal income. In particular, they have a plot of land, where they grow citrus which they sell locally. 

Tea decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to open a fast food cafe. With the received credit Tea will purchase all the needed materials for opening a fast food cafe. 

She thinks that the business will be profitable and Tea will do her best to improve the living conditions of her family with the increased income.

loans.use: to open a fast food.

loans.name: Omer Group

texts.en:
Omer group is the same group which took out their first loan from Kiva lenders. It consists of three members: Shwaiah, Hind, and Ala. They hadn't yet completely repaid the first loan but applied for a concurrent loan of 120,000 YER from Kiva.
Shwaiah is still the leader of the group which applied for a loan to buy more clothes, incense, and perfumes. She thanks Kiva lenders very much for the first loan that helped her to increase her business. She will finish repayment of the installments for the first loan. Her concurrent loan of 40,000 YER from Kiva will enable her to purchase clothes, incense, and perfume to resell.
Shwaiah hopes this loan will be funded too

loans.use: To purchase clothes, perfumes and incense to resell.

loans.name: Sok Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally is a 45-year-old married woman living in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She has three children, one  is a dependent  and attends school. 

She and her husband have sold rice soup and Khmer noodles in their village for years. The current business earns her family about 65,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Phally has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles  and she used the previous loans to support her family with sufficient food and  education.

She is leading her group to ask for a loan and will use her portion to buy more  ingredients, pots, and dishes. She hopes to earn additional income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy  ingredients.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a 35-year-old mother with five children. She operates a small business selling pancakes, buns, and pork cake in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Olive has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil to help her run the business. Olive hopes to build a small bakery in the near future using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima  lives in the Dangara district and was born in 1993 in a large family. She lives with her parents, brother, 2 sisters and sister-in-law. 

She graduated from  high school and makes national dresses. Her older sister taught her how to make beautiful, comfortable women's dresses. 

Fotima is a professional seamstress. She takes orders for women and sews at home. Fotima is a quiet and polite person. Her customers are always pleased. Fotima wants to buy a multifunction machine to expand her business and improve her  income.  However, she does not have enough money. This loan will help her to buy a new machine and increase her business. 

Your support is very important for her.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Whel Wigs Group

texts.en:
Maxima is the featured borrower of Whel Wigs group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon. In this way, they can earn a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Maxima is a 58-year-old divorced mother of two children who is working hard to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan to support her family in the Philippines.

The same case applies to her group members:
Bedan is a 42-year-old single lady, Marylyn is a 47-year-old married mother of two children, Irene is a 37-year-old single mother of one child, and Rocelle is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. They all want to support their families in the Philippines.

Maxima is the second lady on the left, Bedan is the lady standing behind, Marylyn is the first lady on the left, Irene is the second lady on the right, and Rocelle is the first lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to support her family in the Philippines.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda, born in 1986, is a hardworking woman living in a rural area. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a laborer. Four years ago, Mavjuda bought livestock to improve her family's income. She likes to do business in this sphere. She has gained experience and knows the secrets of how to keep cattle. 

Mavjuda is planning to widen her activity but she doesn't have enough profit to improve her business. Mavjuda has decided to open a factory to keep cattle in the future. She needs financial support to buy cattle to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Wily

texts.en:
Wily always has the enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income, helping her husband in support of their family. At the age of 48 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family, most especially for her children's education. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and compost for growing her crops.

In the future, Wily wishes to own a motor cab for easy transport of her produce to any marketplace in the province.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for growing her crops.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
In 2014, Gina learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Gina tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Gina borrowed another amount to purchase bags of fertilizers. This will help her farming income with a big boost. Gina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has a coffee farm in Balintawak, Aurora. This is the primary source of income for her family. Susan makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and have a good income. 

Recently, she needed an amount to pay for irrigation costs and she borrowed it from Paglaum MPC. Susan wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply coffee to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor to irrigate and soften tillage pans.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita, 46 years old, lives in Napolan, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has 3 adult aged children. For the past 11 years, Conchita has operated a sari-sari (convenience store) while also providing manicure and pedicure services. She earns PHP 2,000 a month with these businesses. Conchita has requested a loan to buy new manicure and pedicure sets to offer good service. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Conchita wants to have her own beauty parlor.

loans.use: to buy new manicure and pedicure sets

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en: Charlita has a coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. Charlita makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Charlita wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings on her farm

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina, 58 years old, lives in Sto. Niño, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has 4 adult aged children. Wilhelmina is very optimistic in selling different kinds of products such as clothes, cosmetics and soap to earn money for her family. She has had this business for 1 year.

Wilhelmina has requested a loan to restock her direct sales business to supply her customers' orders. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Wilhelmina hopes to buy a motorcycle for her business service.

loans.use: to restock her direct sales business

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Rosadelima

texts.en: Rosadelima is from Aloran, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. Rosadelima makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for holing and planting more cassava seedlings on her land. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply cassava in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for holing and planting more cassava seedlings on her land

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pavos, cerdos, etc. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de más animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, esto le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y de esta manera incrementrar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 22 years old and single. He lives with his family in the Oyotún District, located in the Chiclayo Province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in the district is tranquil. The people of the region work mainly in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

He makes a living by breeding and selling animals such as ducks, turkeys, pigs, etc. He has more than 3 years of experience in the business and very good personal and professional references locally. This loan is for the purchase of more animals and balanced feed for fattening them. This investment will help him to have more variety and productivity in animals which will have a large influence on his business. This will allow him to generate more revenue and thereby improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as balanced feed for fattening them.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married mother of seven children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman lives with his family at the frontier village of Lusadzor in the Tavush region. He is 32 years old and his family is one of many young families that decided to stay in their native village and develop it's farming and agriculture resources. 

Roman is married and has a daughter and a son. Roman is the  bread-winner in his family.  He  farms, cooks at the canteen, and works abroad to earn an income. 

Roman has cows, a calf, a pig, and chickens. His farm products include milk, meat, and eggs which he sells to regular customers. Roman wants to raise pigs to meet customer demands.

Roman asks for 700.000 AMD in order to buy  pigs.

loans.use: to buy several pigs.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin has stopped her work as a housemaid to her neighbor where she only received PHP 1,500 each month. As a good mother and responsible wife, she never gets tired of supporting her husband in raising their family. 

Jasmin has four kids. In order to earn a living, she engaged in a snack-vending business. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time perfecting her own food snacks recipe. She has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

The reason why she requested another loan from PMPC is to buy additional raw ingredients for her food snacks; to cater to more customers and be able to accept orders as well for additional earnings. She hopes and prays that her business will grow. She will make other snack recipes to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her food snacks.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 55 years of age and lives in Aloran, Philippines. She is married with three children, Pilar is engaged in a retailing business, she buys merchandise in bulk for retail. She has had this business for 2 years now. 

She requested a loan to pay for the coco plantation she pawned so that she can do her desired coco-growing project. The income from her business shall be used to pay off the loan she requested from PMPC. She has been a member of PMPC for a two years already. 

In the future, Pilar hopes to have a good standard of living with her family and adequate income out from her business.

loans.use: to pay for the coco plantation she pawned so she can do her desired coco-growing

loans.name: Shefaa

texts.en:
Shefaa is the daughter of a family that consists of five persons, including her parents and two brothers. Her mother holds a diploma in design, but does not work outside the home. Her father is working as a contractor and has an office. 

Shefaa is a good student who got high grades in high school. Unfortunately, her grades did not allow her to receive a discount on her university fees. Her father had enrolled her in architecture engineering classes toward a bachelor's degree, paying the full fees. He chose for her the least costly university but  it is still expensive and the family cannot pay all the fees. 
Shefaa said that she had chosen this field of study because it is related to her mother's area of design. Her mother had wished to continue her studies to get a bachelor's degree in design but she could not accomplish her goal due to certain circumstances. So now she wants Shefaa to make her dream come true .

loans.use: To pay her semester fees

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 28 лет, замужем, есть сын. У Венеры высшее образование, уже 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Венеры на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 20 овец, 1 лошадь. На участке мерою 1,04 Га она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка 5 овец. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует отремонтировать сарай.
texts.en: Venera is 28 years old, married and has a son. She has a college degree and has been raising livestock and farming for the last 5 years, using 5,000 som (KGS) to start her business. Her hard work has resulted in a larger herd: 2 cows, 20 sheep and a horse. She also grows oats for sale on 1.04 hectares of land. The monthly income from the farm is 6,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her farm Venera requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) from "Bai-Tushum". She will use the loan to buy 5 sheep. She plans to use the profits from the loan to expand her farm and repair her barn.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 31 год, замужем, многодетная мать 4 детей. У Айгуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Айгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 0,70 ГА собственной земли, где Айгуль с супругом выращивают картофель, кукурузу и люцерну. Всю закупленную, экологически чистую продукцию Айгуль реализует. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). Айгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она хочет накопить на покупку земельного надела.
texts.en: Aigul is 31 years old, married and a proud mother of four kids. She has a high school degree and farms to support her family. Her work and perseverance have allowed Aigul to now own 0.7 hectares/1.7 acres of farm land where she and her husband grow potatoes, corn and alfalfa. Aigul then sells all of their organic produce on the market. The monthly farm income is 10,000 com (KGS). Aigul has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan in order to buy more seed potatoes and fertilizer. She will use the profits from the loan to expand her business and save for buying more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and fertilizer in order to grow organic vegetables

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 6 farmers in Matete District. She is 58 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Ruth likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Ruth plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Ruth’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 3.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is married and has three children who attend school. She operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

Kabibi requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000, KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Kabibi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Minara

texts.ru: Минара, 54 года, замужем. Образование среднее. Минара живет и ведет хозяйство вместе с ее мамой, так как мама пожилая и не может сама заниматься бизнесом. У Минары тоже есть большой опыт в этой сфере деятельности, в хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 10 овец и 1 лошадь.  На участке мерою 1,60 Га выращивают кукурузу и люцерну. Минара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  скота. На полученные доходы от кредита Минара планирует и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en: Minara is 54 years old, married and has a high school degree. She lives and raises livestock with her mother, as her mother is old and cannot take care of the animals on her own. Minara has a lot of experience raising livestock, she owns 5 cows, 10 sheep and a horse. She also grows corn and alfalfa on 1.6 hectares/4 acres of farm land. Minara applied for a 50,000 som (KGS) loan from "Bai-Tushum" to finance another cattle purchase. She will use the profits from this loan to buy even more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and expand her herd

loans.name: Al- Asala Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Asala. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB.

Samar is the leader of the group. She is married and is a mother of two children, living with her family in a rented house. She works as a teacher and gets a small salary. Over time, she shared with her husband and purchased a piece of land so they could build their own house on that land. The renting takes half of their income monthly. They couldn't afford this thing and decided to have their own house. Unfortunately, they didn't have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, Samar applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to purchase cement, bricks, iron and steel to build some rooms on that land which they purchased.

Samar looks forward to completing the building of the house and renovating to make it ready for life.

loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks, iron and steel to build some rooms on the land which they purchased.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional incense and perfume.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is 56 years old and a mother of four children. She is a home maker and also raises cattle for meat sales. Mahbuba is a very hard working woman, despite the fact hat her husband is working in Russia. She maintains the family's budget and cooks for the traditional feasts which happen at her home. Mahbuba is a caring and loving mother and mother-in-law. Her daughter-in-law is attending medical school. To pay for her eduction Mahbuba needs money. She has turned to "Arvand" for a loan. She has been working with this organization for three years now. She used one of her loans to purchase a laptop. Now the family can see and talk with their father (via Skype) much more often. Mahbuba's husband is far away from his loved ones and has to work very hard to take care of his family. Mahbuba is very grateful to all the lenders for supporting this loan with a low interest rate. She plans to use "Arvand" loans in the future as well.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Saul Arani

texts.es: Saúl de 20 años de edad es un joven tenaz que se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado bovino, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años cerca de su lugar de habitación. Él vive en vivienda propia con su madre, su padre y sus 5 hermanos desde hace muchos años.  Al no encontrar otra manera de ganarse la vida Saúl decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado bovino con lo cual ha logrado ganarse la vida, pero actualmente desea invertir más en su negocio, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en ganado bovino para continuar con el negocio y seguir apoyando a su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Saúl, 20, is a tenacious young man who buys and sells cattle. He has been doing this for 3 years, close to the place where he lives. He has lived in his own home with his mother, his father and his 5 siblings for many years. Not finding another way to earn a living, Saúl decided to buy and sell cattle, and in this way he has managed to earn a living. He currently wants to invest more in his business, but he doesn't have the necessary cash flow, so he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cattle so that he can continue with the business and continue supporting his family group.

loans.use: to invest in cattle

loans.name: Ashurbibi

texts.en:
Ashurbibi is an open-minded woman. She was born in 1976. For more than eight years she has been doing a business. She is married. She has three children. Her husband works abroad. 

Ashurbibi is a sewer. She is a famous sewer in her area. She works hard and is responsive. She has all up-to-date equipments and sewing machines. She wants to enlarge her activity, because customers are requesting it. She gets some orders to sew a blanket covers, bed-sheets and pillow-cases. That is why she is planning to widen her business. It also would be better to gain additional income. 

She wants to be financially secure and to educate her children well. Ashurbibi wants to invest to have a better standard of their living. She is requesting financial support to buy textiles and to enlarge her activity.

loans.use: To buy textiles to enlarging her activity.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de mecanica,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de mecanica y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas como llantas para arreglar los carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues to work as a mechanic. His dream in to grow the mechanics business, and through the business he wants to move forward. The member asks for a loan to buy tools such as tires to fix cars. The member is happy for the loan and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools such as tires to fix cars.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita has been managing her eatery business in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta, in the Philippines. It has been doing well supporting her family's needs, along with those of her parents. Perlita has local customers and she also accepts catering for added income. 

Perlita recently borrowed a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices, cooking equipment, kitchen wares and utensils for her eatery business. She wants to improve her business and would be very happy to undergo expansion and renovation of the area to draw more customers to her eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices, cooking equipment, kitchen wares and utensils for her eatery business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has mastered her swine production in Dulapo, Oroquieta City, in the Philippines. This business allows Virginia to support her husband in raising their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to obtain credit to fully support her business. 

Just as Virginia takes care of her swine production business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so that she can always apply for any financing she may need. This loan of PHP 14,900 will be used to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine. Virginia hopes and prays that her business will grow because that will help her save enough for future emergencies. She wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
“Hardworking mother” best describes Rosario. She is married and resides in San Vicente, Oroquieta City. Rosario has seven children and is married to a carpenter. The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs in their family, so she started a business. She opened a sari-sari (general store). Rosario has been in the business for more than two decades.

Rosario wants to expand her business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially her grandchildren. She would be able to save enough to repair her house.

In order for Rosario to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 25,000 additional capital, and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy more assorted goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy more assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 46-year-old married woman from Tangub, Philippines who has four adult school-age children. She signed up for her membership in PMPC after she learned about the financial assistance it gives. Elena owns and manages a small restaurant in front of their house, which is on a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their town, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities as well as earning for her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Rosita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria is from Oroquieta and a widow. As a farmer, she always experienced hardships like planting vegetables and any agricultural commodity to sufficiently provide for her family. Hilaria landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. Farming is the main source of her income. PMPC came to Hilaria just in time for the working capital she needed. Now, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase farm inputs and pay for land and seedbed preparation to grow her crops and vegetables. This will help her gain more income. She is always looking forward to better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay for land and seedbed preparation to grow her crops and vegetables

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is driven by the passion of selling. At the age of 58, she has chosen to live as a single person in Oroquieta, Philippines. She runs a store to provide for her needs. Every day she patiently tends her store. Estrella wants to expand her business; she recently applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC, where she became a member in 2013 in order to access insurance and financial assistance. Now she has borrowed a loan to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and to extend help to her nephews and nieces in anything she could afford, especially in their education.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Esperanza Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Santa Marianita, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Esperanza, tiene 47 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen 2 hijos de 17 y 16 años que estudian en colegio y aún viven con ella. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una Academia artesanal en la ciudad.
Doña Esperanza es una mujer que siempre le ha tocado ganar lo suyo y así salir adelante, para esto hace más de 5 años instaló un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí además d coser ropa también vende productos de belleza los mismos que vende en su taller y también a domicilio, trabaja todos los días unas seis horas por día, ella trabaja a base de pedidos de sus clientes quiénes conocen de la calidad de sus trabajos.  En época de fiestas o entrada a clases es cuando más trabajo tiene y sus ganancias aumentan como en la actualidad. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar telas, cierres, hilos, materiales para la  costura y productos de belleza que ella vende. Lleva más 6 meses  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son  seguir mejorando todos los días.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito Santa Marianita comes together every fifteen days in the city of Carmen. This is an area known for being dynamic, where the majority of inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals. There is a lot of vegetation. Esperanza lives in this area. She is 47 years old, divorced, and has two children, aged 17 and 16 years old. They study in school and still live with her.

A few years ago, she learned dressmaking in an artisan academy in the city. Doña Esperanza is a woman who has always supported herself, and therefore moves forward. As such, she established a small sewing workshop in her home more than 5 years ago. In addition to sewing, she also sells beauty products; she sells them out of her home and also door to door. She works every day for about 6 hours per day. She works based on the orders of her clients, who know the quality of her work. She has the most work during holiday times or for the back-to-school season, and her earnings increase. 

This loan will be used to buy fabric, zippers, thread, sewing materials, and beauty products that she will sell. She has been in the Grupo de Crédito for more than 6 months, and she likes it because the loans are helpful. Her dream is to continue improving every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, thread, sewing materials, and beauty products.

loans.name: Willy's Group

texts.en:
Willy is 66 years old and has 12 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group of eight farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Willy has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. His decision to join was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and although he describes his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Willy also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Willy's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 64-year-old proud father of 11 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Peter has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Peter described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Peter’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a donkey carriage

loans.name: Beauty And The Beast Group

texts.en:
Enrica is the featured borrower of the Beauty and the Beast group. She and the other group members got together to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have been friends since they left their homes in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their loved ones back home.

Enrica is a 48-year-old widowed mother of two children. She works hard as a housekeeper to cover her beloved children's expenses and needs and to improve their living conditions. Enrica is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines.
 
The other group members are in the same situation, wanting to support their families in the Philippines. Susana is a 47-year-old single lady, Analiza is a 37-year-old single lady and Cecilia is a 37-year-old married mother of two children. The women appear in the photo (from left to right): Susana, Cecilia, Enrica, Analiza.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines

loans.name: Mahur

texts.en:
Mahur is a 22-year-old single man. He is a student in his second course. Mahur has no home; he lives in a little old rented house near the university. His father is ill so his father can't send money to him. Mahur works in a cafe. His monthly income is 120 manat. 

He is a good student who always gets good marks in the university. Mahur will be an engineer in the future. He loves his profession and hopes one day he will come home to do it.  But Mahur's studies have to be paid for and it is difficult for him to pay this money. That is why he needs a loan to pay his education fees. He is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN. It is his first loan with Aqroinvest.

loans.use: to pay his education fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 48-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He is the father of four sons and two daughters. He is an employee in the public sector.

Nahed earns a very low income, which barely covers all of the family's needs. He wants to improve his family's living conditions and buy all of the things they need.

Nahed took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water, and a tank. By taking this loan, Nahed will be able to decrease his family's electricity expenses.

Nahed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water, and a tank.

loans.name: Donath

texts.en: Donath is 25 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 1 and 3. They do not yet go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, salt, and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, salt, and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy, 43 years old, is married and her family resides in Oroquieta, Philippines. Daisy joined PMPC in October of 2011 in order to access its programs and services. She has recently accessed her 3rd loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 to buy more varieties of dried fish for her retail business. Daisy hopes that her business will grow to continuously support her children in getting a degree in college.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of dried fish to retail

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en: Neciforo, 59 years old, lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is a widowed father of an adult-aged child. For the past 21 years, Neciforo has operated his own motorcycle transport service, earning approximately PHP 4,000 each month. He also receives a monthly pension as his wife's survivor. Neciforo has requested a loan to pay his mother's medical bills. He has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Neciforo hopes to acquire an additional tricycle for hire.

loans.use: to pay his mother's medical bills

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca makes a good living with every quarter of her coconut farm in Aloran, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting herself and her family since she was widowed. She has been able to send all of her children to school, all of them having graduated and secured their own jobs. 

Out of the money she has saved, Francisca purchased a hectare-plot of land. Now, she wishes to plant more dwarf coconut trees and banana plants of a good variety so she can increase her farm's yield. However, Francisca is in need of working capital. She presented her project to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings. 

Francisca has high hopes that her farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to clear and plow her land and plant seedlings on her coconut farm.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is engaged in operating a sari-sari store. She has been in her business for three years and earns enough for her daily needs.  Rosalie is 31 years old, married and has two children. She is from Tangub.  Rosalie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Recently, Rosalie requested a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store to increase stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Felstus's Group

texts.en:
Felstus, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Felstus will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Felstus plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Felstus’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of six acres of land. They will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of using the old one.

loans.name: Puao

texts.en:
Puao is a 52-year-old mother with 3 children. She has a small business of sewing clothes and selling them in her community to earn a living.

Puao has requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement, overlocker, and table to help her with the business. She has been doing this for more than 4 years and will use her profit to expand her business. Puao became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a rolling materials, needles, sewing machine, tape measurement, overlocker and table.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia Noemí pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco-Perú. 
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias, lechuga, tomates entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de tomates entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Noemí, belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” in the city of Cusco, Perú. 

She continues to work in the business of selling vegetables, such as carrots, lettuce, tomatoes, among others, that her customers ask for. Noemí feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with the payment terms. 

She has spent a good amount of time working at her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into to it every day. 

She requests a loan to buy tomatoes and the like.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and the like.

loans.name: Fanny Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Fanny Elizabeth se dedica al negocio de transporte, la socia tiene un carro que hace servicio a la ciudad de lima llevando carga, la socia trabaja 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es comprarse un carro nuevo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny Elizabeth works in transportation, she has a car that services the city of Lima by taking cargo. She has been working in this business for seven years and it is going very well for her. 

She is asking for a loan to buy tires for her car. She is happy about the loan and she promises to comply with her payment plan. Fanny's dream is to buy herself a new car.

loans.use: to buy tires for her car.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed to the local people in her area. She is a 23-year-old single woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for three years now.

She has requested a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and other materials. With these tools, Margie will be able to grow and sell a huge volume of seaweed. These could also help her improve her daily income. In the long run, she will be able to manage her finances and start to pay her dues.

In the future, Margie is determined to expand her business to become more productive to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and other materials

loans.name: Enrieta's Group

texts.en:
Enrieta is 58 years old and has 8 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Enrieta is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of 8 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Enrieta started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year Enrieta decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Enrieta’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, for a group total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita has a banana farm in Tangub, and it is her family's primary source of income. Melita makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She is planning to plant more bananas of a good variety and grow crops. She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for land clearing and plowing, and holing and planting of seedlings. Melita wishes to gain more income and be able to repair her house.

loans.use: to pay for land clearing and plowing, and holing and planting of seedlings on her banana farm

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria earns a living through farming. At  62 years of age and married, she never stopped pursuing her goals for the sake of her family. Gliceria is a full fledged member of PMPC and has borrowed several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Gliceria's desire to earn extra income prompted her to engage in a sari-sari (convenience store) business. PMPC stood by her to start her chosen business. She has now applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories, and to purchase bags of farm fertilizer. Gliceria continues to seek business ideas on farming, proof that she has the determination to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories, and to purchase bags of farm fertilizer

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza, 36 years old, is one of the good women in the Shahrituz district. She has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls; two of them are studying at school. For the past 3 years, Feruza has been engaged in a business purchasing and selling livestock. Her husband is a builder but he also helps her with this activity. 

Feruza gained experience in this work in her childhood, from her mother. She says that this activity gives her a good profit and develops her life but she also loves to care for animals. Feruza is requesting a loan to purchase livestock and improve her income. While her children are small, she is working hard in order to provide them with a good future. Feruza is asking for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase and sell animals

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vidrios, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tener otra tienda de venta de vidrios. El socios solicita el crédito para comprar vidrios.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Exaltación is still making a living by selling glass. He is a hard working person that wants to use this business to get ahead. His dream is to have another store for selling glass. He requests a loan for the purchase of glass.

Exaltación is happy about the loan and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy glass

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaidi operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Mwanaidi wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 35 years old and from Baniswef. He is married and has three elementary school-aged children. He has a small photography studio business. It is the only source of income for the family, but it can't cover his family's monthly expenses. As a result, Mohammad requested a 5000 EGP loan from TADE to buy a new camera and a PC to expand his studio. He hopes these materials will help him to attract more customers and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy a camera and a PC

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has mastered her hog raising business in Oroquieta. This business allows her to support her husband in raising their family. Lorna was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to obtain credit to fully support her business. 

Just as Lorna takes care her hog raising business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always apply for any financing needs. This loan of PHP 14,900 will help her build a concrete pig pen to improve sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Sayramkhol

texts.en:
Sayramkhol is a young woman who lives in Shahrituz district. She has a large family. Her husband is a builder. Sayramkhol is a sociable and hardworking person. She has 6 children. For their best future, she works every day from early morning until late evening.

Recently, Sayramkhol created a business plan, and she wants to start her activity. She has her own point of sales in Shahrituz market and also has a supplier. She wants to buy vegetables and fruits from Kurgantube and to sell wholesale in Shahrituz.

Unfortunately, Sayramkhol does not have enough money to realize her business plan. That is why she has submitted an application for a loan. She believes that with your support, her dream of starting her own business will come true and she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is sixty years old and she cooks and sells food in her street stand. Asunta has her own house and she is married. Her husband is a mason. Asunta also has a son. 

Asunta needs a loan to buy new pots and an oven. As you can see in the picture, Asunta's kitchen needs support so Asunta hopes you can help her to improve her food business.

loans.use: to buy pots and an oven

loans.name: Dds Group

texts.en:
Jayne is the featured borrower of Dds group. She went along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines, to come and work in Lebanon, for a better income to support their loved ones back in the Philippines.

Jayne is a 40-year-old, married mother of three children, who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children and improve their living conditions. Thus, she is acquiring a loan to pay her children's school tuition fees.

With respect to the other group members, Syvel Mae is a 28-year-old, single woman, Yolanda is a 52-year-old, married mother of five children, and Rochie is a 38-year-old, married mother of one child. They all want to cover their family's increasing living costs in the Philippines.

In the photo, Jayne is the first woman on the right, Syvel Mae is the second woman on the left, Yolanda is second woman on the right, and Rochie is the first woman on the left.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of four children, who all attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her villages. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma  is a married mother of five children, who all attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanajuma operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to her villages. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase a stock of firewood for resale and to pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale and to pay for transport

loans.name: Joni

texts.en:
Joni is 37 years old and has been photographed with his horse; a rooster and a chicken are standing on the horse’s back. He is married and his children are 17, 12 and 9 years old.

For Joni, the planting season has already started and he must buy onion and potato seeds to plant soon. Kindly note that his region is known domestically for the largest production in the country of both products -- in addition to beans, leeks, red peppers, apples, pears and quince fruits. Joni has been in agriculture for about 15 years; his clientele includes wholesale buyers. All in all, Joni owns 10 dynym (one hectare) of agricultural land; in 5 of them he plants potatoes, and in 3 dynym onions and beans. Although agriculture is the only source of income for their family, his retiree mother who lives with them receives a pension of about $100/month.

loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Altin

texts.en:
A loan of 250,000 ALL (Albanian Lek) will help Altin to buy cherry seedlings and onion seeds for planting; the season has already started. 

Altin, 41 years old, is married and a father of two children, 11 and 13 years old. His family resides in the southeastern part of the country. Altin owns about 3 dynym (3,000 square meters) of agricultural land where he has already planted apple orchards. He has also rented from some villagers about 12 dynym of land where he plants onions, potatoes, beans and peppers. Altin sells all the produce to wholesale buyers. In addition to his agriculture activities, Altin works as a driver for some neighbors who own a transportation van, earning $300/month.

loans.use: to buy cherry seedlings and onion seeds for planting

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with 2 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanamkasi operates a grocery stall at the market selling vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of not only expanding but also establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With her 20,000 KES loan Mwanamkasi would like to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 49 years old and is from Baniswef. He is married with three school-children. He is a teacher but his monthly income is very small and can't cover his family's monthly expenses. So he requested a 10,000 EGP loan to start a small plumbing tools and supplies store and successfully repaid it on its due date. He requested another 10,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more plumbing supplies and tools such as water supply fittings, tubes, and drain/sewer fittings and parts.

loans.use: to buy more plumbing supplies and tools such as water supply fittings, tubes, and drain/sewer fittings and parts

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema, 31 years old, is from Baniswef. She is married and has two children. Her husband works part-time for a mechanic. The family's monthly income is not sustainable and can't cover their monthly expenses so Neema decided to help her husband by starting a small clothing project in her house. 

Neema previously requested a 4,000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on time. Neema's customers' demands have increased, so she has requested another loan, this time for 7,000 EGP, to buy more clothing to expand her business and meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to expand her business and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Amr

texts.en: Amr is twenty-seven years old and comes from Baniswef. He is a graduate of the Tourism and Hotels High School. He is single and lives with his parents and three siblings. Amr is the only bread winner of the family as his father's pension income is very low and can't cover the family's monthly expenses. Amr runs his father's small clothing shop because his father's health has deteriorated. Previously, he requested two loans to expand his business and successfully repaid them on the date they were due. Amr is so ambitious that he requested another 8,000 EGP loan to buy kids clothing to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy kids clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build furniture.

loans.name: Elisa Group

texts.en:
Maria is the featured borrower of Elisa group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Maria is a 43-year-old married mother of four children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines. The same case is applied to the other group members. Elisa is a 41-year-old divorced mother of one child, Merlinda is a 44-year-old married mother of two children, and Marilou is a 36-year-old married mother of one child. They all want to support their families in the Philippines.

Maria is the second lady on the right, Elisa is the first lady on the left, Merlinda is second lady on the left, and Marilou is the first lady on the right.

loans.use: to support her family's increasing needs in the Philippines.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 49-year-old married mother of three children who has been selling Brazilian gold and cosmetics for eight years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.
 
Jamila is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to develop her business.
