She is now acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable designs of Brazilian gold and new kinds of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' needs.

Jamila hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own accessories and cosmetics shop to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable designs of Brazilian gold and new kinds of cosmetics

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda  pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco-Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida  para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para así continua apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, carnes, menestras  entre otros.
texts.en: Hilda belongs to the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She is still making a living by selling food to all of her customers who ask for her. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with her established payments. She has been making a living from this business for a long time, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she makes each day. She wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies like rice, meat, and beans, among other items.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, meat, and beans, among other items.

loans.name: Melvin Jeovanny

texts.es:
El señor Melvin de 33  años  de edad,  vive con su familia en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de la música tiene una discomóvil la cual alquila para fiestas como bodas, cumpleaños, graduaciones, etc. 
Don Melvin es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales para mejorar su casa necesita comprar pintura, una puerta, bloques, etc. Espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y poder seguir mejorando su casa.
Uno de sus sueños es que su negocio crezca y que le permita seguir generándose ingresos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Melvin is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his family. For the past 10 years, he has been making a living in the music business. He owns a sound and lighting equipment, which he rents for parties such as weddings, birthdays, graduations, and the like.

Melvin is a hard-working person, eager to succeed. He is requesting a loan to buy materials to improve his home such as paint, a door, cinder blocks, and the like. He hopes that this investment will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family, and he hopes to keep on making improvements to his home.

One of his dreams is for his business to grow so that it will allow him to keep on earning an income.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – December, 2014.

loans.use: to buy paint, a door, and bricks to improve his home

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel earns a living by fishing. She sells fish to the people in her community. She is a 32-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is one year old. Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials for pump boat renovation, like plywood, paint and epoxy (adhesive). These materials will be very helpful in augmenting her income. She could now have a new pump boat, which will be used primarily in transporting her daily catch and would be a mode of transportation as well. With these improved circumstances, slowly her earnings will improve and start to sustain her finances.

Maricel dreams of expanding her fishing business to make it progressive and to be able to support the education of all her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for pump boat renovation, like plywood, paint and epoxy (adhesive).

loans.name: Mbimbi

texts.en:
Mbimbi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 15 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasiti operates a grocery stall at the market selling vegetables to town dwellers and her neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan Mwanasiti wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Evelina Monserrate

texts.es:
En El Sitio EL Limón del cantón EL Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mariano, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura las personas cultivan, piñas, café, cacao, plátano por ser un clima húmedo propio para estos cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Evelina, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 3  años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Evelina es una mujer que le gusta colaborar con su esposo para salir adelante, ellos tienen un negocio en su casa donde venden frutas y legumbres, el de madrugada se va al mercado de mayoristas  a abastecerse de todos los productos, luego lleva a su casa en la cual distribuyen a los clientes que a diario llegan hasta su local a abastecerse de sus productos para el diario vivir,  llevan más de 8 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual se ganan su sustento diario y luchan para que a sus hijos no les falte lo necesario para vivir.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The credit group Mariano meets every fifteen days in a place called El Limón in the canton of El Carmen. It is a place known for its dynamism. The majority of the people are farmers and they grow pineapple, coffee, cacao, and plantains due to the humid climate which is good for these crops.

This is where Evelina lives.  She is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are 11 and 3 years old. The eldest one goes to school. Her husband is a merchant. Evelina is a woman who likes to work with her husband so they can get ahead.  They have a business in their house in which they sell fruits and vegetables. Early in the morning her husband goes to the wholesale market where he stocks up on products and then takes it home. They distribute it to their customers who come each day to their shop to get the products they need for daily living. They have been doing this for more than eight years, and it has allowed them to earn a livelihood and to ensure that their children have everything they need to live. 

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables for their business. She has been with the credit group for three years and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with 3 adult children. She and her husband run a small business.

Oksana is a very hardworking person who has been growing vegetables in greenhouses for 25 years. She owns a large plot of land, half of which is busy with greenhouses, while the other half is still vacant. She wants to develop her business further and build more greenhouses. As well, in the future, Oksana would like to sell metal parts to customers with which they can build their own greenhouses.

Oksana is requesting a 60,000 UAH loan to build new wooden greenhouses on the empty part of her land. This loan will help her develop her business and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to develop her business by building additional greenhouses.

loans.name: Sisters Group

texts.en:
Leonila is the featured borrower of Sisters Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Leonila is a 40-year-old married mother of two children, who is working hard to develop her business and cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids. Therefore, she is acquiring a loan to increase her business merchandise with more prepaid mobile cards, in an attempt to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions in the Philippines.

Leonila is the second lady on the left. With respect to the other group members, Numeriana is the first lady on the left, Lynn is second lady on the right, and Laila is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with more prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia continua elaborando tejidos a pedido como chompas, chalinas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando sus chompas apara vender a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas de colores, agujas entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Marina is a member of the Communal Bank named “Imasumac I” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. She continues to make knitted goods upon request such as sweaters, scarves, and other items. Luz Marina is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments. She is a responsible and industrious person.

Luz Marina continues to produce sweaters that she can sell to customers who request them such as friends, relatives, and other individuals. Working in this manner allows her to help her family get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to buy colored wool, knitting needles, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy colored wool, knitting needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo es su hombre emprendedor quien tiene la edad de 69 años, casado, es agricultor, este negocio es herencia de sus padres, el mismo comercializa el producto en el mercado de la localidad, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y nietos, llevas más de diez años trabajando con los financiamientos de ADIM por lo que ha demostrado que además de ser un hombre trabajador es responsable con las cuotas de su crédito, y solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes tales como abono, urea, además invertirá en semillas mejoradas lo que le permitirá seguir ofreciendo un producto de calidad, ha logrado ofrecer durante estos años un producto de calidad ya que es los préstamos le permiten invertir en mejores materiales para la agricultura.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a 69-year-old, married, entrepreneurial man. He makes a living as a farmer. This business is an inheritance from his parents. He sells his products at the local market. He relies on the help of his children and grandchildren.

He has been working with loans from ADIM for more than ten years because he has demonstrated that in addition to being a hard-working man, he is responsible with his loan payments. He is requesting this loan to buy better quality seeds and to purchase fertilizers such as manure. It is through the microloans over the years that has given Gerardo a better quality product and the ability to invest in better materials for agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and better seeds, which will allow him to provide quality products

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: Emmanuel es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por la señora Heisell quien tiene la edad de 26 años, casada y propietaria de un taller de costura, obteniendo seis años de experiencia es este negocio por lo que tiene clientela fija, es el séptimo ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio este crédito lo solicita para la compra de tela de manta, lana, elástico, dacron, conos de hilo, etc., lo que le permitirá aumentar la producción de su taller, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la clientela. El resto de las integrantes son, la señora Antonia que tiene la edad de 55 años dedicada a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en un mercado de la municipalidad desde hace cinco años, Marling una joven que tiene la edad de 21 años comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, y la joven Carmen de 22 años de edad comerciante de frutas principalmente melón en un mercado.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a solidarity group made up of four enterprising women coordinated by Heisell, 26, who's married and the owner of a tailor shop.  She has six years of experience in this business, so she has steady customers.  This is the seventh loan cycle in which ADIM is giving her financing for her business.

She's requesting this loan to buy muslin, wool, elastic, Dacron, cone thread, and other supplies to increase her production.  With her previous loan she was able to expand her clientele.

The other members are Antonia, 55, who has sold fruits and vegetables in the town market for five years; Marling, 21, a young fruit and vegetable vendor in the town market; and Carmen, 22, a young vendor of mainly fruit in the town market.

loans.use: to buy muslin, wool, elastic, Dacron, etc., to keep on increasing her production

loans.name: Wensislao

texts.es:
Wensislao tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de enfermero (cuidado de enfermos) en el distrito de Santo Tomás. Adicionalmente se dedica la la cría de ganado vacuno (vacas). Cuenta con más de siete años de experiencia en esta actividad y tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de materiales para realizar su trabajo como medicamentos, inyecciones, alcohol, entre otros, así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales materiales de trabajo, con esto Wensislao espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wensislao is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents. They reside in the District of Santo Tomás in Cutervo Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The residents of this district engage primarily in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding.

Wensislao provides health services (caring for the sick) in the District of Santo Tomás. In addition, he raises cows. He has more than seven years of experience in this business and also has very good personal and work-related references who are from this area. His loan will be used to buy supplies for his work such as medicines, injections, alcohol, and other items so that he can maintain his current inventory for his job. As a result, Wensislao hopes to provide better service to his clients. This will be reflected in his level of income and he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his work such as medicines, injections, alcohol, and other items.

loans.name: Inés Rocio

texts.es:
En El Sitio EL Limón del cantón EL Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mariano, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura las personas cultivan, piñas, café, cacao, plátano por ser un clima húmedo propio para estos cultivos.
En este lugar vive la señora Inés, tiene 40 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación  tuvo tres  hijos, dos  mayores  de edad y el menor de 10 años el cual estudia en escuela, dos de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Inés es una muy buena madre que hace lo posible para darles a sus hijos lo mejor,  ella tiene una pequeña granja en la cual se dedica a la cría de pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños los mismos que cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende por libras a vecinos de sus localidad, o entrega en el mercado a comerciantes en este lugar, con esto ella se gana lo suyo que les sirve para sacar adelante a  sus hijos con un trabajo que no le resulta muy difícil ya que está un poco enferma.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
The Mariano lending group meets every two weeks in El Limon, within the El Carmen settlement.  This area is known to be very dynamic and most of the people here farm and raise pineapples, coffee, cacao, and plantains because the climate is humid and right for these crops.

Ines lives here.  She is 40 years old, divorced, and has three children; three adults and a 10 year old who attends school.  Two of them live with her.

Ines is a good mother who does what she can to provide the best for her children.  She has a small farm where she raises chickens.  She buys them when they are small and raises them for three or four months until they are plump and then sells them by the pound to her neighbors or delivers them to merchants at the local market.  She earns a living and supports her children this way.  Although she is a bit sick, this work is not too demanding.

She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens, feed, and medications so that they can develop well.  She has been part of the lending group for seven years and enjoys it because she gets help through the loans.  Her dreams are to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and medicine.

loans.name: Thamari

texts.en: Thamari is 40 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 22 years, all of whom go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing so for 20 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more beans, cassava and bananas to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more beans, cassava and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль погасила свой кредит, она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Айгуль есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 70 овец, 2 бычка, 2 жеребца. Она по-прежнему выращивает фасоль и картофель для реализации. Айгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60 000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка и минеральных удобрений для картофеля. Айгуль входит в состав группы "Келечек-Н", всего в группе 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение орошаемой земельной доли и количества скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Aigul paid back her previous loan, which she is very grateful to Kiva for and to all those who helped her finance it. Aigul has 2 cows, 2 horses, 70 sheep, 2 bull-calves and 2 stallions on her farm. As in the past, she continues to grow beans and potatoes for sale. Aigul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan. She is requesting 60,000 som (KGS) to buy a bull-calf and mineral fertilizers for growing potatoes. Aigul is part of the lending group "Kelechek-N," which has a total of 3 members. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her irrigated plot of land and the number of cattle on her farm.

loans.use: to buy one bull-calf and mineral fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with one child who attends school and is under her care. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For over three years, Mwanaidi has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door-to-door and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Mwanaidi is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a bale of children's clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Tsiuri

texts.en:
Tsiuri is a 65-year-old woman who lives alone in a small village called Atsana. She works hard to generate her own income and have financial stability. She owns a plot of agricultural land, where she seeds maize and nuts. She sells the harvested products at the local market. However, her income is seasonal and she finds it hard to cover all daily costs. She needs financial support to expand her agribusiness and make it more productive.
 
Tsiuri sought credit among local financial institutions, but her attempt was unsuccessful as the creditors didn't find enough family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor people to start or re-start businesses. With the requested amount, Tsiuri plans to purchase a milk-cow to produce milk products for selling and for her own use also. The loan will be great support to this hard-working woman, as her income will significantly increase.

loans.use: to purchase a milk-cow and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Latinoamericanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LATINOAMERICANAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chomapas, taller de carpinterí, artesanía, venta de comida, venta de golosinas, tienda de carnicería, venta de comida, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucy es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace recientemente, aprendiendo al ayudar en la venta de sus amigas, posteriormente con un poco de ahorro decide iniciar su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Latinoamericanas Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office.  It's made up of nine members governed by a board of directors of which Lucy's the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including sweater sales, a carpentry workshop, handmade crafts, food sales, snack sales, a butcher shop, and furniture sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Lucy.  She said it's the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business selling sweaters.  She said she started the business recently, learning by helping her friends make sales.  Later she decided to start her own business with some savings.

Lucy's loan is to increase her capital with the purchase of wool in bulk from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz.  Later she'll make sales in her sales stall.  This job allows her to earn income to support her family, because she's in a common-law relationship and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the institution's training and health offerings.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has a boyfriend and she is the mother of a one-year-old child. Nancy lives in Umapusa. Her boyfriend is a musician. 

Nancy is a farmer and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she wants to sell more milk. Nancy wants to improve the quality of her life because she doesn't have electricity or sewerage in the house where she lives.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza has four children and she has her own house, located in Cala Cala. The family is comfortable in their home, although the house doesn't have sewerage disposal. 

Esperanza makes money by selling cheese that she makes. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Esperanza needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she wants to make more cheese and to sell more milk. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Lidia Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Lidia de 67 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, sus clientes son personas de la zona y también tiene contratos con personas de otros lugares.
Doña Lidia vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, cuajada, leña, manteca, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un gran taller de rosquillas con varias empleadas y que su hija pueda seguir adelante en sus estudios.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia is 67-years old. She lives with her husband and her daughter in her own home. For the last twenty years, she has made her living with a business selling "rosquillas" (a ring-shaped sweet bread). Her customers are people from the area she lives in, and she also has contracts with people who live elsewhere.

Doña Lidia lives in a village in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead. She works hard day after day to improve her quality of life.

Doña Lidia is requesting the loan to purchase products, such as corn, dry cheese, firewood, lard etc. With the help of the loan, she intends to improve her income as well as her quality of life. Doña Lidia is an excellent client of her communal bank, and she hopes to continue working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a big "rosquillas" studio with a number of employees and that her daughter can continue forward in her studies. San Lorenzo, Honduras – December 2014.

loans.use: to purchase corn, dry cheese, firewood, lard etc. for her business.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Balbina es una mujer de 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 14, 12, y 8 años, y 3 hijas de 6, 4 y 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de pescado.
Élla es emprendedora, independiente, cuidadosa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de Sacaba, un sitio que se mantiene como granero de la ciudad, por la producción de cereales, verduras y frutas, hasta en los distritos urbanos. Maíz, trigo, cebada, hortalizas, frutilla, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, manzanas, duraznos y hasta plantas de tumbo se producen en Sacaba. También tienen granjas de pollos e incluso trabajan en la apicultura.
Balbina es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y también habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 3 menores todavia no se encuentran en edad escolar. Recientemente heredó un terreno familiar, el cual se encuentra en una zona alejada, y no cuenta con instalaciones de agua potable, tiene electricidad y agua de pozo. “tengo 6 hijos y deseo darles un lugar donde puedan vivir con tranquilidad…” comenta. Su sueño es construir su casa, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Balbina solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos vivan con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Balbina is a 30 year old married woman with three boys of 14, 12 and 8 years of age and 3 girls who are 6, 4 and 1 year old. She sells fish for a living.

Balbina is enterprising, independent, careful, responsible and hard working. She works in the community of Sacaba which functions as the granary of the city, producing cereal, vegetables and fruit for the urban areas. Corn, wheat, barley, leafy greens, strawberries, plantains, papayas, oranges, apples, peaches and even banana passionfruit are all grown in Sacaba. They also have chicken farms and work in beekeeping. 

Balbina is dark skinned, of short stature, has long plaited hair and dresses in the traditional style of hat, shawl and full gathered skirt. Her native language is Quecha, which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish out of general knowledge and for her job. Her husband is a businessman and they have three older children in school and three younger children who are not yet school age.  

Balbina recently inherited a family plot of land in a remote area which does not have drinking water but is connected to electricity and has water from a well. "I have six children and I want to give them a home where they can live comfortably" she says. Her dream is to finish building her home and install drinking water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry. 

This is Balbina's first loan cycle with the institution in the four years that she has worked in this area.The reason why she is applying for this loan is to install drinking water in her home so that her children can live in comfort.

loans.use: to install drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry so her children can live comfortably

loans.name: Dúo Lirio De Los Balles Group

texts.es:
DUO LIRIO DE LOS BALLES
Este dúo formado por doña Alba Leticia, de 38 años de edad, es la líder del grupo, tiene 1 hijo y vende granizadas de frutas por las mañanas y tambien vende papas fritas  por las tardes Desde hace 9 años, nos cuenta que necesita el crédito para comprar 1 hielera ya que la que tiene ya está algo dañada, también quiere comprar algunos utensilios para freír las papas  y no tiene el suficiente capital además por la temporada ella pone otra venta en el parque, Espera que Fape le pueda apoyar con lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Duo Lirio de los Balles: This duo includes 38-year-old Alba Leticia, who has one son and is the leader of the group. For the past nine years, she has been selling fruit smoothies in the morning and french fries in the afternoon. 

She mentions that she needs the loan to buy a cooler since the one she has is already somewhat damaged.  She also wants to buy some utensils to fry the potatoes and she does not have enough money. Also, due to the season she is putting another small shop in the park. 

She hopes that Fape can help her with what she needs.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and buy utensils needed to make fried foods

loans.name: Ana Olaya

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 55 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 3 hijos, dos  mayores de edad y el menor de 16 años, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y también un pequeño nieto.
Doña Ana es una muy buena madre que le gusta trabajar para así darle lo mejor a sus hijos y mucho mas después de la muerte de su marido, ella tiene un taller de ebanistería que era de su marido pero desde la muerte de él ella tuvo que contratar a una persona que es la encargada de elaborar las obras, allí elaboran puertas, camas y muebles de toda clase y modelos, trabaja a base de pedidos de clientes particulares. Así ella se gana lo suyo lo cual le permite salir adelante junto a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar madera y otros materiales para elaborar los muebles. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the 24 De Mayo canton, Manabí province, known for its lovely landscape, for its forests, variety of fauna and for its friendly and hard-working people who work in agriculture and animal husbandry, the Madre Para un Futuro Mejor communal bank group meets every two weeks. 

Ana lives in this place. She is 55 years old and some years ago her husband died, and she became a widow, but from this relationship they had three children, two who are adults and the younger is 16. Two of them still live in her house and also a little grandson. 

Ana is a very good mother who likes to work in order to give her children the best and much more after the death of her husband. She has a woodworking shop that was her husband's, but since his death, she had to hire a person who is in charge of making the items. There, they make doors, beds, and all kinds and models of furniture. They work based on specific customer orders. In this way, she earns her own money which allows her to get ahead with her children.

This loan will be used to purchase wood and other material to make furniture. She has been a part of the communal bank group from the beginning and she likes it because, with the loans, she can get ahead. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Banco Mujer De Paraiso Group

texts.es: Nelly es madre soltera de una joven de 15 años de edad, ambas están en secundaria y se encuentran cursando el tercer nivel de colegio. Por este motivo Nelly decide dedicarse a una actividad que le genere ingresos al hogar, debido a su experiencia y conocimiento decide iniciar con la cría de cerdos, los cuales ha logrado mantener gracias a la colaboración de su hija. Necesita este crédito para comprar más cerdos, de esta manera generar ganancias y continuar financiando el estudio de ella y su hija, las cuales anhelan un titulo de bachillerato para poder trabajar en lo que sueña cada una. Debido a la zona donde viven actualmente no existen fuentes de empleo para subsidiar los gastos básicos, por ese motivo esta con su propia actividad productiva la cual le ha funcionado muy bien. En un futuro Nelly sueña con que su hija sea una profesional universitaria y ella haberse graduado de secundaria, con el fin de seguir con la cría de cerdos hasta obtener una una porqueriza adecuada para varios cerdos y construir un bio digestor que genere gas a la comunidad donde ella vive.
texts.en: Nelly is a single mother of a 15-year-old.  They both go to high school and are in their third year.  That's why Nelly decided to work to make income for the household.  Based on her knowledge and experience, she decided to start raising pigs. She's been able to maintain the pigs thanks to her daughter's contribution.  Nelly needs this loan to buy more pigs so she can bring in more profit and continue supporting her daughter's and her own education.  They both dream of getting a degree so each can work in whatever job she wishes.  Where they live there aren't too many jobs to pay for basic expenses, which is why Nelly has her own business, and it's been working well.  In the future Nelly dreams of her daughter being a university-educated professional and she herself graduating high school. Her goal is to continue to raise pigs until she can get a pen sufficient for multiple pigs and build a bio digestor to provide gas for the community where she lives.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed concentrate.

loans.name: Sayra Lily

texts.es:
La joven Sayra de 24  años de edad, vive con su mama y su papa  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende  frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo, manteca, espaguetis, salsas,  etc.
Sayra vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Sayra está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  como pollo, arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, jabón, frescos, huevos, papel higiénico, café, pan, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Diciembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sayra, 24, lives with her parents in their own home.  She has had a grocery store for two years.  She sells soft drinks, fritters, frijoles, dairy products, soap, chicken, butter, pasta, sauces, etc.  

She lives in an area in south of Honduras.  She is an enterprising woman who has a desire to succeed.  She works hard every day to improve her standard of living.  

She is asking for a loan to buy general products to stock her store such as chicken, rice, frijoles, flour, butter, soap, soft drinks, eggs, toilet paper, coffee, bread, etc.  She hopes that his loan will allow her to generate a better income and give her a better quality of life.  

She is a new client who is looking forward to working with Prisma.  She dreams of having a successful business which is well stocked, and at the same time making a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy inventroy like chicken, rice, beans, flour, butter, soap, eggs, toilet paper etc for the grocery store

loans.name: Banco Mujer De Paraiso Group

texts.es: Katherine tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, ella estudia Administración Pública en la Universidad, debido a la falta de empleo en la zona donde vive y la poca oportunidad de superación profesional que existe, ella decide iniciar con la cría de cerdos, ya que anteriormente ahorro para comprarse una vaca que ya produce leche. Ahora su hermano le recomienda iniciar con cerdos que también proveen ganancia para que ella logre ayudarse a pagar sus estudios universitarios, con éste préstamo ella va a comprar cerdos y concentrado para la alimenación de los mismos. Katherine sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria y lograr trabajar en alguna institución que le genere un salario mensual para sufragar sus gastos y apoyar la economía de su familia, y también  continuar con la actividad de porcicultura que genera dinero cada seis meses. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Katherine is 23 years old and single. She is studying Public Administration at the university.

Because of the lack of employment in the area where she lives and given that there are limited opportunities for professional growth, she has decided to start raising pigs. Previously, she set aside money to buy a dairy cow. Now, her brother has suggested her to start raising pigs—an occupation that also generates profits—to be able to pay for her university education. She will use the loan proceeds to buy pigs and concentrated food for them to eat. 

Katherine's dream is to finish her degree and be able to work at an institution that pays her a monthly salary so that she can cover her expenses and support her family. She also would like to keep on raising pigs, an occupation that generates income every six months.

She chose Fundación Mujer for the low interest rate they offer.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Kuljamila

texts.ru: Кулжамила успешно погасила свой кредит и обратилась за повторным. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Кулжамилы есть 3 коровы, 1 теленок и 16 овец. Также она занимается полеводством, выращивая картофель и фасоль. Ее прибыль от продажи молока составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь семьи Кулжамилы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулжамила обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60 000 сом(KGS) на покупку 6 овец.  Она является участником группы "Келечек-Н", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Кулжамила планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kuljamila successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a second loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to all those who helped her finance her loan. Kuljamila has 3 cows, 1 calf and 16 sheep on her farm. She also practices crop farming - she grows potatoes and beans. Her monthly income from the sale of milk is 8,000 som (KGS). This amount is not enough for a decent quality of life for Kuljamila's family. For the further development of her farm, Kuljamila turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 60,000 som (KGS) to buy 6 sheep. She is a member of the lending group "Kelechek-N," which is made up of two other members. Kuljamila plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy six sheep for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Las mujeres son el motor económico de muchas familias en todo el mundo y un pilar fundamental del desarrollo. Las mujeres trabajadoras impulsan el desarrollo, luchan por su futuro y el de sus familias, de las que en muchos casos son el motor económico. Este ha sido el caso de Rosa quien se dedica a la venta de refresco y prendas, del cual se ha esforzado todo este tiempo. Rosa se siente agradecida por la facilidad del primer préstamo que se le fue brindado el cual lo ocupo para una compra masiva de sus productos como azúcar y materia prima.
Rosa solicita un nuevo crédito para aprovechar esta temporada y comprar bolsas, frutas, azúcar, entre otros productos que le ayudaran a generar una mayor ganancia a su negocio y de esa manera tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le favorecerá a ella y a su familia. Rosa tienes muchos planes a futuros así como seguir trabajando para mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Women are the economic engine in many families around the globe, they are a fundamental pillar for growth. Working women promote development, they strive for their future and that of their family.

Such is the case with Rosa, who earns a living selling refreshments and clothing. She has struggled all this time to give her children a better quality of life.

Rosa is grateful for the first loan she received, which she used for the bulk purchase of supplies such as sugar and basic ingredients.

She is requesting a new loan to make the most of this season and purchase plastic bags, fruit, and sugar, among other products to help her business generate more profits and achieve in this way better economic stability.

Rosa trusts that this loan will assist her and her family. She has many plans for the future such as to continue working so she can improve the quality of life of herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, fruit, and sugar among other items.

loans.name: Janeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Si de progreso se habla, Janeth es una ejemplo a seguir, ya que en tan solo cuatro años que lleva como comerciante, ya tiene una tienda completa establecida, la cual inició vendiendo productos de belleza a sus amigas con esfuerzo propio y con el apoyo de su hijo mayor. Ahora a sus 34 años de edad, vende carteras, camisas, pantalones, entre otros productos, que ayudan junto con su esposo a sustentar su hogar y a sus dos hijos de 9 y 14 años de edad.
Janeth es una joven apasionada por las ventas, con muchas metas por cumplir. Ella planea llegar a tener una tienda de electrodomésticos que cubran la demanda de sus clientes. Sin embargo, primero quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar pantalones, cremas para la piel, vestidos, carteras, maquillaje, entre otros productos. Esto le permitirá obtener mejores productos para vender, lo que dará paso a un aumento en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Janeth is an excellent example of "progress" . In the only four years that she has been a businesswoman, she already has established a complete store, which she began by selling beauty products to her friends with her own efforts and with the support of an older brother. Now 34 years old, she sells wallets, shirts, and pants, among other products, which help, along with her husband, to sustain their household and their two children, ages 9 and 14.

Janeth is a young woman who is passionate about sales, with many goals to meet. She plants to have a household appliance store which would meet the customers' demand. However, first she wants to continue investing in her business, so she asks for a loan to purchase pants, skin creams, dresses, wallets, and makeup among other products. This will allow her to get more products to sell, which will be a step toward an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skin cream, dresses, wallets, makeup among other products.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina started her Pilates studio, The Reformation Station, in December of 2013 in the Lincoln Heights neighborhood of Los Angeles. She lived in Lincoln Heights for about four years before opening her studio and during that time she grew to love the people and energy in the community. There were no Pilates or yoga studios in the area and she saw so many people who could benefit from it, so she had the idea to bring Pilates to the neighborhood. Through teaching Pilates, Christina witnessed the power that movement and exercise can have on a person's life. Whether it is helping someone rebuild strength and mobility after an injury or training a client to help improve their overall fitness, it is very rewarding to help them reach their goals. Christina’s hope is to share this with her community. The most popular services in the studio are private sessions and the Reform School reformer classes. With a Kiva loan, she will be able to purchase additional reformers to make more room in the classes that are quickly filling up. Her hope for the business is to make Pilates accessible for members of the Lincoln Heights community that may not otherwise be able to take a class. She plans to offer Pilates en Espanol for the Spanish speaking members of the community and teach classes out in the neighborhood to get people excited about Pilates and exercise in general.

loans.use: to make tenant Improvements to her studio (wall, door and fabrication of studio sign)

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein, 42 years old, is from Baniswef. He is married and has four children who attend elementary school. Six years ago, Hussein requested a loan from TADE to start his grocery store project. He then requested two more loans to expand his small project and successfully repaid all of them on their due dates. The sky is not the limit for Hussein as he has requested a 12,000 EGP loan to buy more products such as oil, rice, and pasta to expand his business and meet his customers' increasing demands.

loans.use: to buy more products such as oil, rice, and pasta to expand his business and meet his customers' increasing demands.

loans.name: Hamada Group

texts.en:
Lina, 24 years old, is the responsible representative of the Hamada group, which consists of five women who applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB. Lina is married and a mother of three children. She lives with her husband and children in Taiz, Yemen, in a small house which consists of only one room, a kitchen, and a small bath. 

The family is extremely poor. Lina's husband works for a daily wage which is not enough to cover his children's necessary expenses. Lina decided to take a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to make an extra room for her children. Lina hopes to open a savings account in the bank to help her make a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to make an extra room for her children.

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Salisu would have had to sell his maize for lower prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

However, with this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for prices that are up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Salisu expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is an accountant for a private company and she also rents crockery for parties and other celebrations Janeth needs a loan to renew the crockery she rents. Janeth is married and she has 2 children. She pays rent and she hopes she will have her own house one day. Right now she needs your help and she hopes you can help her. Janeth lives at El Alto and works in the cities of La Paz and El Alto

loans.use: to renew crockery for her crockery rental business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas son mujeres que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de poder ayudarse y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a ser peluquera, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre va hasta su negocio y es por ello que le está yendo muy buen.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos de bellezas como cremas, labiales, sombras, etc., de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con ello ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group has 17 members. They're women who have united in order to improve the condition of their lives. They're conducting a survey about the elimination of poverty, as a means to be able to help themselves and help their families. 

One of the members is Maria, whose survey shows a level of poverty around level one, which is extreme poverty. She makes a living as hair dresser, and she has a very good clientele base who always comes to her store, and it's because of them that she does well. 

She asks for this loan in order to buy beauty products such as creams, lipsticks, eye shadows, etc, in order to continue giving a good service to her clients and to improve the condition of their lives.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, eye shadows, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge is 22 years old. He is single and he lives at his parents house. Jorge is security guard and he is studying to be a cook so he needs a loan to buy a laptop and to pay the tuition. Jorge wants to be a good chef and take care of his parents.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and to pay school tuition

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia Rita  se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rita continues to manage her business of raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. As a result of her work, she was able to open a grocery store since her dream is to have this type of business. Rita also wants to have a larger place where she can sell her animals.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed for the animals. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: This is 28 year-old Mabinty.  She is married and has 4 children aged 10, 9, 6 and 2. In 2008, Mabinty established her fuel and pots business. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women and children. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1500000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5000000. She requires a loan in order to buy 50 bags of coal and 7 pairs of pots for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her business to grow and increase the number of customers. In the future she plans to add another type of business to the present ones.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coal and some pots for resale

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Scanergize (the “Company”) was established on October, 2014 in the state of California. The company will include document imaging   primarily focused on two specific industries; Healthcare and Legal. Each of these industries uses an enormous amount of paper to store their client files. Karen actually worked with her brother in the same business in the Washington DC area and then decided to start a similar company to go after the LA market. After successfully starting the same business three years ago in the Washington DC area, this was the key moment that led to starting her own business. Karen is passionate about Document Imaging because she loves to help businesses become more efficient and she does things to help the environment. 

Karen’s biggest challenge was talking to hundreds of companies and learning what customers really wanted.  Then she had to learn how to scale the service so she could deliver that service at an affordable price but still maintain high quality. With the Kiva funding, Karen intends to use the loan mostly for equipment and materials. Her first year goal is to get 12 customers and create a strong reference base to go after the medical community, which is still mostly paper based.

Thank you so much for supporting Scanergize.

loans.use: to buy the required software and equipment

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Don Ivan es padre de familia, el junto con su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos de primera necesidad, el negocio que tienen es muy pequeño y ha sufrido muchos problemas por el clima y el tiempo, es por ello que solicitan un préstamo de un millón cien mil colones (1.100.000) para poder remodelar y comprar mas inventario para su negocio. Con esta inversión ellos podrán ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientes y así tener un mejor futuro y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Ivan is a father. He and his wife have a small business where they sell basic necessity foods. The business is very small and has encountered many problems due to weather and age. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,100,000 CRC so that he can remodel his business and buy more inventory.

With this investment Ivan hopes to provide better service to his customers, have a better future, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to remodel his store and to buy inventory.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en: Fanny is an experienced cook. She needs a loan to renew her crockery because she rents crockery if you have a party or other celebration event. Fanny has two kids but she is a divorced woman She lives at their parents house and she hopes she can have her own place one day so she expects you can help her

loans.use: to renew crockery

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is 29 years old. He lives at his parents house. Juan is an employee of a private company. He works long hours. He wants to help with his parents house so he needs a loan to install a bathroom at their house. Juan hopes he will have his own company some day. Right now he needs your help to improve the life quality of his family. Juan appears in the picture at the room where the bathroom will be installed.

loans.use: to install a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of home appliances for his house.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:
Guadalupe is 55 years old, married, and a mother of two. She lives in a house she owns and makes a living by selling seasonal merchandise and has an additional source of income by babysitting children. Her husband is a tianguis (street market) leader and her son also works to be able to contribute to the family expenditures.
She sells seasonal merchandise, such as: Christmas, Valentine’s Day and the Day of the Dead; a Mexican tradition. She asks for this loan to stock up her business, and also to end some construction at her house. 
With the effort Guadalupe puts into her work she aspires to be able to establish formally her business and have a premise for it.

loans.use: to stock up her seasonal merchandise business and to end some constructions at her house

loans.name: He Muong 10 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh, 34, has been married and she became the mother of two girls and a boy, whose ages are 13, 11, and 9 years old, respectively. She lives with her husband and her children, along with her in-laws and she works at agricultural production. 

Indeed, Minh supports the family by cultivating rice, corn, cassava, and by raising pigs and chickens. Minh is a hard-working farmer who has constantly increased production. 

To deal with the difficulty of a lack of capital, Minh has taken out a loan from the Entrepreneurs du Monde - Anh Chi Em Program and she will use it to buy piglets and food for the pigs. 

This is the second time she has received a loan from the Program and she believes that, with the support of the socio-economic team of the Program, as well as her experience in animal husbandry accumulated since she was very young, her investment will go well. 

Minh dreams her children will have a brighter future than hers and that they will escape from poverty. 

In the picture of He Muong 10 Group, Minh stands in the first row, the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a single man. He lives at his mother's house and he has a sister. The family live in Umapusa, the house has electricity and sewerage. Victor has 2 cows and he sells milk to the community. His mother helps him with this activity. Victor is a mason too. Victor needs a loan to buy a milking cow that will help him to sell more milk. In the future Victor hopes he can have his own building company.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Central La Cuchilla Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Mujeres Central La Cuchilla” has just finished paying back their first loan funded by KIVA investors. With the financial support of the group loan, the seven women of the Trust Bank were able to invest in capital for their various business, which include the sale of flowers and vegetables, items for daily consumption, and agriculture. Due to their success and motivation for continued business and personal growth, all seven of the members of the Trust Bank have requested another loan with Friendship Bridge. 
In the first loan cycle we told the story of Maria, a 26-year-old member of the Trust Bank, who had plans to join her brother in the expansion of their small store, investing in an inventory of kitchen items, clothing, and toys. While Maria was successful in repaying her loan with the income from the business shared with her brother, she is now requesting a new loan to establish her own business. Maria plans to start a business buying wholesale vegetables (onions, radishes, beans, etc.) from regional farmers and selling them for a profit in local markets. Maria believes that her new produce venture will give her independence and experience as a business owner. As she builds knowledge from experience and the monthly educational training from her Friendship Bridge loan officer delivered in Maria’s native language of Kaqchikel, on topics including business administration, over-indebtedness and women’s rights, she hopes to continue expanding her business and its profitability. Maria’s goal is to build enough knowledge and capital to open a shoe store, an investment that will guarantee a steadier income. With the support of KIVA investors, Maria will be given the opportunity to become more independent and self-determining.
Thank you, KIVA lenders, for your continued support of Maria and the Trust Bank “Las Mujeres Central La Cuchilla.” With the loans provided by KIVA, Maria and her Trust Bank have the opportunity to determine their own futures and the futures of their families and community.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables (onions, radishes, beans, etc.) from regional farmers and sell them for a profit in local markets.

loans.name: Conavi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Conavi está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lizza, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de zapatillas bordadas, comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que sus zapatillas son muy pedidas, ya que tiene muy buen trabajo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de zapatillas, lentejuelas, hilos, pinzas y otros, para poder usarlo en el bordado de zapatillas, que le será muy útil para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group Conavi is in their second cycle in the women's committee program. They are a part of the program to eliminate poverty, which allows them to know each other's situations while at the same time improving them. 

One of the members is Lizza, who makes and sells embroidered shoes. She says that she has great sales, since her shoes are ordered frequently, so she has a great job. She is a very hardworking and determined person who makes a lot of effort to move forward.

She requests this loan to invest it in the purchase of shoes, sequins, threads, clothespins, etc, in order to use them to embroider shoes, which will be very useful to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sequins, threads, clothespins, etc, in order to use them to embroider shoes.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine's Group is comprised of 11 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Catherine, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. Catherine has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Catherine isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has noticed that her life has changed because of more profits. This year, Catherine will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Catherine's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Her name is Rosalie, 42 years old from Bacoor, Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Windsor, a driver and has one child who is still in the Elementary Level in school. She works hard to augment their income to meet her family's everyday needs. 

Rosalie runs a school and office supply store for a number of years already. A school and office supplies store is where one can buy school supplies, like pen, bond, photo paper, art paper, and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from her store she also has photocopying services to serve students' school requirements at their area. She also has an E-load service.Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 700 in sales everyday.

To improve her profit, Rosalie is requesting for a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to pay for school and office supplies such as pads, photo and bond paper, ink, notebooks and other supplies to sell at her store. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial aid that will be given her for it will surely help cover her family's household, personal needs and school needs of her child.

Rosalie hopes to sustain and grow her businesses to improve her living condition. She desires to give her child the best education until the college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for school and office supplies such bond and photo paper, notebooks, pad paper, pencils to sell.

loans.name: Familia R Group

texts.es:
Doña Margarita y Don Pedro están casados desde hace 36 años, tienen 11 hijos aunque actualmente ya sólo uno depende de ellos. La pareja vive en una comunidad muy tranquila donde aún conservan sus costumbres y su lengua materna. Los habitantes se sienten muy orgullosos de pertenecer a una cultura con tanta historia aunque saben que poco a poco, con el tiempo, algunas tradiciones se van desvaneciendo así que en la medida de lo posible, en casa o con sus vecinos, tratan de seguir realizando las fiestas más importantes.
 
Margarita o Doña Mago, como le dicen de cariño, tiene 54 años de edad. Durante 30 años se ha dedicado a la crianza de becerros, por el momento tiene dos en casa, pero está a punto de venderlos es por eso que necesita un préstamo para invertir en dos animales más. Espera que las ganancias sean suficientes para solventar los gastos de reparación de su vivienda. 

Don Pedro también ayuda en el cuidado de los animales, aunque él siempre se ha dedicado al campo cultivando maíz y más adelante nopales que vendía de casa en casa, en mercados y en pequeños tianguis de su comunidad. Actualmente también se dedica a vender dulces y bebidas en un campo deportivo pero sin dejar de brindar apoyo a Mago. 

Doña Mago y Don Pedro mencionan que cuando hay ganas y entusiasmo para salir adelante, todo se puede lograr. En su caso, se levantan desde temprano para cuidar a los animales y más tarde, dedica un poco de tiempo en el negocio de los nopales. 

"Estoy muy agradecida con VisionFund porque llevo ya muchos ciclos solicitando préstamo y nos ayudaron a mantener las actividades para sacar adelante a mis otros hijos" comentó Doña Mago. Doña Mago sigue soñando con tener más animales para lo cual esperan contar con el apoyo de VisionFund y obtener un préstamo de mayor monto en el futuro. 

Margarita M. también es integrante del grupo, es nuera de la pareja y desempeña la misma actividad. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la comunidad donde viven los integrantes. Doña Mago viste un chaleco verde y detrás de ellos se pueden ver algunos de los animales que crían.
texts.en:
Margarita and Pedro have been married for 36 years.  They have 11 children, although only one of them is dependent on them now.  The couple lives in a very peaceful community where they preserve their customs and their native language.  The residents are very proud to belong to a culture with so much history, although they know that little by little, in time, some traditions are fading, so they try to keep on holding the most important celebrations to the extent they can, at home or with their neighbors.

Margarita, or Mago as she's known affectionately, is 54 years old.  For 30 years she has worked raising calves.  She has two at home at the moment, but she's about to sell them.  That's why she needs a loan to invest in two more animals.  She hopes she earns enough profit to pay for the expenses of making repairs at her home.

Pedro also helps take care of the animals, although he has always worked in the field growing corn and, later, nopales that he sold door-to-door, in markets, and in small fairs in his community.  Currently he also sells sweets and beverages at an athletic field, but without neglecting to help Mago.

Mago and Pedro mentioned that one can achieve anything if there's a desire and enthusiasm.  In his case, he gets up very early to take care of the animals and later devotes a little time to the nopal business.

"I'm very grateful to VisionFund because I've been requesting loans for a lot of loan cycles now, and they helped up keep our jobs and get my other children ahead," said Mago.  Mago still dreams of having more animals, for which she hopes to have the VisionFund's support and get a loan for a bigger amount in the future.

Margarita M. is also a member of the group.  She's the couple's daughter-in-law and she works at the same job.

*The photograph was taken in the community where the members live.  Mago's wearing a green vest, and some of the animals they raise can be seen behind her.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Juliana's Group

texts.en:
Juliana's Group has 10 farmers in the Matete District. Juliana is the 30-year-old group leader. She is married and has 4 children. Juliana has been a farmer for 16 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Juliana isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Juliana will purchase fertilizer, seeds and a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Juliana's Group will purchase a total of 2 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nofal

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Nofal, one of the Ruma agents who lives in East Serang, Indonesia - a suburban city located about 3 hours drive from Jakarta. Nofal is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with 2 children. In order to support his family, Nofal runs a small shop that sells not only kids toys and mobile phone airtime credits, but also facilitates utility bill payments. Nofal started the mobile phone airtime business about 2 years ago after he was introduced to Ruma by Ruma field staff. He was excited to start selling mobile phone airtime because he wanted to increase his income to be able to save for his children's education. Nofal would like to acquire a working capital loan from Ruma and Kiva lenders in order to process more transactions. He is a hardworking and humble man. He performs well and has become a trusted seller and service provider in his community. In the photo above, Nofal is carrying his son. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: María Mónica

texts.en:
María Mónica is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:
María is 46 years old, has been in a common law relationship for 10 years now, and is mother of a 14 year-old boy who studies in middle school. She lives in her mother’s house and makes a living by selling therapeutical soap and shampoo, which are fabricated by her, and cookies in a market nearby her house.
She started this business after a severe health problem she had, related with facial paralysis; this situation convinced her to study herb science and she met some people who taught her the process of fabricating these soaps and shampoos. 
María asks for this loan to stock up her business, increase her sales and income, and elevate her standard of living.

loans.use: to stock up her therapeutical soaps and shampoo business.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann and her husband, Michael, have the theater in their veins. Both have an extensive background working in the theater: her husband with a background in acting and Joann with a background in set building and artistic design. In 2013, they were traveling back and forth from Los Angeles to attend an indie horror film festival, and they saw a gap in their hometown market. It was then they had the idea to start a new festival during Halloween in San Diego the next year. The festival would give a unique opportunity for indie film makers to showcase their work in San Diego. 

Dubbed the FANtasic Horror Film Festival, the 2014 event featured more than 34 films over three days, including a kick-off party in downtown San Diego. The festival provided the opportunity for film makers and horror fans to mix and mingle and discuss the horror film industry while enjoying films from all over the world. 

Joann and her husband faced some challenges the first year selling tickets and spreading the word about the event, and they are determined to make 2015 even better! The first year was a learning experience for them and they have new ideas about how to build on the event. Joanna says they will use this Kiva loan to pay the fees associated with the event venue. 

“We love the opportunity to empower independent film makers,” Joann says. “Our goal for next year is to increase ticket sales for the movie showings so we can expose more people to the films we are so passionate about.”

loans.use: to pay for fees associated with the event venue for their film festival.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis, 48 years old, is originally from Ecuador. Luis is a professional instructor in Olympic gymnastics. He was champion in Ecuador for two years in a row and vice-champion in Colombia. He studied his master's in Cuba. In 1996, he moved to the States. Since then, he has been working at a private gym. Now he is opening his own gym and needs $3,250 to purchase equipment. This equipment will allow him to have his business operating.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his gym

loans.name: Bayartsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayartsetseg, who is 49 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a laboratory technician at a power plant for twenty-five years. Her husband provides taxi services to local people. Their children both go to secondary school.

Last year Mrs. Bayartsetseg began to run a retail store, and in a short amount of time, she succeeded in attracting a large number of customers. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy cups, key chains, souvenirs, and other items, which will be sought after greatly during the upcoming national holiday. Since opening this store, her family's living standard has been improving, and she says that if her business goes very well, she will hire a cashier.

loans.use: to buy cups, key chains, and other items

loans.name: Tzutujil Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tzutujil” have just finished paying off their first loan from KIVA investors that they received in May of 2014. The success of the seven members of “Tzutujil” in their first loan cycle has inspired them to apply for another loan with Friendship Bridge. With this loan the women of “Tzutujil” will continue to take advantage of the increased tourism in their picturesque home of San Juan La Laguna bordering the beautiful Lake Atitlan. The complex and bright, traditional Maya “Tzutujil” weavings that are hand-crafted and sold locally by the women of the Trust Bank, compliment the boundless natural beauty of the lakeshore.  
Martha, a spirited woman with five children, is one of the artisans and members of the Trust Bank “Tzutujil.” Martha plans to use her loan to buy thread and the materials used for natural dyeing for her textile business. In San Juan La Laguna, dried and ground achiote seeds or annatto, tree bark, charcoal and pomegranates, are all components of unique natural dye extraction techniques. With the loan, Martha will be able to apply her knowledge of natural dye extraction and textile weaving to create and sell beautiful woven fabrics. Martha, who has three years of business experience, is determined to use this loan to improve her quality of life and level of self-esteem.  Martha has goals to grow her business and production capacity, hoping that her loan will provide her with enough materials in order to meet the demand throughout the next ten months. Martha’s confidence and positive outlook is indicative of the Trust Bank’s determination to improve their quality of life. 
KIVA lenders by continuing their support of Martha, and the rest of the Trust Bank “Tzutujil” are contributing to the development of San Juan La Laguna through the empowerment of women entrepreneurs. Thank you, KIVA lenders for believing in the women of “Tzutujil” and supporting them as they expand their business and improve the futures of their families and community.

loans.use: to buy thread and the materials used for natural dyeing for her textile business.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
La señora Silvina, es una persona muy trabajadora, que gracias al esfuerzo que hace ha ido mejorando mucho en su emprendimiento que hace. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido muy útil para la utilización en su negocio para poder mejorar.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de sabanas, colchas, frazadas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Mrs. Silvina es a very hardworking person, which, thanks to her effort, has been improving her business a lot. She says that her previous loan has been very useful in improving her store. She asks for this loan to buy sheets, quilts, blankets, etc, in order to continue with her sales like she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy millet, peanuts and beans to resell
